Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

JOB DESCRIPTION

Entra nel nostro mondo.

Trasforma insieme a noi.

¬†

Nati nel 2003, abbiamo raccolto e valorizzato l‚Äôesperienza storica della consulenza e abbiamo aggiunto due ingredienti chiave: l‚Äôinnovazione e la digitalizzazione.

Grazie a questo percorso siamo oggi oltre 5000 professionisti e professioniste, presenti in 13 Paesi, con oltre 4500 progetti alle spalle e le conoscenze pi√π all‚Äôavanguardia nell'ambito della Digital Transformation, Data Science, Cybersecurity, Industry 4.0, IOT e di tutte le Disruptive Technologies che mettiamo a servizio di ogni settore di mercato.

Aiutiamo i nostri clienti a fare la differenza creando qualit√† su larga scala attraverso una formula che opera su tre leve: Valore, Persone e Tecnologia.

Crediamo nel valore dell‚Äôeccellenza, che √® la bussola su cui orientiamo il nostro agire, e adottiamo un approccio etico e leale nei confronti di quante e quanti scelgono di lavorare con noi, promuovendo un ambiente in cui le persone possano crescere insieme, grazie alla contaminazione tra competenze diverse.

Data Analyst

Quale sar√† la tua sfida?

Entra a far parte di BIP xTech, il Centro di Eccellenza di BIP specializzato in consulenza¬†e servizi innovativi in ambito Data Analytics, Big Data, Data Science, RPA, Cloud, Blockchain e Networking.

In particolare, verrai considerato per far parte di DANA, il Competence Team di xTech che accoglie i nostri consulenti Data Analyst ‚Äì figure professionali che combinano competenze informatiche e statistiche con l‚Äôinteresse per il business e i processi operativi dei nostri clienti. Il team segue progetti di lungo, medio e breve termine, con attivit√† quali:


Estrazione, pulizia, modellazione e analisi dati, con strumenti tipici del settore (quali MS Excel, SQL, SAS e Python);
Costruzione di modelli analitici e di reportistica interattiva con MS Excel;
Automazione di processi operativi tramite modelli MS Excel avanzati, macro VBA, ed eventuali altre tecnologie a supporto;
Supporto all‚Äôoperativit√† dei clienti nell‚Äôesecuzione dei processi, utilizzando le proprie competenze tecniche specifiche per individuare ed implementare soluzioni di efficientamento, anche in collaborazione con colleghi xTech con altre specializzazioni;
Analisi funzionali in ambito dati e IT;
Project management in ambito dati e IT.


Le posizioni aperte riguardano profili sia junior che senior.

Ti sar√† richiesto, in modo commisurato alla tua seniority, di dimostrare ed evolvere le capacit√† di costruire relazioni con clienti, vendor e partner, promuovendo il raggiungimento degli obbiettivi aziendali.

Sarai tu a entrare nel nostro team?

Core Skills:


Laurea Specialistica in Ingegneria Gestionale, Ingegneria Informatica, Ingegneria Matematica, Ingegneria delle Telecomunicazioni, Informatica, Statistica, Marketing, Economia, Management, Scienze Politiche o altre discipline con metodi quantitativi
Ottima competenza con MS Excel, pivot e formule
Ottima competenza con il linguaggio SQL
Buona conoscenza di concetti di RDBMS
Buona conoscenza di almeno un linguaggio di programmazione
Buone competenze statistiche
Conoscenza fluente di italiano e inglese


Plus:


Ottima competenza con il linguaggio VBA
Buona competenza con la suite SAS (Base/Guide/Viya)
Buona competenza con MS Access
Buona competenza con il linguaggio Python
Buona conoscenza delle principali tecnologie Cloud (AWS, GCP, Azure) e dei relativi servizi in ambito dati
Conoscenza di tecnologie di Business Intelligence (Power BI, Qlik Sense, Tableau)
Conoscenza base di tecnologie di Robotic Process Automation
Conoscenza base di tecnologie di Process Mining
Conoscenza base di tecnologie CRM (es. Salesforce)
Conoscenza base di tecnologie ERP (es. SAP)
Conoscenza di altri linguaggi di programmazione


Soft Skills:


Standing consulenziale
Ottime doti relazionali e comunicative
Orientamento al cliente e al raggiungimento degli obiettivi
Buona attitudine e flessibilit√† a lavorare sia in team sia in autonomia
Precisione e stress tolerance nel rispetto delle scadenze
Disponibilit√† per trasferte in Italia e all‚Äôestero


¬†

Perch√® Bip?

People at the center of our culture

Fiducia e collaborazione, imprenditorialit√† e coraggio, meritocrazia e sviluppo guidano la crescita delle nostre persone.

Lavorare in BIP √® un'esperienza sfidante, in cui il merito paga e l'innovazione avviene attraverso idee coraggiose, collaborazione e un rapporto di fiducia con i nostri clienti.¬†

Challenging yourself

Avrai la possibilit√† di metterti alla prova in contesti progettuali diversi in termini di ambito, natura delle attivit√† e stakeholders coinvolti. Vedrai valorizzato il tuo spirito di iniziativa, la tua passione, l‚Äôautonomia e la capacit√† di assumerti responsabilit√† e metterti in gioco.

Unlocking your potential

Potrai partecipare a + di 300 corsi formativi all‚Äôavanguardia per accrescere le tue competenze su tecnologie e temi di business emergenti.

Work-life Integration

Troverai una policy che supporta¬†lo smartworking¬†fino al 100% del proprio tempo e favorisce il work-life integration.

Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

Valorizziamo l‚Äôunicit√† e ci impegniamo a garantire che tutti abbiano pari opportunit√† di dare un contributo ed esprimere al massimo il potenziale nell'ambiente di lavoro.

Il nostro approccio alla diversit√† e all‚Äôinclusione si fonda sui principi di etica e integrit√† e rappresenta il fattore determinante per lo sviluppo di orizzonti, di crescita personale e aziendale, pi√π ampi.

Promuoviamo l‚Äôinserimento e l‚Äôintegrazione lavorativa delle persone appartenenti alle categorie protette ‚Äì in base a quanto disciplinato dalla legge 68/99 ‚Äì.

Next Steps

Una volta ricevuto il tuo cv ci prenderemo del tempo per valutarlo attentamente.

Se c‚Äô√® un match con questa o con altre posizioni aperte all‚Äôinterno del Gruppo, ti contatteremo per iniziare la nostra conoscenza reciproca.

L‚Äôiter di selezione comprende generalmente un colloquio con HR, un colloquio tecnico con un line manager ed un eventuale colloquio con un Partner.

L‚Äôordine e il numero delle interviste potrebbero variare a seconda delle esigenze di recruiting.

In alternativa, saremo felici di conservare il tuo CV nel nostro database
per poterlo rivalutare per altre opportunit√† future.

Se dovessi identificare ulteriori posizioni di tuo interesse ed in linea con il tuo profilo, aspettiamo la tua candidatura per poterla valutare nuovamente.

Title: Data Analyst - Milano
Description:
Descrizione azienda

realizzando report su misura;

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Skill Farm Members are invited to apply for the following role:

Responsibilities:

Business trend analysis: Constant monitoring of market trends and company performance to identify growth opportunities and potential threats.

Support in defining the three-year strategic plan: Collaborate with the leadership team to develop and review the long-term strategic plan, ensuring alignment with company objectives.

Definition of tactical actions: Identify and propose tactical actions aimed at refining commercial strategies based on analyzes of business trends and corporate objectives.

Performance measurement and corrective actions: Monitor the performance of the commercial team, analyzing the results against the established objectives. Define and implement corrective actions to maximize performance and achieve set objectives

Presentations to top management: Preparation of key documents for top management, clearly illustrating business analyzes and strategic recommendations to support business decisions.

Skills & Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Economics, Statistics, Engineering Management or related field.

Previous experience in a strategic analyst role or similar roles, preferably with consultancy experience. Excellent analytical and problem solving skills

Organizational and planning skills, flexibility, entrepreneurial spirit, problem solving and teamwork

Knowledge of Excel data analysis tools, BI and presentation tools such as Power Point - Ability to communicate clearly and effectively, both verbally and in writing, with excellent knowledge of English.

Title: Data Quality Analyst
Description:
Data Quality Analyst (fixed-term contract)

sennder is Europe‚Äôs leading digital freight forwarder. In a traditional industry, we are moving fast to digitise and automate all road logistics processes. We are a growing team looking for a Data Quality Analyst to help us on our journey to revolutionise road freight logistics. You would join our ‚ÄúOperations Program & Innovation‚Äù department, based out of the Milan office and will report to the Team Lead Ops. Quality.

We value humility and we're as interested in your character as we are in your talent. Please apply, even if you feel you only meet part of our listed criteria. Diversity drives our innovation and we offer a collaborative, dynamic and international work environment. Just be yourself. We are excited to meet you and for you to join us in shaping the future of the logistics industry in Europe.

About The Role

As a Data Quality Analyst you‚Äôll work on interesting responsibilities like supporting the Operations Programs & Innovation department and specifically the Network Quality Team by analyzing and identifying logistic network inefficiencies, managing carriers delays and penalties.

IN THIS ROLE YOU WILL:


Ensure compliance with service quality KPIs by monitoring and supporting continuous performance improvement.
Work together with carriers to reduce the impact of low performances through bonus/malus mechanisms.
Analyze operational issues by identifying their root causes and proposing corrective actions through daily KPIs monitoring (e.g., on-time performance, incidents).
Build supplier performance reports in order to create presentations useful to management.
Support the definition of processes with the aim of identifying best practices and improving performance.
Work closely with Operations and Program Management teams to improve our quality metrics.
Develop and maintain relationships with key internal and external stakeholders.


PREFERABLY YOU HAVE:


Bachelor's degree in economics, statistics, engineering, or equivalent work experience.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in both Italian and English.
Proficiency in G-Suite and MS Office (Excel & PowerPoint); essential proficiency in SQL.
Strong analytical skills to conduct analyses and translate them into actionable insights.
Proactive, self-starter with excellent organizational skills.
Strong interpersonal skills and adaptive mindset with the ability to learn quickly.
Strong team player with a collaborative attitude.


ABOUT Sennder Italia

sennder Italia, based in the heart of Milan, is a joint venture company between sennder and Poste Italiane. Our company matches the digital and innovative focus on technologies and digitalization of sennder with the expertise and know-how of the largest distribution network in Italy, Poste Italiane.

We not only connect shippers to our fleet of thousands of trucks, but also improve how they move products in sustainable, cost-efficient, and transparent ways - making the logistics industry fit for the future. In a traditional industry, we‚Äôre growing and moving fast to digitally automate all road logistics processes.

We are building a curious team that is driven by an ambitious desire to solve the toughest logistics puzzles. What others may consider uncertainty, we see as an opportunity to learn and be proactive. We invite you to go on this journey with us and be part of one of Europe‚Äôs inspiring growth stories as we fast-forward road logistics into digitalization. Read more about the sennder Italia joint venture here.

What You Can Expect

At sennder, we want to maximize the individual‚Äôs potential for all employees and reinforce an inclusive culture and environment of continuous learning that empowers people to succeed as a team. In addition to humility, we value commitment, team spirit, respect, and kindness to build trusted relationships across teams. Learn more on our career site.


A fast-growing, start-up-oriented international team of 1000+ people with 65+ nationalities spread across 11 country offices with English as our company language.
A structured promotion process, providing everyone with fair and transparent career growth.
Learning and development opportunities on the job and through conversations with your manager.
Various opportunities to connect with colleagues, formally and informally, digitally or in-person (when allowed), through regular team events, company get-togethers, and partnership events with other companies and local organizers.
Office first work policy (three days a week), that complies with local COVID-19 restrictions and policies. We also provide flex/hybrid remote working options.
When in the office: unlimited snacks, drinks, and fruits.


Please send your application in English and help us reduce negative unconscious bias by leaving out your picture, age, address, and other unnecessary information in your CV. We only want to know the merits on which you‚Äôd be great for this role.

Title: Analista dati
HTML:
Per ampliamento del nostro organico interno sulla sede di Figino Serenza (CO), siamo alla ricerca di una figura di DATA ANALYST.

La risorsa operer√† nell‚Äôarea di miglioramento continuo con l‚Äôobiettivo di fornire l‚Äôinsieme aggregato dei dati a supporto dell‚Äôidentificazione e del monitoraggio di azioni di miglioramento finalizzate all‚Äôefficientamento dei processi nell‚Äôarea operations.


Nello specifico:

  • Elaborare report mensili ed analizzare i risultati delle performance e dei principali KPI, valutandone tendenze e scostamenti;
  • Supervisionare e collaborare nella definizione di eventuali report di controllo per migliorare la qualit√† dei dati e delle informazioni gestionali;
  • Garantire la correttezza dei dati produttivi;
  • Si interfaccia con la produzione e si occupa di reperire i dati attendibili in base ai quali strutturare le successive azioni di efficientamento e miglioramento dei processi produttivi;
  • Fornire i dati puntuali e corretti per garantire l‚Äôefficientamento del processo di analisi e reporting dell‚Äôarea produttiva;
  • Compila accuratamente le tabelle relative alle commesse, inserendo dati derivati dall‚Äôanalisi di costificazione effettuata;
  • Importa con precisione i suddetti dati nel gestionale impiegato (Gamma Enterprise);
  • Si occupa di rilevare eventuali discrepanze utili per ridurre le stesse tra la fase di costificazione a preventivo e la fase di costificazione a consuntivo.


Si richiede:

  • Ottima conoscenza del pacchetto Office, in particolare Excel e capacit√† di creare macro;
  • Preferibile conoscenza di Visual Basic e conoscenza di QlikView;
  • Conoscenza di sistemi ERP;
  • Conoscenza del flusso dati all'interno di una realt√† produttiva.


Contratto di lavoro: Tempo determinato con finalit√† assuntiva a tempo indeterminato

Orario di lavoro: 8.00-17.00

Title: Data Analyst Specialist
Description:
Smart Eventi √® alla ricerca di una nuova figura da inserire nel team,¬†che si occuper√† di analizzare e ottimizzare i diversi processi organizzativi e decisionali nei vari settori dell‚Äôazienda esperto in analisi e ottimizzazione dati per performance e budget management.

Il candidato seguir√† un percorso di formazione che lo porter√† ad essere in grado di analizzare le criticit√† aziendali per proporre, pianificare, sviluppare e monitorare le soluzioni necessarie al miglioramento dei processi interni all‚Äôazienda.

¬†

Attitudini personali richieste:

Il candidato ideale √® una persona precisa ed affidabile, curiosa e organizzata, desiderosa di imparare quotidianamente, con una buona capacit√† di ascolto e incline a trovare soluzioni.

Stiamo ricercando una persona¬†che abbia¬†un atteggiamento positivo, dotata di un buon spirito d'iniziativa¬†e rapida¬†capacit√† di apprendimento.




Requisiti essenziali:

Conoscenza eccellente della lingua italiana.

Capacit√† di risoluzione di problematiche di base legate¬†all‚Äôutilizzo di pc.

Buona padronanza dell‚ÄôInglese scritto e parlato.

Eccellente conoscenza di Excel.

Buona familiarit√† con l‚Äôanalisi dei dati.

Conoscenza di tool per la rappresentazione grafica dei dati.

Capacit√† di descrivere in maniera chiara ed efficace analisi complesse a clienti e colleghi non tecnici.




Competenze ed esperienze desiderate:

Conoscenza dei seguenti strumenti: Google Ads, Google GA4, Wordpress, Google¬†Workspace e cloud server.

Conoscenza base delle dinamiche Seo e ottimizzazione per i motori di ricerca.

Buon utilizzo di strumenti per l‚Äôinvio di DEM.

Conoscenza di SQL e delle basi di dati (i.e. database relazionali).

Smart Eventi √® alla ricerca di una nuova figura da inserire nel team, che si occuper√† di analizzare e ottimizzare i diversi processi organizzativi e decisionali nei vari settori dell‚Äôazienda esperto in analisi e ottimizzazione dati per performance e budget management.

Il candidato seguir√† un percorso di formazione che lo porter√† ad essere in grado di analizzare le criticit√† aziendali per proporre, pianificare, sviluppare e monitorare le soluzioni necessarie al miglioramento dei processi interni all‚Äôazienda.

 

Attitudini personali richieste:

Il candidato ideale √® una persona precisa ed affidabile, curiosa e organizzata, desiderosa di imparare quotidianamente, con una buona capacit√† di ascolto e incline a trovare soluzioni.

Stiamo ricercando una persona che abbia un atteggiamento positivo, dotata di un buon spirito d'iniziativa e rapida capacit√† di apprendimento.


Requisiti essenziali:

Conoscenza eccellente della lingua italiana.

Capacit√† di risoluzione di problematiche di base legate all‚Äôutilizzo di pc.

Buona padronanza dell‚ÄôInglese scritto e parlato.

Eccellente conoscenza di Excel.

Buona familiarit√† con l‚Äôanalisi dei dati.

Conoscenza di tool per la rappresentazione grafica dei dati.

Capacit√† di descrivere in maniera chiara ed efficace analisi complesse a clienti e colleghi non tecnici.


Competenze ed esperienze desiderate:

Conoscenza dei seguenti strumenti: Google Ads, Google GA4, Wordpress, Google Workspace e cloud server.

Conoscenza base delle dinamiche Seo e ottimizzazione per i motori di ricerca.

Buon utilizzo di strumenti per l‚Äôinvio di DEM.

Conoscenza di SQL e delle basi di dati (i.e. database relazionali).

Conoscenza di tool CRM (i.e. Salesforce o similari).

Capacit√† di effettuare analisi di costi e benefici dettagliate, per valutare al meglio le performance e il budget da allocare.

Saper indentificare le relazioni tra diverse KPI e l‚Äôimpatto di queste sui risultati aziendali per identificare eventuali azioni di miglioramento.

Title: STAGE DATA ANALYST
Description:
SYNLAB √® il leader europeo nel settore della medicina di laboratorio e della diagnostica medica, attivo in 36 paesi e 4 continenti (Europa, Asia, Africa e America), con oltre 450 laboratori, 24.000 dipendenti e 500 milioni di test effettuati ogni anno.

In Italia, SYNLAB rappresenta il pi√π vasto gruppo di diagnostica integrata e il primo interlocutore nei servizi di diagnostica di laboratorio per molti specialisti e laboratori clienti.

Siamo presenti in 8 Regioni (Veneto, Friuli Venezia Giulia, Lombardia, Toscana, Emilia-Romagna, Liguria, Lazio e Campania) con i nostri 9 Laboratori, oltre 300 Punti Prelievo e 80 Medical Center. Abbiamo un fatturato di oltre ‚Ç¨ 300 milioni, effettuiamo 40 milioni di analisi di laboratorio e 1,5 milioni di prestazioni poliambulatoriali all'anno, grazie ai 2.000 dipendenti e 2.000 liberi professionisti che collaborano con noi.

La nostra Mission: fornire informazioni diagnostiche utili per una vita sana e per il benessere di tutti.

La nostra Vision: una leadership conquistata attraverso l‚Äôeccellenza del servizio a favore delle persone e della comunit√† medica, con una diagnostica di altissima qualit√†.

I nostri Valori: passione, responsabilit√† e customer centricity.

Posizione:

Sotto la guida e supervisione del Medical Center Manager, avr√† la possibilit√† di acquisire la necessaria autonomia al fine di interpretare i dati, costruire piani d‚Äôazione e apprendere le logiche di gestione dei Medical Center.

La risorsa sar√† di supporto nelle attivit√† di reporting, budgeting, forecasting e avanzamento rispetto ai target riguardanti le visite specialistiche e la diagnostica strumentale. Il team coopera strettamente con i colleghi delle funzioni Retail, Marketing, Finance, Operations e IT per lo sviluppo di progetti, attivit√† crosschannel e monitoraggio delle performance.

In particolare, lo stage verter√† sulle seguenti attivit√†:


Estrazione dati, redazione reportistica e dashboard
Supporto nelle attivit√† di analisi relative a Sales, P&L, Customer Experience, Customer Centricity, Efficiency.
Monitoraggio dei risultati economici con l‚Äôutlizzo di KPIs
Stesura di piani d‚Äôazione al fine di ottimizzare il canale
Partecipare a riunioni periodiche con Site e MC Manager per condividere informazioni, valutare gli impatti delle attivit√† in corso e delle nuove opportunit√† di business


Requisiti:

Titolo di Studio: Laurea in materie economiche, ingegneria gestionale o equivalenti

Competenze Tecniche: Buona conoscenza pacchetto Office (in particolare Excel e Power Point) - Conoscenza della lingua inglese parlata e scritta - Abilit√† nell‚Äôutilizzo di software per estrazione dati - Disponibilit√† a trasferte

Competenze Relazionali: Predisposizione al lavoro in gruppo - Precisione e organizzazione - Predisposizione alla gestione delle attivit√† assegnate nel rispetto delle tempistiche richieste - Spirito di iniziativa, collaborazione e capacit√† di osservazione

Altre informazioni:

sede di lavoro: Monza - via martiri delle foibe 1, 20900 Monza Mb

orario di lavoro: full time 40 ore da luned√¨ a venerd√¨

contratto: stage extracurriculare con rimborso spese mensile di 800 euro

2 giorni alla settimana di smart working - ticket restaurant di 6 euro

Title: DATA ANALYST
HTML:
Chi siamo?

Siamo una societ√† dinamica, giovane e flessibile.

Offriamo servizi e soluzioni altamente qualificati a partner e Clienti di livello Enterprise grazie ad un team smart composto da tecnici pluricertificati in grado di comprendere e soddisfare le esigenze che i progetti richiedono.

I nostri ingredienti vincenti sono la passione per quello che facciamo, la professionalit√† con cui affrontiamo le sfide che ogni giorno i Clienti ci propongono e la preparazione continua a cui ci sottoponiamo.


Chi cerchiamo?

Un* Data Analyst che, all'interno di un team, operer√† per un prestigioso Cliente Multinazionale analizzando e ottimizzando i processi e i costi.


Requisiti:

  • Ottima conoscenza di Excel;
  • buona conoscenza di Microsoft Azure;
  • buona conoscenza Power BI
  • conoscenza di linguaggi di programmazione (es. PowerShell, Java, Python...);
  • ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese;
  • minimo 2 anni di esperienza


Sede di lavoro: Cernusco sul Naviglio (fermata Villa Fiorita, metro M2).


Cosa offriamo?

  • Ambiente lavorativo informale, stimolante e aggiornato;
  • contratto a tempo indeterminato e retribuzione in linea con il ruolo;
  • possibilit√† di acquisire certificazioni tecniche;
  • periodiche attivit√† di Team building.


Se vuoi far parte del team e sei curios* di conoscerci, iscriviti all‚Äôannuncio.

Ti aspettiamo!

Title: Data, Analytics & AI Analyst (STAGE)
Description:
Are you a creative, data-driven problem solver with an innovative mindset and a passion for Data Analytics & AI?

Do you have an interest in how Data, Analytics & AI solutions can support the needs of the modern world?

Are you ready to launch your career in the dynamic world of Data, Analytics & AI consulting?

Within our Data, Analytics & AI area, we are increasing our local expertise and looking for a new colleague to join as Intern, for a six-moths full-time internship. You will play a key role in applying advanced data analytics.

You will be based in our Milan office, with a hybrid way of working.




What will you do?

You will join a growing, friendly, and compelling team focused on Data, Analytics & AI topics.
You will support our Data, Analytics & AI colleagues in helping our clients understand and gain valuable insights from data, help them understand art of the possible and how to leverage the power of AI, including Generative AI, to ultimately drive tangible business growth.
You will be guided and mentored by more senior professionals that will take care of your professional growth. We work in an open and supportive environment, where new ideas and solutions are always encouraged.
You will be able to understand real business requirements and identify the best solution to achieve the expected outcome.




Whom are we looking for?

You have successfully completed a Master‚Äôs Degree in Statistics, Finance, Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, Business Analytics disciplines, or similar fields, gained with excellent results from a top University/Business School.
You are willing to continuously learn and research on new approach and technologies related to data management and analytics.
You are interested in data collection, interpretation, analysis as well as presentation of insights.
You know at least a coding language.
You have good communication and team-working skills.
You have a quantitative mindset and analytical approach.
You are able to communicate both in Italian and English at all levels of the Organization (other European languages will be considered as a plus).

You will have an advantage, if additionally, you have:

Previous internship experience, especially within leading consulting firms.
Knowledge of Python and/or SQL.
Knowledge of data visualization and data analytics tools like Tableau, Power BI, Spotfire, Qlik.
Knowledge of modelling.




We want to offer you a unique experience!

You will work in a global organization that is large enough to offer a wide variety of challenging opportunities, but in a local community where everyone knows your name and is always willing to offer support.
You will join our international network of Data, Analytics & AI experts and help companies to succeed in their technology ambitions.
You will be supported to continuously grow and develop your career through regular discussions with your development manager, formal training, and direct project work.
You will work with other like-minded and creative individuals to develop new ideas that have the potential to make a real difference to the businesses we work with.
We offer competitive compensation as well as a comprehensive benefits package, which includes electronic meal vouchers, and company computer and iPhone.
Are you interested in discovering more about our culture? Let's take a look at our Instagram profile.




About BearingPoint

BearingPoint is an independent management and technology consultancy with European roots and a global reach. We operate in four units: Consulting, Solutions, Business Services, and Ventures. Consulting covers the advisory business; Solutions provides the tools for successful digital transformation, advanced analytics and regulatory requirements; Business Services provides managed services beyond SaaS; Ventures drives the financing and development of start-ups.

Our clients include many of the world‚Äôs leading companies and organizations. We have a global consulting network with more than 10,000 people and support clients in over 75 countries, engaging with them to achieve measurable and sustainable success.

We are guided by our purpose ‚Äì Together, we are more than business.

It revolves around three key areas of focus ‚Äì More innovation, more for our planet and more for our people. Our people promises ‚Äì Purpose in Practice, Deeper Connections, New Flexibility, Personal and Professional Growth, and Holistic Wellbeing and Rewards, brings together our values, aspirations, and responsibilities towards our people. It helps our people achieve and accomplish more than you can imagine possible.

We can‚Äôt do this alone. We can do this together. Join us!




Interested?

If this sounds like the ideal environment for you to work, innovate and achieve our shared purpose, join our high-performing team, apply now!




Equality & Inclusion

BearingPoint is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce where each individual feels they belong. Fostering a work environment with a strong sense of community and where everyone can thrive is a core pillar of our business.

We are focused on attracting and retaining the best people with the right skills and the desire to deliver excellent results, regardless of background. In return, we will provide a working environment in which everyone feels valued and has the opportunity to fulfill their potential, where their talents are fully utilized, and company goals are met. We celebrate the strength that comes from our similarities and our differences through local initiatives which promote inclusion, outreach, and respect.




Please click here to view our privacy policy.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Per azienda leader del mondo Manufacturing e casa madre tedesca, con sede a Lainate, siamo attualmente alla ricerca di una figura di Data Analyst.

Responsibilities

La figura, a riporto del responsabile regionale e in sinergia con i referenti delle altre country si occuper√† delle seguenti attivit√†:

  • Progettare ed implementare l'analisi dei dati;
  • Creazione di Dashboard tramite PowerBI;
  • Contribuire alla Gestione del Ciclo di Vita dei Dati a livello di gruppo;

Title: Data Analyst/Scientist
Description:
Skill Farm Members are invited to apply for the following role:

Responsibilities:

Development of AI/ML algorithms to meet internal customer requirements, starting from the exploratory and prototype phase up to the industrialization and scale-up of the developed software

Support internal customers in analyzing large, heterogeneous and highly complex datasets in order to extract relevant content

Development of MLOps pipelines in AWS cloud in order to release a production-ready code thanks to the available tools (AWS Glue, docker and EKS, SageMaker...)

Skills & Qualifications:

Degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science or equivalent experience

1-3 years of work experience in Machine Learning and statistical analysis

Programming experience in Python for the realization of AI/ML projects

Knowledge of Machine Learning algorithms and main Python libraries for their implementation (scikit-learn, prophet, Tensorflow, PyTorch√â)

Cloud model development using Big Data and MLOps tools (PySpark, Apache Airflow, Docker and Kubernetes√â)

La modalit√† di lavoro sar√† ibrida su Milano, (2 giorni a settimana presso la sede del cliente).


Per poter svolgere l‚Äôattivit√†, il candidato ideale dovr√† possedere un‚Äôottima conoscenza di Splunk Enterprise Application.


Il candidato ideale dovr√† svolgere attivit√† di progettazione e sviluppo di dashboard, analisi del dato per la ricerca di anomalie e identificazioni di nuovi pattern, identificazione di nuovi KPI.


Completano il profilo:

  • diploma e/o laurea ad indirizzo tecnico-scientifico;
  • buona conoscenza della lingua inglese, sia parlate che scritta.


Se interessati, inviate il Vostro Curriculum Vitae aggiornato e dettagliato che dovr√† contenere autorizzazione al trattamento dei dati secondo l'articolo 13 GDPR679/16 a: paola.riccardi@atoninformatica.it.

Title: Analista Data Governance
Description:
NTT DATA, Trusted Global Innovator, √® tra i principali player a livello mondiale in ambito IT services.

Con pi√π di 140.000 professionisti in oltre 50 Paesi in tutto il mondo, siamo protagonisti e acceleratori della trasformazione digitale offrendo ai nostri clienti soluzioni tecnologiche e innovative progettate su misura. Il motore di NTTDATA sono le persone, ognuna con la propria unicit√†, talento ed attitudine.

Abbiamo costruito una Smile Working Company in cui la cura, l‚Äôascolto delle persone, il loro benessere e sviluppo delle competenze sono la nostra priorit√†. Abbiamo creato spazi di lavoro che favoriscono il senso di comunit√† e lo scambio costruttivo di esperienze.

Guardiamo al nostro domani con la stessa passione di ieri e abbiamo bisogno anche del tuo talento!

www.nttdata.com/it

Responsibilities

Il candidato scelto sar√† inserito all'interno del Center Of Excellence Informatica parte della practice ‚ÄúData Intelligence‚Äù di NTT DATA Italia.

Un analista della governance dei dati √® specializzato nella gestione dei flussi di informazioni incluse l'integrit√†, l'efficienza e la disponibilit√† dei dati. Avr√† in compito di confrontarsi con il cliente e gli stakeholder di progetto al fine di indirizzare le giuste scelte tecnologiche e di business in modo da rendere fruibili, validi e facilmente consultabili i dati aziendali. Sar√† premiante la conoscenza dell‚Äôintera suite di Data Governance dei principali vendor con particolare attenzione alla suite Informatica, ivi compresa la componente di Master Data Management.

Rientrano Nei Suoi Compiti


Analisi dell‚Äôecosistema del cliente, delle best practice e dei modelli di governance in uso;
Analisi dei flussi dei dati tra sistemi;
Supporto al disegno dei flussi tramite soluzioni Informatica, delle regole di qualit√† e della definizione del Business Glossary e del suo popolamento attraverso gli strumenti di catalogazione, come:
Informatica Axon
Informatica Enterprise Data Catalog (EDC)
Informatica MDM



Required Skills


Laurea in discipline tecniche o economiche.
Esperienza di almeno 3 anni nell‚Äôambito di Data Governance.
Profonda conoscenza dei principali strumenti della suite Informatica Axon, EDC, MDM.



Completano Il Profilo


Conoscenza di altri prodotti di Data Governance quali Collibra Governance, Talend Data Management Platform, SAS Data Management, etc..
Capacit√† di stesura della documentazione in lingua inglese.
Esperienze progettuali con in principali Cloud Provider (AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform, IBM Cloud)



Location: Milano, Bari, Bologna, Cosenza, Napoli, Roma, Salerno, Torino

Title: Business Intelligence
Description:
OUR STORY

At ST, we believe in the power of technology to drive innovation and make a positive impact on people, business, and society. We are a global semiconductor company, and our advanced technology & chips forms the hidden part of the world we live in today.

When you join ST, you will be part of a global business of more than 115+ nationalities and present in 40 countries, 50,000+, diverse and dedicated creators & makers of technology around the world!

Developing technologies takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understands collaboration and respect. People with passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries and drive innovation ‚Äì whilst unlocking your own potential.

Working at ST means innovating for a future that we want to make smarter, greener, in a responsible and sustainable way. Our technology starts with you. Join us and start the future!

Looking for an intern to automate specific and key business data collection, through new available AI tools, to improve the overall efficiency in business data management.

The goal of the internship is to design and implement an automated AI based system for easy and effective business data collection (from different sources), analysis and presentation aimed to reduce time and efforts spent on those data analysis and presentations creation.

Main users of the outcomes will be divisional management team.

Profile

Graduate (pre or post) in Data Analytics with good understanding of AI tools and algorithms

Open minded and used to teamwork

Good communication skills

Trustworthy and results oriented

We encourage candidates who may not meet every single requirement to apply, as we appreciate diverse perspectives and provide opportunities for growth and learning. Diversity, Equity and Inclusion (DEI) is part of our company culture. Our DEI vision is, ‚ÄúAt ST, you can be the true version of yourself‚Äù, we value all employee contributions and have zero tolerance for any kind of discrimination.

Joining us is also about a greater work-life balance and workplace with equal opportunities. Dedicated Employee Resource Groups for women and LGBTQIA+, hybrid work arrangements are amongst the many DEI & Sustainability initiatives that make us a great place to evolve your career.

To discover more, visit st.com/careers

Title: Digital Analytics Intern
Description:
Country: Italy

City: Milan, Piazza Einaudi, 4

Contract Type: Intern

Department: E-Commerce & Omnichannel

Mode: Hybrid




Are you ready for a new challenge in our E-Commerce & Omnichannel team?:

We are seeking a dynamic and motivated individual to join our team as a Digital Analytics Intern.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to work on projects related to digital experience analysis and digital data collection, gaining hands-on experience in the field of digital analytics.




What can you learn with us?:




Digital Experience Analytics:

Collaborate to set up and configure the Digital Experience Analytics Platform for effective data tracking and analysis
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify key behavioural metrics on a Digital Experience perspective
Measure and analyze user behaviour, engagement, and conversion to optimize user journeys and enhance digital experience.




Data Collection:

Work with analytics tools to gather clean and reliable data for actionable insights.




General support:

Collaborate with the Digital Analytics team on various projects and tasks as needed, gaining exposure to a wide range of analytics activities (ie: A/B tests, personalization of navigation, etc..)
Generate and present reports on key performance indicators creating visualizations that effectively communicate data insights
Manage and facilitate communication with external agencies to ensure smooth collaboration on analytics-related projects.




Do you have these qualifications and skills?:

Degree in a related field such as Marketing, Business Analytics, or Information Technology;
Strong interest in digital analytics and data-driven decision-making;
Familiarity with digital analytics tools such as Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics and Decibel or ContentSquare;
Knowledge of behavioural analytics concepts and methodologies.




Don‚Äôt lose this great opportunity to join us. Apply soon!




Diversity and inclusion are integral to Versace's DNA. We promote an inclusive environment where employees and customers from diverse backgrounds are welcomed, valued, and celebrated. We take pride in our commitment to diversity, equality, and inclusion, and will continue to uphold these principles wherever we do business. Our doors are open to all.




WE ARE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER M/D/F

Title: Data Analyst Stage
Description:
sennder is Europe‚Äôs leading digital freight forwarder. In a traditional industry, we are moving fast to digitize and automate all road logistics processes. We move trucks with courage and the power of data to unlock endless and sustainable capacity at exceptional quality. Get to know us better by reviewing our "About Us" presentation.

We are a growing team looking for a Data Analyst Intern in the Operations Program & Innovation department to help us on our journey to revolutionize road freight logistics. The role is located in our Milan office.

What You Will Do ‚Ä¶

As a Data Analyst Intern, you will play a crucial role in enhancing real-time visibility and driving advancements in tracking technologies. You will support the management of the "Service Quality and Visibility Program," collaborating with various stakeholders to develop processes aimed at delivering high-quality services to our carriers and shippers. Additionally, you will assist in leading projects focused on visibility and service quality improvements to meet company objectives.

In this role, you will ‚Ä¶


Assist in managing the "Service Quality and Visibility Program," working closely with internal and external stakeholders.
Support the execution of projects aimed at improving our services, contributing to the achievement of company goals.
Assist in the preparation of ad hoc analyses, forecasts, reports, and presentations for senior leadership, providing insights into the effectiveness of outputs.
Aid in building, managing, and maintaining performance reports and dashboards related to key metrics such as GPS coverage, Perfect Service Shipment, and On-Time Performances.
Collaborate with the Product Team to contribute ideas for new solutions, enhancements to existing ones, and draft business requirement documents.
Assist in monitoring and enhancing GPS integration processes of carriers regularly.
Support daily interactions with third-party service providers to enhance real-time visibility.
Serve as a primary point of contact for Operations Teams regarding visibility and service quality matters.


What We Are Looking For ‚Ä¶


Bachelor's degree in engineering, business, statistics, or a related field.
At least 1 year of experience in operations management, quality management, performance management, consulting, or similar roles.
Preferred experience in the transportation/logistics industry or familiarity with supply chain visibility concepts.
Proficiency in G-suite and MS Office; SQL skills are a plus.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in both Italian and English.
Demonstrated ability to work independently and proactively.
Strong analytical skills and a data-driven mindset.
Fast learner with a collaborative approach to teamwork.


ABOUT Sennder Italia

sennder Italia, based in the heart of Milan, is a joint venture company between sennder and Poste Italiane. Our company matches the digital and innovative focus on technologies and digitalization of sennder with the expertise and know-how of the largest distribution network in Italy, Poste Italiane.

We not only connect shippers to our fleet of thousands of trucks, but also improve how they move products in sustainable, cost-efficient, and transparent ways - making the logistics industry fit for the future. In a traditional industry, we‚Äôre growing and moving fast to digitally automate all road logistics processes.

We are building a curious team that is driven by an ambitious desire to solve the toughest logistics puzzles. What others may consider uncertainty, we see as an opportunity to learn and be proactive. We invite you to go on this journey with us and be part of one of Europe‚Äôs inspiring growth stories as we fast-forward road logistics into digitalization. Read more about the sennder Italia joint venture here.

What You Can Expect‚Ä¶

At sennder, we want to maximize the individual potential of all employees and reinforce an inclusive culture and environment of continuous learning that empowers people to succeed as a team. In addition to humility, we value commitment, team spirit and respect to build fruitful collaboration across teams. Learn more about who we are on our career site.


Fast growth scale-up with an international team of 1000+ people, 74+ nationalities spread across 11 European offices. With English as our common language, we are able to work together.
Learning and development on the job and with the support of a bi-annual review process, learning allowance, high potential programs, sennder onboarding academy, and internal trainings.
Various opportunities to connect with colleagues through regular team events and company get-togethers such as our highly anticipated sennder Summer Camp.
Prioritize employee engagement and mental well-being by fostering a supportive environment through the Likeminded platform and conducting regular employee satisfaction surveys.
Hybrid work model where you seamlessly merge virtual productivity and in-office collaboration with your colleagues.
Commuter allowance to assist employees with their daily travel expenses and a one-time home office benefit to ensure that you're properly equipped wherever you work.
Competitive compensation package including objective-based bonus, referral reward, and in some cases virtual option plan.
For the Milan office we offer: free on-site gym!
Vibrant offices complete with healthy snacks, focus zones, and social areas to connect with your colleagues. Click here for a virtual tour and better yet, hope to see you soon!


We value humility and we're as interested in your character as we are in your talent. Please apply, even if you feel you only meet part of our listed criteria. Diversity drives our innovation and we offer a collaborative, dynamic, and international work environment. Just be yourself. We are excited to meet you and for you to join us in shaping the future of the logistics industry in Europe.

If you have any questions or need special accommodation please reach out to us at ta@sennder.com. As soon as you apply your journey with sennder begins.

If you have any questions or need special accommodation please reach out to us at ta@sennder.com. As soon as you apply your journey with sennder begins.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Skill Farm Members are invited to apply for the following role:

Responsibilities:

Business trend analysis: Constant monitoring of market trends and company performance to identify growth opportunities and potential threats.

Support in defining the three-year strategic plan: Collaborate with the leadership team to develop and review the long-term strategic plan, ensuring alignment with company objectives.

Definition of tactical actions: Identify and propose tactical actions aimed at refining commercial strategies based on analyzes of business trends and corporate objectives.

Performance measurement and corrective actions: Monitor the performance of the commercial team, analyzing the results against the established objectives. Define and implement corrective actions to maximize performance and achieve set objectives

Presentations to top management: Preparation of key documents for top management, clearly illustrating business analyzes and strategic recommendations to support business decisions.

Skills & Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Economics, Statistics, Engineering Management or related field.

Previous experience in a strategic analyst role or similar roles, preferably with consultancy experience. Excellent analytical and problem solving skills

Organizational and planning skills, flexibility, entrepreneurial spirit, problem solving and teamwork

Knowledge of Excel data analysis tools, BI and presentation tools such as Power Point - Ability to communicate clearly and effectively, both verbally and in writing, with excellent knowledge of English.

Title: Data, Analytics & AI Analyst (STAGE)
Description:
Are you a creative, data-driven problem solver with an innovative mindset and a passion for Data Analytics & AI?

Do you have an interest in how Data, Analytics & AI solutions can support the needs of the modern world?

Are you ready to launch your career in the dynamic world of Data, Analytics & AI consulting?

Within our Data, Analytics & AI area, we are increasing our local expertise and looking for a new colleague to join as Intern, for a six-moths full-time internship. You will play a key role in applying advanced data analytics.

You will be based in our Milan office, with a hybrid way of working.




What will you do?

You will join a growing, friendly, and compelling team focused on Data, Analytics & AI topics.
You will support our Data, Analytics & AI colleagues in helping our clients understand and gain valuable insights from data, help them understand art of the possible and how to leverage the power of AI, including Generative AI, to ultimately drive tangible business growth.
You will be guided and mentored by more senior professionals that will take care of your professional growth. We work in an open and supportive environment, where new ideas and solutions are always encouraged.
You will be able to understand real business requirements and identify the best solution to achieve the expected outcome.




Whom are we looking for?

You have successfully completed a Master‚Äôs Degree in Statistics, Finance, Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, Business Analytics disciplines, or similar fields, gained with excellent results from a top University/Business School.
You are willing to continuously learn and research on new approach and technologies related to data management and analytics.
You are interested in data collection, interpretation, analysis as well as presentation of insights.
You know at least a coding language.
You have good communication and team-working skills.
You have a quantitative mindset and analytical approach.
You are able to communicate both in Italian and English at all levels of the Organization (other European languages will be considered as a plus).

You will have an advantage, if additionally, you have:

Previous internship experience, especially within leading consulting firms.
Knowledge of Python and/or SQL.
Knowledge of data visualization and data analytics tools like Tableau, Power BI, Spotfire, Qlik.
Knowledge of modelling.




We want to offer you a unique experience!

You will work in a global organization that is large enough to offer a wide variety of challenging opportunities, but in a local community where everyone knows your name and is always willing to offer support.
You will join our international network of Data, Analytics & AI experts and help companies to succeed in their technology ambitions.
You will be supported to continuously grow and develop your career through regular discussions with your development manager, formal training, and direct project work.
You will work with other like-minded and creative individuals to develop new ideas that have the potential to make a real difference to the businesses we work with.
We offer competitive compensation as well as a comprehensive benefits package, which includes electronic meal vouchers, and company computer and iPhone.
Are you interested in discovering more about our culture? Let's take a look at our Instagram profile.




About BearingPoint

BearingPoint is an independent management and technology consultancy with European roots and a global reach. We operate in four units: Consulting, Solutions, Business Services, and Ventures. Consulting covers the advisory business; Solutions provides the tools for successful digital transformation, advanced analytics and regulatory requirements; Business Services provides managed services beyond SaaS; Ventures drives the financing and development of start-ups.

Our clients include many of the world‚Äôs leading companies and organizations. We have a global consulting network with more than 10,000 people and support clients in over 75 countries, engaging with them to achieve measurable and sustainable success.

We are guided by our purpose ‚Äì Together, we are more than business.

It revolves around three key areas of focus ‚Äì More innovation, more for our planet and more for our people. Our people promises ‚Äì Purpose in Practice, Deeper Connections, New Flexibility, Personal and Professional Growth, and Holistic Wellbeing and Rewards, brings together our values, aspirations, and responsibilities towards our people. It helps our people achieve and accomplish more than you can imagine possible.

We can‚Äôt do this alone. We can do this together. Join us!




Interested?

If this sounds like the ideal environment for you to work, innovate and achieve our shared purpose, join our high-performing team, apply now!




Equality & Inclusion

BearingPoint is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce where each individual feels they belong. Fostering a work environment with a strong sense of community and where everyone can thrive is a core pillar of our business.

We are focused on attracting and retaining the best people with the right skills and the desire to deliver excellent results, regardless of background. In return, we will provide a working environment in which everyone feels valued and has the opportunity to fulfill their potential, where their talents are fully utilized, and company goals are met. We celebrate the strength that comes from our similarities and our differences through local initiatives which promote inclusion, outreach, and respect.

HTML:
Are you a creative, data-driven problem solver with an innovative mindset and a passion for Data Analytics & AI?

Do you have an interest in how Data, Analytics & AI solutions can support the needs of the modern world?

Are you ready to launch your career in the dynamic world of Data, Analytics & AI consulting?

Within our Data, Analytics & AI area, we are increasing our local expertise and looking for a new colleague to join as Intern, for a six-moths full-time internship. You will play a key role in applying advanced data analytics.

You will be based in our Milan office, with a hybrid way of working.


What will you do?

  • You will join a growing, friendly, and compelling team focused on Data, Analytics & AI topics.
  • You will support our Data, Analytics & AI colleagues in helping our clients understand and gain valuable insights from data, help them understand art of the possible and how to leverage the power of AI, including Generative AI, to ultimately drive tangible business growth.
  • You will be guided and mentored by more senior professionals that will take care of your professional growth. We work in an open and supportive environment, where new ideas and solutions are always encouraged.
  • You will be able to understand real business requirements and identify the best solution to achieve the expected outcome.


Whom are we looking for?

  • You have successfully completed a Master‚Äôs Degree in Statistics, Finance, Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, Business Analytics disciplines, or similar fields, gained with excellent results from a top University/Business School.
  • You are willing to continuously learn and research on new approach and technologies related to data management and analytics.
  • You are interested in data collection, interpretation, analysis as well as presentation of insights.
  • You know at least a coding language.
  • You have good communication and team-working skills.
  • You have a quantitative mindset and analytical approach.
  • You are able to communicate both in Italian and English at all levels of the Organization (other European languages will be considered as a plus).

You will have an advantage, if additionally, you have:

  • Previous internship experience, especially within leading consulting firms.
  • Knowledge of Python and/or SQL.
  • Knowledge of data visualization and data analytics tools like Tableau, Power BI, Spotfire, Qlik.
  • Knowledge of modelling.


We want to offer you a unique experience!

  • You will work in a global organization that is large enough to offer a wide variety of challenging opportunities, but in a local community where everyone knows your name and is always willing to offer support.
  • You will join our international network of Data, Analytics & AI experts and help companies to succeed in their technology ambitions.
  • You will be supported to continuously grow and develop your career through regular discussions with your development manager, formal training, and direct project work.
  • You will work with other like-minded and creative individuals to develop new ideas that have the potential to make a real difference to the businesses we work with.
  • We offer competitive compensation as well as a comprehensive benefits package, which includes electronic meal vouchers, and company computer and iPhone.
  • Are you interested in discovering more about our culture? Let's take a look at our Instagram profile.


About BearingPoint

BearingPoint is an independent management and technology consultancy with European roots and a global reach. We operate in four units: Consulting, Solutions, Business Services, and Ventures. Consulting covers the advisory business; Solutions provides the tools for successful digital transformation, advanced analytics and regulatory requirements; Business Services provides managed services beyond SaaS; Ventures drives the financing and development of start-ups.

Our clients include many of the world‚Äôs leading companies and organizations. We have a global consulting network with more than 10,000 people and support clients in over 75 countries, engaging with them to achieve measurable and sustainable success.

We are guided by our purpose ‚Äì Together, we are more than business.

It revolves around three key areas of focus ‚Äì More innovation, more for our planet and more for our people. Our people promises ‚Äì Purpose in Practice, Deeper Connections, New Flexibility, Personal and Professional Growth, and Holistic Wellbeing and Rewards, brings together our values, aspirations, and responsibilities towards our people. It helps our people achieve and accomplish more than you can imagine possible.

We can‚Äôt do this alone. We can do this together. Join us!

Equality & Inclusion

Title: Data Analyst, Product Team
Description:
About Satispay

At Satispay, we're not just reimagining payments; we're pioneering a movement toward simplicity and accessibility. Picture yourself at the forefront of innovation, leading the way in revolutionizing payments - and beyond! - across Europe, alongside a vibrant community of like-minded individuals driven by a shared vision: simplifying payments to improve everyone‚Äôs life.

Are you ready to be part of something bigger? Satispay is the place for you! Come be part of our dynamic team and help us shape the future of payments in Europe.

üöÄ Join us as Data Analyst - Product Team and let's make magic happen together.

Role Overview

As a Data Analyst, Product Team, you will join the Tech & Product team and collaborate closely with stakeholders from the Product, Engineering, and Marketing teams to identify business needs and uncover analytics opportunities.

Your Mission


Deliver real impact. Bring concrete impact to the product through research and implementation of rigorous data-driven solutions.
Analyze performance. Conduct thorough analysis of product usage and performance data to identify trends and opportunities for improvement.
Generate actionable insights. Distill insights from big data and make recommendations to drive product decisions and future developments.
Design and optimize experiments. Develop and manage A/B tests to optimize and guide product enhancements.
Create and maintain dashboards. Track key metrics and visualize insights to inform stakeholders and drive data-driven decisions.
Manage analytic solutions. Modernize, standardize, troubleshoot, and maintain existing analytic solutions to ensure accuracy and reliability.
Stay current with industry trends. Continuously evolve the organization by adopting best-in-class technologies and techniques.
Enhance data-driven culture. Support decision-making and promote a data-driven culture through ad-hoc analyses and insights.


Your Ideal Profile


Proven experience and analytical skills. You have 3+ years of working experience in Business Intelligence or Data Analytics and can apply high-level analytical, statistical, and quantitative problem-solving skills to various scenarios. Experience in Product Analytics is a plus.
Expertise in programming. You possess advanced knowledge of SQL and query optimization, as well as extensive knowledge of Python or R. Additionally, you have experience with Looker, Tableau, or similar technologies.
Detail-oriented and communicative. You have a maniacal attention to detail and enjoy executing complex projects. You can communicate in a structured and convincing manner, adapting your style to build trust in a positive and professional way with various stakeholders.
Passion for fintech or startup environments. You are enthusiastic about working in dynamic, innovative settings.
Language proficiency. You are fluent in Italian and English.


Don't let a checklist hold you back - at Satispay, we thrive on diverse perspectives and unique strengths. Your individuality could be the missing piece to our puzzle! Even if you don't meet every skill listed above, we encourage you to apply if you're passionate about the role and believe you can contribute to our team's success.

Your Perks as a Satisperson

üôÜüèª Join an international team to grow with

üè° Hybrid working policy

üçΩÔ∏è Fuel your day with our meal vouchers

üåê Preply language platform access to expand your language skills

‚≠ê Benefit from our 1.2k company welfare budget

üöÄ Own part of Satispay‚Äôs success with our Stock Option Plan

üë©üèª‚Äçüíª Gear up with our tech equipment

ü•≥ Join us in the fun with team-building events, parties, trips, and more!

Our selection process is tailored to each role and includes at least a call with our Talent Acquisition Team, a technical evaluation, and a final in-person meeting. Your recruiter will share more insights during your first meeting with us!

Equal Opportunity Employer

At Satispay, we're proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and inclusion, welcoming individuals of all backgrounds. This opportunity is open to everyone, regardless - for instance - of race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, and national origin. Join us in a workplace where everyone belongs!

Learn More About Us

Curious about our core values? Explore them here.

Title: Data Analyst - Field Marketing
Description:
Vuoi un mini spoiler su CPM?

Ci prendiamo cura dei maggiori brand mondiali da oltre 80 anni attraverso diverse attivit√†, dal merchandising alle vendite, dalla consumer activation al supporto clienti fino alla formazione sul prodotto. Questa √® CPM, una realt√† internazionale forte e dinamica, come le persone che ne fanno parte. Per te, rappresenta la grande opportunit√† di entrare a far parte di una solida multinazionale dove formarti e sviluppare la tua carriera in un settore in crescita e in un ambiente giovane, innovativo e super stimolante. Un‚Äôesperienza che ti metter√† a contatto con i brand e le aziende pi√π importanti in Italia.

Candidati e‚Ä¶ magari ci vediamo a bordo!




Ti offriamo di diventare

il guru dei nostri dati.




Per te abbiamo una posizione come Data Analyst in un settore, il field marketing, dove la tua competenza pu√≤ davvero fare la differenza.

Potrai mettere in luce le tue capacit√† di analisi e interpretazione del dato al servizio di tanti brand diversi. Annoiarsi? Impossibile.

Lavorerai nella nostra sede di Milano in spazi di nuova generazione e potrai operare anche da casa e ovunque grazie alle nuove politiche di smart working. Perch√© in CPM Italy siamo convinti che i tuoi risultati passino anche attraverso la qualit√† della tua vita.




Ok, ma cosa farai di preciso?




Il tuo ruolo riguarda l‚Äôanalisi e la presentazione dei dati riguardanti la vendita, il posizionamento e la valutazione di campagne promo e di comunicazione in store dei brand delle nostre aziende clienti.




Come?

> realizzando report su misura;

> utilizzando indicatori chiave di performance (KPI);

> sviluppando e gestendo un avanzato sistema di business intelligence e dashboard online;

> collaborando con i colleghi del team.




Sei tu la persona giusta?




Per entrare nel nostro reparto di Data Analyst √® richiesta un‚Äôesperienza di almeno 1 anno in questo ruolo. Essere positivi, proattivi e precisi √® un ottimo requisito ma i veri must sono la passione per i numeri e la voglia di partecipare sempre a nuove sfide.




In pi√π √® fantastico se‚Ä¶

> ti piace trasformare dati in informazioni;

> excel √® il tuo pane quotidiano;

> hai una conoscenza base di SQL e PowerBI

> ti entusiasma lavorare in team;

> sei flessibile sia come orari che di mentalit√†!




Altre informazioni

Ricerchiamo una persona che s'identifichi con i valori CPM: condivisione e propensione al lavoro di team, curiosit√†, integrazione, lavorare per obiettivi sia individuali che di gruppo.

Ai sensi della legge 12 Marzo 1999, n.68 Inventa CPM promuove l'inserimento e l'integrazione delle persone disabili nel mondo del lavoro, per questo motivo verranno tenute in particolare considerazione le candidature di tutti i soggetti indicati al comma 1 art.1 della succitata legge.

La ricerca √® altres√¨ rivolta ad entrambi i sessi.

Title: L/S Equities Data Analyst
Description:
A Career in Long/Short Equities at Point72

Long/short discretionary equity is Point72‚Äôs core investment strategy and its success depends on our sector-based investing teams, comprised of portfolio managers and research analysts. As an ever-increasing volume and variety of data are used to drive fundamental equity strategies, data scientists placed on portfolio manager teams serve as a key resource for many of our investing professionals.

Role

As a data analyst embedded in an equity investing team, your role will be to spearhead innovation through the utilization of diverse data sources and systems. You will engage closely with a portfolio manager and their team of research analysts, bridging the gap between data and fundamental research. Your contributions will underpin investment hypotheses and play a crucial role in guiding investment choices.

Responsibilities


Work closely with a portfolio manager and a team of research analysts to analyze a broad universe of Compliance approved data that will directly influence idea generation and investment decisions
Maintain and update financial models, using Excel as the primary tool, to provide accurate and timely data to inform investment decisions
Perform quarterly updates to ensure the integrity and accuracy of financial data
Follow and synthesize company earnings reports and conference calls
Support investment teams by elucidating the primary data factors influencing companies and industries


Requirements


Undergraduate degree or higher
1-2+ years of experience in a related field, such as accounting, corporate finance, or investment banking
Strong proficiency in Excel and financial modeling
Quantitative ability demonstrated through relevant coursework or work equivalent
Team player with an entrepreneurial spirit and good communication skills
Intellectual maturity, exceptional attention to detail, and the ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Deep intellectual curiosity and lifelong-learning mind-set
Commitment to the highest ethical standards


We take care of our people

We invest in our people, their careers, their health, and their well-being. We want you to concentrate on success and leave the rest to us. When you work here, we provide:


Fully-paid health care benefits
Life and Income Protection
Group Self Invested Personal Pension Scheme
Generous parental and family leave policies
Business Travel Accident Insurance
Corporate Wellness Programs


About Point72

Point72 Asset Management is a global firm led by Steven Cohen that invests in multiple asset classes and strategies worldwide. Resting on more than a quarter-century of investing experience, we seek to be the industry‚Äôs premier asset manager through delivering superior risk-adjusted returns, adhering to the highest ethical standards, and offering the greatest opportunities to the industry‚Äôs brightest talent. For more information, visit www.Point72.com/working-here.

Title: Data Analyst - stage extracurriculare
Description:
Publicis Media √® parte di Publicis Groupe, il terzo gruppo di comunicazione al mondo.

Cosa possiamo fare come Publicis Groupe?
Conosciuto per la sua creativit√† di fama mondiale, la migliore tecnologia e l'esperienza digitale e di consulenza, Publicis Groupe √® l'unico nel settore in grado di accompagnare al meglio i suoi clienti nel loro percorso di trasformazione digitale del business, ovunque nel mondo.

E cosa ci rende unici?
Un'azienda che si connette, guidata da uno scopo comune, da uno spirito forte, da comportamenti condivisi, da un grande carattere e da un'incessante attenzione ai clienti - Power of One!

Informazioni su Publicis Media

S√¨, lo sappiamo... La scelta di un singolo brand all'interno di un grande Gruppo √® talvolta complessa. Perch√© non supportarli tutti? Scegliete Publicis Media: contenuti, dati, digitale, commercio e molte altre e immergetevi nei progetti dei nostri ambiziosi clienti!

Publicis Media | Publicis Groupe




Job Description



Il candidato dovr√† contribuire all'analisi di business e alla reportistica per migliorare la capacit√† interna di previsione e consentire ulteriori approfondimenti di business.

To do list:

Aggiornare i file del database interno con le attivit√† di business dettagliate
Aggiornamento del software interno per il monitoraggio del business
Verifica delle informazioni delle fatture con i dati del database per aiutare il reparto contabilit√† a risolvere i disallineamenti
Relazioni costanti con i responsabili aziendali per gestire e migliorare i flussi di dati
Sviluppo di una nuova soluzione di business intelligence

Publicis Media cerca un Data Analyst - stage extracurriculare per la sede di Milano!



Qualifications



Se hai:

Conoscenza completa della lingua italiana
Laurea in Economia, Matematica, Statistica, Informatica, IT o simili
Buona conoscenza della suite Microsoft Office (principalmente EXCEL)
Buona conoscenza dell'inglese livello B2
Forte determinazione nel lavoro quotidiano ed elevata attenzione ai dettagli e ai dati.


Additional Information



Ci prendiamo cura dei nostri talenti e del loro benessere:

Smartworking e orari flessibili
Corporate benefit: una piattaforma dedicata alle nostre persone ricca di offerte, sconti e molto altro
Learning&Development: un percorso di apprendimento personalizzato, individuale e basato sui bisogni, sempre attivo!
Corporate Wellness: accesso gratuito ai corsi di formazione online per il vostro benessere fisico e psicologico

Lo sapevi che il nostro motto √® Viva la difference?


Con o senza D.Lgs. 198/2006, non vediamo l'ora di incontrarti e darti il benvenuto, chiunque tu sia!

Qualifications

  • Buona conoscenza dell'inglese livello B2

Additional Information

Ci prendiamo cura dei nostri talenti e del loro benessere:

  • Smartworking e orari flessibili

Con o senza D.Lgs. 198/2006, non vediamo l'ora di incontrarti e darti il benvenuto, chiunque tu sia!

Title: Data Engineer ‚Äì Data Platform & Analytics
Description:
As a member of the Data Platform & Analytics you will developing the best of breed big data analytics platform for Sky. You are never satisfied with a good enough solution, but you are always looking on better ways to solve problems, providing a world class data infrastructure and services.

You will work on complex, challenging and exciting enterprise-level data solutions/programmes which needs to be solved with simple and high quality solutions.




Main responsibilities include:

- Contribute to the overall system design/architecture and implementation, understanding requirements and problems to be solved and translating these into data engineering solutions.

- Develop and maintain the data flows, ingesting raw data from different sources or data platforms, transforming it through a set of tools into intuitive data models, KPI and allowing to act on this data.

- Help to foster innovation and good engineering practices (testing, continuous integration/delivery, pair programming, software design patterns, ‚Ä¶)




Requirements:

- Excellent problem solving skills, creative and entrepreneurial

- Experience designing highly available, scalable and distributed end to end data flows

- Strong experience in the whole software development lifecycle, including code versioning systems (Git) and CI/CD

- Experience with OO programming (Scala, Java, Python, C++, ‚Ä¶)

- Experience with relational databases (Oracle, MySQL, Postgres, ‚Ä¶)

- Experience with scripting languages (Bash, Perl, Python, Ruby, ‚Ä¶)

- Experience with ‚ÄúBig Data‚Äù technologies on Google Cloud, Amazon Web Services or Azure

Experience with Big Data platforms and engines (Apache Hadoop, Apache Kafka, Apache Spark,

- Computer science or technically related degree

- Professional knowledge of English language, written and spoken




Soft Skills:

- Able to work in a fast paced environment

- Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal

Title: Digital Data Analyst
Description:
Experis, an IT company of the ManpowerGroup group, is a leader in 54 countries in the search and selection of profiles specialized in IT & Digital, Career & Skills development, IT Consulting and Project Solutions.




For a digital company, we are looking for a Digital Data Analyst.

The candidate must be capable of working with a diverse group of stakeholders performing high level and detailed analysis, defining and writing programs using Tableau and be able to leverage the API. The candidate must be able to design dashboards with advanced Tableau functionality built with end-user functionality in mind.




Main Responsibilities:

-Design, development, testing and deployment of Tableau Dashboards

-Work under the guidance of CDO to create BI dashboard solutions based on Business needs

-Structure ambiguous business problems and recommend visualization solutions

-Leverage advanced Tableau functionality (parameters, actions, tooltip modifications, API, etc.) to create analytical dashboards.

-Develop a strong understanding of business requirements; working with business users/ business analysts to define technical and process requirements

-Build effective working relationships with team members




Position Requirements:

-3-5+ years of experience with Tableau or similar BI tools

-8+ years Business Intelligence experience

-Proven experience delivering Business Intelligence solutions

-Experience with Tableau, dashboard design and delivery

-Hands on experience querying MS-SQL databases

-Understanding of development, data modeling and ETL knowledge

-Excellent problem-solving, design, debugging, and testing skills

-Ability to work with multiple different personality types while managing work load within a fast paced, energetic, and dynamic workplace




What we offer:

-RAL commensurate with experience

-Full-time contract

-Smartworking 1 day/week

-Place of work: Milan

Description:
In Ipsos siamo appassionati di persone, mercati, brand e societ√†. La nostra ambizione √® diventare partner di tutti i clienti che vogliono comprendere in profondit√† e dettaglio la loro audience, i mercati, i consumatori, e le marche in un mondo in rapida e continua evoluzione.

Iniziativa, curiosit√† e entusiasmo

un percorso professionale all‚Äôinterno di un Gruppo internazionale e altamente formativo;

Taking Responsibility

Il processo di selezione

Una volta ricevuta la tua candidatura, ci prenderemo il tempo necessario per valutarla attentamente. Nel caso in cui il tuo profilo sia in linea per questa o altre posizioni presso l'azienda, ci metteremo in contatto con te. Tuttavia, nel caso in cui non ci sia una corrispondenza al momento, non preoccuparti! ci assicureremo di tenere in considerazione il tuo cv per future opportunit√† in linea con il tuo profilo e nel totale rispetto della normativa privacy e GDPR. Tutte le candidature saranno prese in considerazione per la posizione senza riguardo all'et√†, alla razza, al colore della pelle, alla religione, al sesso, all'orientamento sessuale, all'identit√† di genere, all'origine nazionale, allo status di rifugiato o a qualsiasi altra categoria protetta e non saranno discriminati sulla base della disabilit√†.

I nostri valori

Siamo "Proud to be Ipsos" perch√© crediamo fortemente nella nostra cultura aziendale, incarnando i valori di Integrit√† ‚Äì Collaborazione ‚Äì Curiosit√† ‚Äì Spirito Imprenditoriale ‚Äì Attenzione al Cliente nei rapporti con i colleghi, con i clienti e con la societ√†.

Se ti riconosci nella nostra realt√† e nei nostri valori, se hai l‚Äôambizione di entrare a far parte di un‚Äôazienda dinamica e internazionale e desideri crescere insieme a noi, candidati subito!

Questo non potrebbe essere realizzato senza le persone di Ipsos che compilano e analizzano questi dati: essi sono l'essenza di ci√≤ che siamo e di ci√≤ che facciamo. Ci impegniamo a offrire pari opportunit√†, a creare un ambiente che promuova l'inclusione. Ipsos incoraggia il proprio personale ad agire in modo rispettoso e responsabile, in linea con il codice e la nostra policy in materia di diversit√† e inclusione, diritti umani, uguaglianza e civilt√†.

Il processo di selezione

Una volta ricevuta la tua candidatura, ci prenderemo il tempo necessario per valutarla attentamente. Nel caso in cui il tuo profilo sia in linea per questa o altre posizioni presso l'azienda, ci metteremo in contatto con te. Tuttavia, nel caso in cui non ci sia una corrispondenza al momento, non preoccuparti! ci assicureremo di tenere in considerazione il tuo cv per future opportunit√† in linea con il tuo profilo e nel totale rispetto della normativa privacy e GDPR. Tutte le candidature saranno prese in considerazione per la posizione senza riguardo all'et√†, alla razza, al colore della pelle, alla religione, al sesso, all'orientamento sessuale, all'identit√† di genere, all'origine nazionale, allo status di rifugiato o a qualsiasi altra categoria protetta e non saranno discriminati sulla base della disabilit√†.

I nostri valori

Siamo "Proud to be Ipsos" perch√© crediamo fortemente nella nostra cultura aziendale, incarnando i valori di Integrit√† ‚Äì Collaborazione ‚Äì Curiosit√† ‚Äì Spirito Imprenditoriale ‚Äì Attenzione al Cliente nei rapporti con i colleghi, con i clienti e con la societ√†.

Se ti riconosci nella nostra realt√† e nei nostri valori, se hai l‚Äôambizione di entrare a far parte di un‚Äôazienda dinamica e internazionale e desideri crescere insieme a noi, candidati subito!

I dati personali raccolti ai fini del processo di selezione saranno trattati nel rispetto del Regolamento UE n. 679/2016
