Title: Business Intelligence Developer/Analyst - Sales & Marketing
Description:
Thanks to our innovative BuyNow PayLater payment solution, Scalapay is transforming the way more than 5 million customers buy online and in-store, empowering 8,000+ merchants (online and in-store) to give their customers magical shopping experiences.

Being only 3 years old didn‚Äôt stop us from becoming a unicorn ü¶Ñ We have raised over $700mln and we did this thanks to a team built around our 4 core values: #MakeItHappen #PlayAsATeam #StayCurious #FocusOnCustomer.

This is where your magic happens. If you love it, Scalapay it ‚ô•

Our data team seeks a Business Intelligence Developer/Analyst who will champion a 'data-first' mindset, ensuring precise measurement and reporting of relevant metrics. This role collaborates closely with our Marketing, Sales, and Strategy teams, employing technical expertise to translate concepts into concrete outcomes.

You will:


Serve as the data point of reference for our Marketing and Sales team, providing them with necessary support
Use advanced analytical tools to assess and interpret sales and marketing data, measuring the effectiveness of activities and pinpointing areas for improvement
Build and maintain comprehensive reports and dashboards for our teams to facilitate data-driven decision-making
Translate business questions into analytical solutions, providing actionable insights
Ensure accuracy and reliability in measuring key performance indicators (KPIs) and the underlying data
Identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement in order to propose data-driven recommendations to optimise marketing strategies and sales processes
Conduct hands-on work with data, including data cleansing, transformation, and validation
Help us extend a data-driven mindset throughout Scalapay
Be an active member of the Data team, helping to develop and enhance our suite of Business Intelligence tooling


You‚Äôll be great for this role if:


You have a bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Economics, or related field
You have a minimum of 3 years of experience in a data-driven role, preferably within a Sales and Marketing environment, and ideally with a background in startups or fintech
You have strong SQL skills, Python is a plus
You are proficient in data visualisation tools
You have experience working with CRM tools
You have a background in statistics and can conduct experiments or validate hypotheses
You are fluent in Italian and English: you must be totally confident talking and sharing results in English in a sharp and concise way
You demonstrate outstanding communication skills, both verbally and in writing. You excel at simplifying complex topics into straightforward solutions and ideas
You‚Äôre more than data-driven, you are obsessed with data!


Why you should join Scalapay:


Attractive packages based on skills and experience - the salary band we have for this position is 40'000‚Ç¨-50'000‚Ç¨ (Gross Annual Base)
International environment with significant challenges to be met every day
Lots of opportunities to work with a team of industry tech leaders who are focused on delivering products that offer exceptional user experiences
Personalised support to accelerate your professional growth and take ownership of the products you deliver: we want to help you grow!
Latest technologies and being encouraged to bring your flair to the role.


Recruitment Process:


A quick chat with one of our Talent Acquisition team members
The first interview with the Hiring Manager to dive deep into your experiences and better understand your motivation
A case study to test your hard skills
A final chat with Simone, our CEO


Want to learn more? Don't hesitate to explore our Careers website , our LinkedIn and Glassdoor pages.

Pro tip: send your CV in English üòâ

Super Pro tip: we know that application processes can be scary and frustrating but‚Ä¶ we look for talent, not people that tick all our boxes.

We believe in the power of diversity: Scalapay is an Equal Opportunity Employer for any minority, disability, gender identity or sexual orientation.

Title: Senior BI and Automation Expert
Description:
Cosa farai




I dati hanno un ruolo fondamentale nella strategia di BNP Paribas Cardif in ogni fase della catena del valore assicurativa.

In qualit√† di Senior Business Intelligence & Automation Expert, avrai una responsabilit√† centrale nello sviluppo e nella manutenzione delle soluzioni di reportistica, visualizzazione, automazione di processi e di pipeline di dati.

Ingegneria, matematica, fisica, statistica, computer science). √à richiesta una pregressa esperienza di almeno 4/5 anni di esperienza lavorativa in un ambito similare, possibilmente maturati nel settore assicurativo/finanziario.




Competenze tecniche:

esperienza nella raccolta dei requisiti per la creazione di reportistica e per la visualizzazione tramite strumenti di Business Intelligence;
esperienza nello sviluppo di soluzioni di automazione dati e processi

capacit√† di interfacciarsi con diversi clienti interni e processi complessi, con focus sul delivery;
capacit√† di collaborare con gli altri dipartimenti per garantire la disponibilit√† e la correttezza dei dati
esperienza nella scrittura e manutenzione di documentazione strutturata relativa alle soluzioni sviluppate
esperienza nell'implementazione di soluzioni per migliorare le capacit√† di elaborazione e visualizzazione dei dati
la conoscenza trasversale dei processi assicurativi sar√† considerata un plus







Competenze comportamentali: forte spirito imprenditoriale e motivazione; capacit√† di gestire e risolvere problemi complessi; forti capacit√† comunicative e di influenza; capacit√† di facilitare e gestire cambiamenti operativi e relativi impatti organizzativi; capacit√† di costruire solide relazioni con le diverse aree aziendali; capacit√† di ispirare e motivare, promuovendo entusiasmo e impegno, dando l'esempio, valorizzando i contributi e i successi; forte orientamento al delivery, al raggiungimento dei risultati e a tradurre idee e decisioni in azioni, entro i limiti e le tempistiche stabiliti; grande curiosit√†, agilit√† e passione per le tematiche inerenti i dati.




Competenze linguistiche / informatiche: lingua inglese livello avanzato; la lingua francese √® considerata un plus; esperienza avanzata con tool Power BI (conoscenza approfondita di DAX e Power Query); conoscenza del linguaggio SQL; conoscenza del linguaggio Python; esperienza con i tool di automazione Office 365 (Power Apps, Power Automate, ecc...).










Durata e retribuzione

Il contratto previsto √® a tempo indeterminato, la retribuzione segue quanto previsto dal Contratto Collettivo Nazionale.

Title: Data Engineer ‚Äì PL/SQL
Description:
Sei un/a Data Engineer con la passione per il mondo dei dati e per la Business Intelligence? Spindox ha bisogno di te per rafforzare i suoi team impiegati su numerosi progetti!




Con chi lavorerai e di cosa ti occuperai?

Lavorerai in un contesto fortemente dinamico e innovativo, presso la nostra sede di Milano. Farai parte del Technology Hub appositamente dedicato al mondo dei dati, Data&Analytics, e ti confronterai quotidianamente con altri professionisti del settore, prendendo parte a progetti sfidanti e ambiziosi di Business Intelligence, per importanti clienti multinazionali.




Cosa vorremmo trovare in te?

Laurea in materie STEM o cultura equivalente
Esperienza pregressa di almeno 3 anni nel ruolo
Dimestichezza nello studio, implementazione e ottimizzazione di query complesse (Oracle)
Buona conoscenza linguaggio PL/SQL
Buone doti comunicative e relazionali

Con chi lavorerai e di cosa ti occuperai?

Lavorerai in un contesto fortemente dinamico e innovativo, presso la nostra sede di Milano. Farai parte del Technology Hub appositamente dedicato al mondo dei dati, Data&Analytics, e ti confronterai quotidianamente con altri professionisti del settore, prendendo parte a progetti sfidanti e ambiziosi di Business Intelligence, per importanti clienti multinazionali.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst with a strong finance background to join our team and work on the implementation of our new CRM system for the bank. The ideal candidate will have experience in finance, specifically as an accountant or auditor, and will be responsible for data transfer and integration.




Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with the finance and IT teams to understand data requirements and ensure smooth data transfer during the CRM implementation.
Analyze and validate financial data to ensure accuracy and integrity.
Develop and maintain complex Excel spreadsheets, including pivot tables, data extraction, and VLOOKUP functions.
Utilize SQL and Python to manipulate and analyze data (preferred).
Ensure data quality and consistency throughout the migration process.
Generate reports and provide insights to support decision-making.
Communicate effectively in both French and English with internal and external stakeholders.




Qualifications:

Minimum of 3 years of experience as a Data Analyst in the finance sector (accounting, auditing, etc.).
Strong proficiency in Excel, including pivot tables, data extraction, and VLOOKUP.
Familiarity with SQL and Python is a significant plus.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Bilingual proficiency in French and English is required.




Education:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Finance, Accounting, Data Analytics, or a related field.




Benefits:

Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunities for professional development and career growth.
Friendly and collaborative work environment.

Show more

Title: Junior Data Analyst Consultant
Description:
Line of Service

Advisory

Industry/Sector

Not Applicable

Specialism

Technology Strategy

Management Level

Associate

Job Description & Summary

Contribute to creating a better tomorrow

The only way we can tackle the challenges of this fast-changing world is with passionate people. Led by our purpose of building trust and solving important problems, we come together at PwC to address the biggest issues facing the world in a way that drives positive impact. Are you eager to join a team fuelled by open and curious minds? People who are passionate about their work and create new solutions for a new day? Then you‚Äôre at the right place.

Bring your talent. Learn new skills. Make a positive impact.

PwC Advisory is a garden of possibilities, and you‚Äôre reaping the rewards. Where you want to make an impact is always up to you. With the full support of our Advisory teams, you‚Äôll delve into the inner workings of companies to find the best solutions for any challenge they might have. From the excitement of deals to the complexities of consulting and the fascinating realm of risks and threats in forensics, you‚Äôll help clients nurture trust and maintain their evolutionary edge, today and into the future. Now that‚Äôs making a difference.

We‚Äôre looking for a talented Junior Data Analytics Consultant to join our Technology Consulting department as of September 2024.

Your impact

As a Data Consultant, you‚Äôll make an impact by:


Help clients by providing efficient data analysis to reach a better understanding of their business
Guide clients from strategy through execution when facing digital challenges
Leverage the value of enterprise knowledge and big data to help clients evolve towards insights-driven organisations by going through the whole ‚Äúdata‚Äù range: data architecture, business intelligence, machine learning, data science, visualisation and reporting
Enable business growth for our top tier clients and create unique experiences for their people and customer base
Use your knowledge and expertise to contribute to the success of our projects with and for our clients


About You


You have a bachelor‚Äôs or a master‚Äôs degree in business, data analytics, informatics, engineering or computer sciences, or any other relevant degree that showcases your capabilities
You have a strong interest in technologies and the opportunities they offer as well as a good understanding of how to leverage them
You are fluent in English and Dutch and/or French
You are creative and eager to solve challenging problems
You have an analytical mindset, a can-do attitude and great communication skills
You enjoy being client facing as from day one
You are eager to work in multi-disciplinary teams with consultants from various backgrounds, while also being able to work flexible and independently
You are keen to take on new challenges and to continuously learn
You are sociable and communicative, while embracing an inclusive environment
You are people-oriented and look forward to being part of an international family
You are looking for lifelong experience as well as a learning from failure culture


Life at PwC Belgium

Our culture and workplace are something we‚Äôre proud of. Here‚Äôs a sneak peek at some of the benefits you can look forward to.


Flexibility: flexible working hours so you can decide your most effective working pattern.
Infinite learning and growing: broad opportunities to learn every day and exciting career pathways that help you explore different disciplines or areas of expertise.
Rewards that matter to you: a flexible rewards plan gives you access to a wide range of benefits so you can make the choices that best fit your personal circumstances and lifestyle.
Diversity & inclusion: we believe that diversity makes PwC stronger. It helps us solve important problems and deliver added value to our clients. We encourage an inclusive culture where people can be the best versions of themselves. We organise various D&I initiatives, including an active employee-led Employee Resource Group (ERG) community, comprising 9 diversity groups with over 200 PwC employees aiming to make an impact within and beyond PwC.
A sustainable mobility offer: we offer a comprehensive mobility budget with a wide range of options (hybrid and electric cars, bike leasing, mobility card or loan reimbursement).
Well-being: an extensive health and well-being programme that includes access to professional sport coaching, individual sessions, sports communities and mental health resources. We encourage a healthy lifestyle with regular wellness challenges and various catering options at our cafeteria.
Team events such as Last Friday Drinks, quarterly themed parties, team-building days and celebrations, as well as time spent on community days and charity activities.
International PwC network: broad access to industry expertise, both locally and through our wider global network of member firms.
Supporting you in every phase of your life, including family friendly work schemes.

Degrees/Field of Study required:

Degrees/Field of Study preferred:

Certifications (if blank, certifications not specified)

Required Skills

Optional Skills

Desired Languages (If blank, desired languages not specified)

Travel Requirements

0%

No

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Nexeo is currently looking for a Data Analyst (Freelance or permanent) for a market leader in the banking industry in Belgium.




Nexeo Belgium is a consultancy company that supports its clients in the banking, finance and insurance sectors in all phases of their transformation projects: from business consulting to the implementation of IT solutions.¬†




As a consultant you will have the opportunity to be part of Nexeo:

International environment ( Offices in France, Belgium, Luxembourg, Switzerland & Canada)
+ 450 employees
over 20% growth each year




The ideal candidate will use their passion for big data and analytics to provide insights to the business covering a range of topics. They will be responsible for conducting both recurring and ad hoc analysis for business users.¬†

¬†

Responsibilities

Understand the day-to-day issues that the bank faces
Performs cleansing of data quality issues through the analysi
Monitors the data quality based on data quality dashboards, supports redesign & upgrade
Contributes to designing, monitoring and reporting on common reference tools
Contributes to raising awareness of the importance of data quality
Will be involved in all the topics related to Customer Data
Business Analysis
Work in collaboration with other technical teams to share data
Data extraction with SAS
Industrialize the process to run define periodicity
Document the project (functional and technical part)
Contribute to the achievement of the team objectives




Qualifications

Bachelor's or Master's degree
At least 3 years¬†of experience in Data Analysis (focus data quality & data governance)
Understand data lifecycle and data usage
Working in Agile environnement (Jira & Scrum)
Good experience working with SQL Queries & SAS
English Fluent & French or Dutch native

Nexeo is currently looking for a Data Analyst (Freelance or permanent) for a market leader in the banking industry in Belgium.


Nexeo Belgium is a consultancy company that supports its clients in the banking, finance and insurance sectors in all phases of their transformation projects: from business consulting to the implementation of IT solutions. 


As a consultant you will have the opportunity to be part of Nexeo:

  • International environment ( Offices in France, Belgium, Luxembourg, Switzerland & Canada)
  • + 450 employees
  • over 20% growth each year


The ideal candidate will use their passion for big data and analytics to provide insights to the business covering a range of topics. They will be responsible for conducting both recurring and ad hoc analysis for business users. 

 

Responsibilities

  • Understand the day-to-day issues that the bank faces
  • Performs cleansing of data quality issues through the analysi
  • Monitors the data quality based on data quality dashboards, supports redesign & upgrade
  • Contributes to designing, monitoring and reporting on common reference tools
  • Contributes to raising awareness of the importance of data quality
  • Will be involved in all the topics related to Customer Data
  • Business Analysis
  • Work in collaboration with other technical teams to share data
  • Data extraction with SAS
  • Industrialize the process to run define periodicity
  • Document the project (functional and technical part)
  • Contribute to the achievement of the team objectives


Qualifications

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree
  • At least 3 years of experience in Data Analysis (focus data quality & data governance)
  • Understand data lifecycle and data usage
  • Working in Agile environnement (Jira & Scrum)
  • Good experience working with SQL Queries & SAS
  • English Fluent & French or Dutch native

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
About Akkodis




Akkodis, is a global leader in the engineering and R&D market that is leveraging the power of connected data to accelerate innovation and digital transformation. With a shared passion for technology and talent, 50,000 engineers and digital experts deliver deep cross-sector expertise in 30 countries across North America, EMEA and APAC. Akkodis offers broad industry experience, and strong know-how in key technology sectors such as mobility, software & technology services, robotics, testing, simulations, data security, AI & data analytics. The combined IT and engineering expertise brings a unique end-to-end solution offering, with four service lines ‚Äì Consulting, Solutions, Talents and Academy ‚Äì to support clients in rethinking their product development and business processes, improve productivity, minimize time to market and shape a smarter and more sustainable tomorrow.

About Akkodis


Akkodis, is a global leader in the engineering and R&D market that is leveraging the power of connected data to accelerate innovation and digital transformation. With a shared passion for technology and talent, 50,000 engineers and digital experts deliver deep cross-sector expertise in 30 countries across North America, EMEA and APAC. Title: Data Analyst
Description:
As a pivotal member of our Finance team, you will harness the power of data to transform complex financial information into clear, actionable insights that propel our organization forward. They will serve as the linchpin in bridging the theoretical frameworks and practical applications of data governance, ensuring robust and compliant data practices. Collaborating closely with our agile Scrum teams, they will spearhead the development and implementation of cutting-edge AI and BI use cases, driving innovation and enhancing our data-driven decision-making capabilities.

Detailled tasks


Convert the theoretical data governance framework of data owners, data stewards and data custodians into a data culture where Finance employees are empowered by their data governance responsibilities and experiences.
Encourage and support experimentation and innovation in data practices, aligning with the organization's mission for sustainability and operational excellence.
Extract and interpret financial data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can inform strategic decisions.
Work closely with the Scrum teams to integrate AI and BI solutions into business processes and workflows.
Provide training and support to team members on data analysis tools and methodologies.
Identify opportunities for leveraging AI and BI to improve financial processes and outcome in line with our company wide AI program.
Monitor and ensure data quality within the department.
Advocate for data stewardship and encourage proactive data management.
Facilitate effective communication and collaboration between business units and their respective data stewards.
Actively work to improve data management KPIs within the department by ensuring all data-related activities are executed effectively and efficiently.
Work transversally across departments to identify and address data silos.


Profile

A degree in Finance, economics, computer science, data science, or a related field.

Competences:


Ability to think strategically and align data initiatives with organizational goals and objectives
Proficiency in transforming complex datasets into actionable insights and familiarity with statistical analysis tools and methodologies
Strong knowledge of data governance principles and practices, including data quality, and data management requirements
Experience in developing and implementing AI and BI solutions, with an understanding of Machine Learning algorithms and Business Intelligence platforms
Good communication and presentation skills
Ability to influence and drive change within the department
Familiarity with Scrum and agile methodologies, and the ability to work effectively within cross-functional teams
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities
Proficiency with data analysis and visualization tools, such as SQL, Python, R, Tableau, or Power BI
Excellent collaborative skills and ability to maintain positive work relationships
A commitment to continuous learning and staying updated with the latest trends and technologies in data analysis and governance


Knowledge:


Understanding of (financial) data analysis and its application in driving strategic business decisions.
Familiarity with data governance principles and the ability to bridge theory and practice.
Knowledge of AI and BI tools and methodologies for developing use cases and solutions.
Awareness of agile and Scrum methodologies, particularly in the context of cross-functional team collaboration.


Experience


Experience in transforming (Finance) data into actionable insights.
Practical experience with data governance and ensuring data compliance within an organization.
Hands-on experience in facilitating and developing AI and BI use cases.
Proven track record of working closely with Scrum teams to deliver data-driven projects

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Experience

Mandatory

- Several years of hands-on experience in data analysis and data science projects, ideally in marketing and sales domain

Technical Skills

Mandatory

- Strong knowledge of predictive modeling, including steps to build models and best practices like cross-validation

- Experience with various machine learning algorithms and feature selection techniques

- Hands-on experience in A/B testing

- Knowledge of regression analysis

- Experience in data modeling, beyond just data visualization

- Experience in data modeling, beyond just data visualization

Technical Skills

Nice to have

- Experience in some kind of coding: Python / R

- Experience in some Marketing Automation tools like SFMC / SF / Adobe Campaign / Marketo / Data Cloud / etc

Business Acumen

Mandatory

- Understanding of relevant marketing and sales KPIs

- Ability to derive insights and recommendations for business from data

Soft Skills

Mandatory

- Strong communication skills to explain complex analyses in simple terms

- Willingness to learn and adapt to new technologies and tools

- Passion for data and leveraging it to optimize the business

Title: Data & Insights Analyst
Description:
You‚Äôll be part of the Strategy team, working closely with senior management and focusing on the business lines of Telenet, BASE, and Tadaam for both segments: a) residential and b) SOHO (small office home office).




Here are some key points about the role:

Your tasks as a Data & Insights Analyst

Identify & Prioritize Insights: Work with business unit‚Äôs facilitators and senior management to determine key insights and reporting needs.
Build & Communicate Dashboards: Create and share KPI dashboards that map business unit‚Äôs performance.
Recommend Improvements: Proactively suggest areas for performance enhancement.
Collaborate on Deep Dives: Work with Data & Insights specialists to synthesize complex insights into actionable recommendations.
Monitor Business Planning: Assist with budget and forecast updates, creating insights with business stakeholders.
Support Colleagues: Help business colleagues with self-service tools.




What we have to offer

Strategic Department: Gain a broad view of strategic projects and P&Ls.
Personal Development: Opportunities for internal mobility and extensive learning opportunities. Along with chance to press the pause button after a while or take another path.
Work-Life Balance: A supportive environment that adapts to your needs.
Financial incentives: A competitive gross monthly salary that we complement with a lot of fringe benefits (meal vouchers, cell phone, option for a car, hospitalization insurance, telephone subscription, discounts on Telenet products, possibility to work from home,.).

It‚Äôs a dynamic and fast-paced environment where you can grow and make a significant impact. Does this role align with what you‚Äôre looking for in your next career move?




Our ideal D&I Analyst has ‚Ä¶

Minimum 2-3 years' experience as a data or business analyst or similar roles
Master's degree in an economic, technical or economic field (Commercial Engineering, Applied Economics, Computer Science, Digital...) or similar experience
Excellent presentation and storytelling skills. We value different points of view.
Strong analytical & result oriented skills
Can naturally assume problem solving thinking and has great impact on decision makers
Knowledge and experience in telecom, media or consulting or similar industries is a plus




Apply? Good idea!

Fancy a job with content and variety? Become D&I Analyst at Telenet. Apply now!

Title: Data Analyst / BI Analyst / Business Intelligence
Description:
My client is a leading Utilities organisation in the centre of Brussels searching for a strong Data/Business Intelligence Analyst on an initial 12 month contract with plenty of scope for extension.

Key Skills


Microsoft Excel
Power BI - Must have skill
Minimum 3-5 Years experience
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Dutch speaking - Bonus (not a necessity)
1-2 Days onsite per week, rest remote


Key responsibilities

Performance Analysis:


Monitor the correct execution of the day-to-day commercial processes and proactively identify and react on potential problems.
Conduct in-depth analysis of the companys commercial performance metrics (e.g. value capture, revenue per product, customer bidding behaviour,...).
Identify areas for improvement and provide actionable insights that could lead to enhanced commercial performance.
Perform competitive benchmarking.
Validate monthly Sales invoices.


Financial Modelling:


Develop and maintain financial models to support revenue forecasting, budgeting, and scenario analysis.
Provide financial insights to support commercial negotiations and decision-making related to auction strategy, new products, ancillary service tenders...).


Reporting and Data Warehouse:


Prepare and deliver regular reports on commercial performance and relevant market information to internal stakeholders (e.g. Management Committee, Board of Directors...).
Deliver the recurring external reports (e.g. imbalance reporting)
Provide Finance with the monthly revenue forecasts.
Provide ad-hoc reporting on the results of important auctions.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Passionate people create exceptional things

Did you know that the solutions we develop are a key part of most industries? We¬¥re everywhere! Working with us means that you can make an impact towards a sustainable future.
Here, your ideas are embraced, you never stop learning, and you can be part of the solution for a better tomorrow.

Join us and make the difference

Your Role

The Smart Compressors team in Engineering in Industrial Air enables (remote) control and monitoring, collects insights into the machines and allows them to communicate with its environment, all to turn it into a state-of-the-art smart compressor.
As a member of this team in Engineering in Industrial Air, you will collaborate globally to maximize and expand the potential of data in machines.
You implement, help and (once fully trained) coordinate data-driven tasks for our compressors.
You explore machine data and gain new insights, and you develop new processes that ensure that data provides better visibility into the performance of our current and future compressors.
There will be a wide variety of data tasks in terms of complexity, timeline, and overall data set size.
The goal is to implement your findings into tangible business value, such as: proactively guaranteeing machine uptime, and using data to pitch new functionalities that make our smart compressor even smarter.
You will work within engineering, a diverse group of experts and project engineers, who work together in a family-like atmosphere. You are encouraged to develop yourself, provide valuable input and receive a godmother/-father to help you on your way. You participate in projects that impact our business and ensure the sustainability of our planet.

To succeed, you will need


You have a Master's degree in Computer Science, Data engineering or similar through experience.
You enjoy working with data and have a passion for technology.
You find it important to work with different people and you feel good in a team.
You dare to build new methods and want to improve processes.
You can program with Python, SQL and are familiar with Azure.
You can visualize data with Power BI, or are willing to learn this.
You speak English, Dutch is an added value.
MS Office (PowerPoint, Excel, Word) and other O365 applications have no secrets for you.
You are interested in artificial intelligence and machine learning.



In return, we offer you


A supportive working environment, within a high performing team.
A satisfying career ‚Äì We are passionate about the development & progression of our employees.



Diverse by nature and inclusive by choice

Bright ideas come from all of us. We recognize that our long-term success depends on how we behave towards our colleagues, business partners, society and the planet.
Together we build a culture where difference is valued, we share a deep sense of purpose and belonging, and we can be part of the solution for a better tomorrow.
Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Joining Collibra‚Äôs Product Operations team

Collibra brings trust to data and AI through flexible and governed catalog, continuous quality and built-in privacy for the world‚Äôs leading brands. Headquartered in New York City and Brussels, Collibra works with 700+ customers worldwide and partners with the most innovative companies. We are on a mission to unite organizations with data that's easy to find, understand, trust and access.

Collibra brings trust to data and AI through flexible and governed catalog, continuous quality and built-in privacy for the world‚Äôs leading brands. Headquartered in New York City and Brussels, Collibra works with 700+ customers worldwide and partners with the most innovative companies. We are on a mission to unite organizations with data that's easy to find, understand, trust and access.

The team: Collibra‚Äôs Product Operations team works at the intersection of Product, Customer Success, Sales, and Engineering. Our mission is to be a trusted partner, providing processes and information that deliver a better experience and more value to our customers, faster.

The role: We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to analyze our product usage, content, and operational data, and work with stakeholders to drive efficiency, quality, and scale.

You will report to the VP of Product Operations and work primarily with stakeholders across all functions in Product. Additionally, you will collaborate closely with other Business and Data Intelligence Analysts across Collibra to develop a culture of data-driven decision-making.

The BI Analyst at Collibra is responsible for


Working hand-in-hand with subject matter experts to define key metrics and data gathering methodologies for various exciting initiatives, focusing mainly on product, customer, and user analytics.
Designing, developing, and continuously improving useful and user-friendly reporting and analytics solutions.
Creating engaging dashboards and visualizations to showcase key metrics.
Turning complex data findings into clear, actionable recommendations for internal stakeholders and leaders.


You have


2+ years of experience in analytics and reporting, preferably in a SaaS context.
Deep appreciation for data. You understand more than most that good data leads to outcomes, and want to learn with the best.
Experience in data exploration and wrangling. You can interrogate data stored in relational databases with SQL and productionalize data pipelines using tools like dbt. Programming experience with Python and/or Java is a plus.
Experience in data modeling. You operate with an understanding of thoughtful model design, query performance, and code maintainability.
Exposure to SaaS productivity tools. You‚Äôve used or understand the purpose of tools like Jira, Salesforce, Pendo, Centercode, Aha!, Zendesk and Collibra.
A bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent related working experience is required


You are


A story teller, with experience visualizing data effectively. You can make data tell the story, using business intelligence tools like Tableau, Looker or Power BI.
A builder, creating data products to solve problems and unlock growth.
An excellent communicator. You can present your ideas succinctly and effectively in excellent written and spoken English. Other languages are a plus‚Äîour team speaks over seven!
A customer champion, translating usage patterns into product improvements.
A team player, helping us grow our business and growing with it.


Measures of success


First Month: Build relationships within the Product Operations team, understand our product tools, processes, and data landscape, and start supporting existing reporting initiatives.
Third Month: Establish relationships with key SMEs, continuously improve existing reporting initiatives, and start developing your own.
Sixth Month: Successfully roll out your first data product for Product & Engineering.


Compensation for this role

This position is not eligible for additional commission-based compensation. Salary offers are based on a combination of factors, including, but not limited to, experience, skills, and location.

In addition to base salary, we offer equity ownership at every level, bonus potential, a Flex Fund monthly stipend, pension/401k plans, and more.

Benefits

Collibra recognizes and values that everyone has different needs, interests, and life goals. We built our {Be}well benefits program with flexibility in mind to support you and your loved ones through a diverse range of circumstances and life events. These flexible offerings sit on a foundation of competitive compensation, health coverage, and time off.

Professional Development

Collibrians are ambitious and inventive, and we want to develop our skills individually and as a team. You‚Äôll have access to development opportunities, as well as other rewards and recognition programs to help grow your career.

Health Coverage

We strive to remain locally competitive and globally equitable. This means comprehensive offerings including medical, dental, vision, and mental health benefits for you and your family.

Paid Time Off and Flexibility

We provide unlimited paid time off, global leave policies for a variety of personal and family circumstances, company-wide wellness days off throughout the year, meeting-free Wednesdays, and a flexible culture to help balance your work and your life.

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

We create inclusion and belonging through how we onboard, meet, connect, engage, and communicate. Learn more about diversity, equity, and inclusion at Collibra.

Learn More About Collibra‚Äôs Benefits.

At Collibra, we‚Äôre proud to be an equal opportunity employer ‚Äì which ties directly to our core value, ‚Äúopen, direct, and kind.‚Äù We realize the key to creating a company with a world-class culture and employee experience comes from who we hire and creating a workplace that celebrates everyone.

With this, we proudly consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, pregnancy, sex, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, physical or mental disability, HIV status, registered domestic partner status, caregiver status, marital status, veteran or military status, citizenship status or any other legally protected category. If you have a need that requires accommodation, let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

Joining Collibra‚Äôs Product Operations team

Collibra brings trust to data and AI through flexible and governed catalog, continuous quality and built-in privacy for the world‚Äôs leading brands. Headquartered in New York City and Brussels, Collibra works with 700+ customers worldwide and partners with the most innovative companies. We are on a mission to unite organizations with data that's easy to find, understand, trust and access.

Collibra brings trust to data and AI through flexible and governed catalog, continuous quality and built-in privacy for the world‚Äôs leading brands. Headquartered in New York City and Brussels, Collibra works with 700+ customers worldwide and partners with the most innovative companies. We are on a mission to unite organizations with data that's easy to find, understand, trust and access.

The team: Collibra‚Äôs Product Operations team works at the intersection of Product, Customer Success, Sales, and Engineering. Our mission is to be a trusted partner, providing processes and information that deliver a better experience and more value to our customers, faster.

The role: We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to analyze our product usage, content, and operational data, and work with stakeholders to drive efficiency, quality, and scale.

You will report to the VP of Product Operations and work primarily with stakeholders across all functions in Product. Additionally, you will collaborate closely with other Business and Data Intelligence Analysts across Collibra to develop a culture of data-driven decision-making.

The BI Analyst at Collibra is responsible for

  • Working hand-in-hand with subject matter experts to define key metrics and data gathering methodologies for various exciting initiatives, focusing mainly on product, customer, and user analytics.
  • Designing, developing, and continuously improving useful and user-friendly reporting and analytics solutions.
  • Creating engaging dashboards and visualizations to showcase key metrics.
  • Turning complex data findings into clear, actionable recommendations for internal stakeholders and leaders.

You have

  • 2+ years of experience in analytics and reporting, preferably in a SaaS context.
  • Deep appreciation for data. You understand more than most that good data leads to outcomes, and want to learn with the best.
  • Experience in data exploration and wrangling. You can interrogate data stored in relational databases with SQL and productionalize data pipelines using tools like dbt. Programming experience with Python and/or Java is a plus.
  • Experience in data modeling. You operate with an understanding of thoughtful model design, query performance, and code maintainability.
  • Exposure to SaaS productivity tools. You‚Äôve used or understand the purpose of tools like Jira, Salesforce, Pendo, Centercode, Aha!, Zendesk and Collibra.
  • A bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent related working experience is required

You are

  • A story teller, with experience visualizing data effectively. You can make data tell the story, using business intelligence tools like Tableau, Looker or Power BI.
  • A builder, creating data products to solve problems and unlock growth.
  • An excellent communicator. You can present your ideas succinctly and effectively in excellent written and spoken English. Other languages are a plus‚Äîour team speaks over seven!
  • A customer champion, translating usage patterns into product improvements.
  • A team player, helping us grow our business and growing with it.

Measures of success

  • First Month: Build relationships within the Product Operations team, understand our product tools, processes, and data landscape, and start supporting existing reporting initiatives.
  • Third Month: Establish relationships with key SMEs, continuously improve existing reporting initiatives, and start developing your own.
  • Sixth Month: Successfully roll out your first data product for Product & Engineering.

Compensation for this role

This position is not eligible for additional commission-based compensation. Salary offers are based on a combination of factors, including, but not limited to, experience, skills, and location.

In addition to base salary, we offer equity ownership at every level, bonus potential, a Flex Fund monthly stipend, pension/401k plans, and more.

Title: Azure Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Devoteam is a leading consulting firm focused on digital strategy, tech platforms and cybersecurity. By combining creativity, tech and data insights, we empower our customers to transform their business and unlock the future.

With 25 years‚Äô experience and 10,000 employees across Europe, the Middle East and Africa, Devoteam promotes responsible tech for people and works to create better change.

Join our global community of exceptional talents at Devoteam, where you‚Äôll collaborate with multidisciplinary teams of data specialists, business consultants, solution architects, security experts, cloud engineers, developers, and more across over 20 countries in the EMEA region. As a member of our team, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to work with the world‚Äôs leading partners, including AWS, Google Cloud, Microsoft, and ServiceNow, driving innovation and advancing your career.


Job Description

If you like these keywords, you‚Äôll love this role:

#data #azure #PowerBI #Reporting #Dashboarding #DataWarehouse #DataMart #StarSchema

Dreaming about exploring the data understanding how the business works? Do you enjoy telling a story around data? Do you enjoy figuring out how to calculate the needed KPI? We are currently looking for an Azure Data Analyst who can support our customers by telling a story around data by creating reports and dashboards.

Do you have experience with Power BI or with a similar reporting tool? Are you also interested in supporting our Azure Data Engineer team computing the right data set? Are you attracted by new technologies and new methodologies? You‚Äôre a good candidate to be our future colleague!

As an Azure Data Analyst, you will be a crucial part of our key projects for our data solutions. You will be in front of the customer understanding their need, creating the correct report and guiding our Azure Data Engineer to prepare properly the needed data.


Qualifications

For this position, we‚Äôre looking for all seniority levels.¬†

[Must-have] Hands-on experience with Power BI, SQL Server Reporting Services or Tableau
[Must-have] Hands-on experience with MS SQL querying language (T-SQL)
[Must-have] Hands-on experience modeling a datawarehouse/datamart in Star Schema
[Must-have] Knowledge about modeling techniques like data vault, Merise/3NF
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience creating Azure resources for a data cloud solution.
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience building data pipeline with some Azure data tools (Azure Data Factory, Synapse, Azure Data Lake‚Ä¶)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with the DataBricks environment (Delta Live Table, Workflows, SQL Warehouse)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with MS SQL Server suite (SSIS, SSAS)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with Python and PySpark
[Nice-to-have] You‚Äôre ready to drive change and bring creative tech ideas to life.
[Nice-to-have] You‚Äôre either proficient in Dutch or French (or you want to learn) and fluent in English.
[Bonus-points] Azure certified (or willing to obtain). Certifications in scope: PL-300, DP-203



If you do not feel fully confident that you meet the requirements above, please don‚Äôt worry. Just apply. Together we‚Äôll discover what you can bring to the table, in which role you would fit best and how you could potentially grow at Devoteam.

Our promises to you

As a digital native you will have a positive impact at top organizations in Belgium.
Direct access to the Microsoft organization and programs thanks to our global partnership.
Prepare to inspire and be inspired by other Devoteamers in tech communities.
We enable local and international collaboration and exchange with other tech leaders and specialists, knowledge sharing, peer-to-peer coaching.
A personalized career plan with training offers in soft- & hard skills and certifications aligned to your needs & expertise.
Our servant leadership supports opportunities to grow your personal brand through blogs, keynote sessions, and more.


Additional Information

#techies in our minds, #creatives in our hearts, #change in our DNA.

Why choose us?

Cutting-edge Technology: Embrace the latest advancements in IT and digital technologies as we constantly innovate to stay ahead of the competition. Our commitment to adopting state-of-the-art tools and methodologies ensures that you'll work on projects at the forefront of the industry.
Entrepreneur mindset: We value our people over processes. You will develop and grow in an agile and ambitious company where it‚Äôs okay to take risks, make mistakes and change plans to find transformative solutions. At the same time, you will learn from the best, building relationships and skills that will last your entire career.
Endless Learning Opportunities: We value personal and professional growth. Through workshops, conferences, and certifications, we offer the resources needed to expand your skill set and reach new heights in your career.
Connect with amazing people: You will become part of a network of +10,000 Devoteamers spread over 20 countries.
Collaborative Culture: Teamwork is at the heart of our organisation. You'll be working side by side with a diverse group of IT experts who share your passion for excellence and will inspire you to think outside the box.
Impactful Projects: Tackle real-world challenges that matter! From revolutionising business processes to developing innovative solutions, you'll have the chance to make a genuine and positive impact on our clients and the community.
Work-Life Balance: We believe in a healthy work-life balance, ensuring that you have time to unwind, pursue your hobbies, and spend quality time with loved ones.
Inspiring and eco-friendly workplace: We just moved to an amazing new building. We believe an inspiring workspace fuels creativity and fosters a positive work culture, allowing our employees to reach their full potential. The Wings building is also designed with eco-friendly features and energy-efficient systems. By reducing our ecological footprint, we are contributing to a greener future and aligning our business practices with our environmental values. The building is also very easily accessible by public transportation.¬†
Competitive package: We offer a competitive salary package with additional benefits like a company car, smartphone, medical insurance, pension plan, net allowance, laptop, meal vouchers, etc. We review our salary grid twice a year to ensure we are in line with the market.

At Devoteam, we combine strong values ‚Äì respect, frankness, ambition, entrepreneurship & collaboration - with a fun environment that empowers you to innovate and succeed.

>>> Does all this sound compelling to you? Go for it and click that apply button!

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (Remote)
Description:
We're looking for a Marketing Data Analyst who is passionate about their work, adapts easily, and shares our company values!

A little bit about us

Leadtech has been fostering and developing innovative digital businesses across several industries since 2009. It has since then expanded to a team of over 500 committed employees working all over Spain. We are thrilled to have more than 23 nationalities working together and very proud to see that our products and services are enjoyed by millions of users monthly around the globe.

How you will make a difference:

Measure the performance of marketing campaigns, build ad hoc custom reports, and analyze anomalies and trends.
Preparation of analytical reports and dashboards (including visualization) for the marketing team.
Creation of Google Sheets scripts to connect data from different reports and Google Sheets.
High experience and skill level in Microsoft Excel / Google Sheets.
Analysis of product & marketing metrics correlation and identification of their drivers.
Analysis and identification of user behavior patterns based on product & marketing analytics and forming hypotheses for the marketing team based on these insights
Develop the SKAN measurement approach for Google, Meta and Tiktok.
Deeply understand the process of acquisition of users in order to analyze/provide valuable proposals
Manage MMP Tools (Adjust), and provide technical support and troubleshooting for the marketing team, specifically related to app attribution, event tracking, and callback implementations.
Analyze performance impact of any product and marketing strategy changes.
Cooperate with Marketing and Product teams to actively increase project profitability¬†
Collaborate with the BI department to create and maintain data visualization dashboards.





Requirements


Bachelor degree in STEM field or similar
Experience working as Analyst of at least 3 years
Strong knowledge of app attribution tools commonly used in the mobile advertising industry.
Strong knowledge of machine learning and statistics techniques.
Strong communication skills and the ability to translate technical findings into clear business recommendations.
In-depth understanding of digital marketing strategies including down funnel analysis, as well technical knowledge of iOS and Android marketing analysis to tailor strategies for both platforms.
Experience working with data visualization tools
Experience with setting up and managing event tracking in mobile apps. Especially with a focus on SKAN, Firebase, Meta etc.
Teamwork and collaboration skills to work closely with other data professionals and cross-functional teams.
Proactive attitude and results-oriented.



Benefits



Perks of being one of us

Full-time, permanent contract
Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off
Remote work
Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m)
Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!)
Enhanced career path designed just for you
External training budget
We celebrate all company landmarks

Sounds good? Apply now! We're looking forward to getting to know you.


Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

  • Strong communication skills and the ability to translate technical findings into clear business recommendations.
  • In-depth understanding of digital marketing strategies including down funnel analysis, as well technical knowledge of iOS and Android marketing analysis to tailor strategies for both platforms.
  • Experience working with data visualization tools
  • Experience with setting up and managing event tracking in mobile apps. Especially with a focus on SKAN, Firebase, Meta etc.
  • Teamwork and collaboration skills to work closely with other data professionals and cross-functional teams.
  • Proactive attitude and results-oriented.


Benefits

Perks of being one of us

  • Full-time, permanent contract
  • Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off
  • Remote work
  • Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m)
  • Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!)
  • Enhanced career path designed just for you
  • External training budget
  • We celebrate all company landmarks

Sounds good? Apply now! We're looking forward to getting to know you.


Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
SII Belgium is currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced Big Data to join our team. As a Big Data Analyst, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing big data solutions to support business objectives. You will work with large, complex data sets and be responsible for analyzing and interpreting data to identify trends and insights. . You would join various teams working in the Energy, Retail, Banking or Telecom sectors.

SII is a European digital and engineering services company of 16,000 experts. SII Belgium supports large businesses in adopting new technologies and innovation management. SII values empowerment and entrepreneurship, providing a fulfilling work environment for employees. Our mission is to contribute to the design and development of future products and services for customers. SII is committed to a sustainable digital world and is recognized as a great workplace.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Key Responsibilities


Develop and maintain big data solutions to support business objectives
Analyze and interpret large, complex data sets to identify trends and insights
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and implement data-driven solutions
Create and maintain data visualization and reporting tools to support decision-making
Integration‚ÄØbetween enterprise architecture and data collection.
Stay up to date with industry trends and technologies to identify new opportunities for data analysis


Qualifications


You hold a bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in IT.
Minimum of 3 years of experience working with data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, Hive‚Ä¶
Strong analytical skills and experience using statistical techniques to interpret data
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools such as Tableau and Power BI
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French, and fluent in English.


We Offer


A challenging and varied role in a growing company
Opportunity to work with the latest technologies
Competitive salary and benefits
Opportunity to improve your skills and knowledge through training and education
Warm and open company culture, supported by an international group


If you are passionate about Data and want to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity at SII Belgium.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Functie:

De afdeling Data and Analytics is het kloppend hart van Colruyt Group in het omgaan met informatie. Als Data Analist ontwikkel je BI-producten, analyseer je data en maak je deze inzichtelijk voor je eindgebruikers. Een leerrijke job met ruimte voor initiatief en verrijkende samenwerkingen!

Een greep uit jouw takenpakket:

Als Data Analist ga je in overleg met onze interne partners en directies om hun noden te verzamelen voor het bouwen van rapporten, cockpits en dashboards.
Je bent ook bij het verdere gehele proces betrokken. Dat betekent van het analyseren van datanoden tot het presenteren van de rapporten. Hierin werk je nauw samen met verschillende stakeholders zoals analisten, developers, projectmanagers en eindgebruikers.
Je ontwerpt, ontwikkelt en onderhoudt de semantische laag, de SAP BO Universe, die afgestemd is op het onderliggende datamodel.
Je stelt testscenario‚Äôs op en levert de nodige steun voor de validering van de producten.
Je documenteert de producten en leidt de eindgebruikers op zodat ze zich ermee vertrouwd voelen.
Je neemt deel aan de Business Intelligence-ombudswerking waarin je op basis van incidenten technische/functionele problemen analyseert en corrigerende acties uitvoert.

Je werkt op ons hoofdkantoor te Halle en kan tot 3 dagen per week van thuis uit werken.




Profiel:

Kennis en ervaring ‚Äì Je hebt een bachelor- of masterdiploma in bv. informatiemanagement of een andere data-gedreven studie, of hebt gelijkwaardige ervaring. Minstens 3 jaar ervaring in Power BI en/of Tableau en SQL is een must.
Communicatief ‚Äì Je bent communicatief ingesteld, bent een echte teamspeler, en legt vlot contact. Je capteert vlot noden bij je eindgebruikers en overlegt regelmatig. Je zoekt actief naar de beste oplossing.
Analytisch en conceptueel ‚Äì Je haalt vlot de te behandelen delen uit een complex gegeven en kan oorzaak en gevolg onderscheiden. Daarnaast heb je snel inzicht in complexe kwesties en plaats je de zaken in een breder perspectief.
Kwaliteit ‚Äì Je hebt een end-to-end mentaliteit en gaat steeds voor de hoogste kwaliteit in wat je oplevert. Je denkt vanuit oplossingen en bewaakt de balans tussen de wensen van je eindgebruikers en optimalisaties die tijdens het proces kunnen opduiken.
Talen ‚Äì Je communiceert vlot in het Nederlands en Engels, zodat je met al je collega‚Äôs en stakeholders goed kan samenwerken.




Wij bieden:

Aantrekkelijk loonpakket ‚Äì Je ontvangt een aantrekkelijk loonpakket, gecombineerd met extralegale voordelen zoals een bedrijfswagen, maaltijdcheques, winstdeelname en een hospitalisatieverzekering.
Opleidingen en leertrajecten ‚Äì Wij voorzien opleidingen die aansluiten bij je ervaring en behoeften. Je krijgt alle mogelijkheden om jezelf te ontplooien, zowel op professioneel als persoonlijk vlak.
Eigen verantwoordelijkheden - We geven je de kans om je eigen verantwoordelijkheden op te nemen, maar ook om je eigen idee√´n en initiatieven mee vorm te geven.
Stimulerende werkomgeving ‚Äì Je werkt in een klein en divers team met collega‚Äôs die over verschillende vaardigheden beschikken.

Werken bij Colruyt Group, dat is elke dag onze missie waarmaken: samen duurzaam meerwaarde cre√´ren. Wij zorgen voor ondersteuning en kansen, jij kan initiatief nemen en idee√´n voorstellen. Wij ondersteunen je groei, want als jij groeit, dan doen wij dat ook.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Airalo

Alo! Airalo is the world‚Äôs first eSIM store that helps people connect in over 200+ countries and regions across the globe. We are building the next digital service that revolutionizes the telecom industry. We are a travel-tech company and an equal-opportunity environment that values and executes diversity, inclusion, and equity. Our team is spread across 50+ countries and six continents. What glues us together is our commitment to changing the way you connect .

About You

We hope that you care deeply about the quality of your work, the intrinsic worth of tasks, and the success of your team. You are self-disciplined and do not require micromanagement in terms of your skillset and work ethic. You do your best to flourish as an individual every day while working hard to foster a collaborative team environment. You believe in the importance of being ‚Äî and staying ‚Äî authentic, honest, positive, and kind. You are a good interlocutor with clear and concise communication. You are able to manage multiple projects, have an analytical mind, pay keen attention to detail, and love to get your hands dirty. You are cognizant, tolerant, and welcoming of vulnerabilities and cultural differences.

About The Role

Position: Full-time / Employee

Location: Remote-first

Benefits: Health Insurance, work-from-anywhere stipend, annual wellness & learning credits, annual all-expenses-paid company retreat in a gorgeous destination & other benefits

As a Data Analyst, you have strong analytical and technical skills and are comfortable collaborating with various departments including Product, Engineering, Design, Growth, Finance, and Partnerships. You will provide actionable insights to drive decision-making and help shape the Airalo strategy and roadmaps across departments. You will play a key role in further growing our Data Analytics function and help us define best practices to improve our ways of working. You‚Äôll be the go-to person in the team to run ad-hoc analyses, find root causes of problems, and evaluate business impact.

Responsibilities Include, But Are Not Limited To


Collaborate with multiple departments to understand their data analysis needs and provide strategic insights to support decision-making, define strategy and prioritize roadmaps
Serve as the primary point of contact for ad-hoc analyses, root cause analysis, and evaluation of business impact across the company
Partner with Product, Engineering, and Design to define tracking, AB testing strategy, and measure post-launch feature and product impact
Develop data dashboards, charts, and visual aids to support decision-making across departments
Convey insights through both reports and visual presentations.
Create documentation associated with the dashboards highlighting definitions, event schema, data models, analyses
Gather and cleanse data from primary and secondary sources



Must-haves


4+ years of experience in a hands-on analytics role
Strong ability to synthesize data into actionable insights
Strong SQL proficiency and understanding of data modeling concepts
Experience with using data visualization tools and analytics tools
A clear understanding of A/B testing methodologies
Demonstrate curiosity and data fluency
Bachelor‚Äôs degree (or equivalent) in mathematics, computer science, economics, or statistics



Good To Haves


Experience using QuickSight, CleverTap, Hotjar, Google Analytics
Experience with consumer and SaaS products
Prior work experience in telecommunications
Knowledge of eSIM and GSMA-related technologies and services



If you are interested in this position, please apply via the link.

We sincerely thank all applicants in advance for submitting their interest in this opportunity with Airalo.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Als Data Analyst ben je verantwoordelijk voor het beheer en de optimalisatie van de data in het ERP systeem. Daarnaast ben je verantwoordelijk voor het opzetten van de nodige rapportage uit de verschillende systemen die gebruikt worden binnen de organisatie ( ERP systeem, WMS systeem,..). Je zal na het maken van de nodige business analyses verschillende rapporteringen opzetten in voornamelijk PowerBI gebruik makend van productie gerelateerde data.




Als Data Analyst ben je verantwoordelijk voor:




Het begrijpen en in kaart brengen van de behoeften van het bedrijf.
Verzamelen, opschonen en voorbewerken van gegevens uit verschillende bronnen.
Nauw samenwerken met cross-functionele teams en je expertise in Power BI inzetten om overtuigende visualisaties en rapporten te maken.
Het ontwerpen, optimaliseren en ontwikkelen van Power BI rapporten en dashboards om te voldoen aan de gedefinieerde behoeften en vereisten.
Een nauwe samenwerking met belanghebbenden om de business noden te verzamelen en te begrijpen, en de nauwkeurigheid en consistentie van gegevens te waarborgen.
Het oplossen van problemen met Power BI-rapporten, complexe datasets om te zetten in zinvolle inzichten door datavisualisaties te maken.
Steeds op de hoogte te blijven van de nieuwste Power BI Microsoft Fabric functies en best practices om uit te blinken in deze rol.




Profiel




Je hebt een bachelor- en/of masterdiploma in informatica of gelijkwaardig.
Je hebt een analytische instelling.
Je bent bedreven in Power BI, inclusief DAX, datamodellering en aangepaste visuals.
Je werkt goed in teamverband
Je spreekt vloeiend Nederlands en/of Frans en Engels.
Een goede kennis van Azure Synapse en Data Factory zijn pluspunten
Je bent vertrouwd bent met verschillende types van dataopslag voor gestructureerde data.
Je hebt kennis van de datamigratie tool Talend




Aanbod

Je komt terecht binnen een groeiende organisatie met snelle beslissingsstructuren en een gezonde langetermijnvisie, waar je continu aangemoedigd en geholpen wordt om je verder te ontplooien op professioneel en persoonlijk vlak.
Afwisselende en uitdagende functie binnen een dynamisch bedrijf, met ambitieuze projecten in het verschiet
Familiale sfeer met een divers en internationaal team
Een degelijke opleiding en ondersteuning waarbij persoonlijke ontwikkeling centraal staat
Competitief verloningspakket aangevuld met diverse extralegale voordelen zoals een bedrijfswagen, netto vergoeding, verzekeringspakket en mogelijkheid tot een fietslease

Title: Data Analyst/Business Developer
Description:
Notre √©quipe recherche un nouveau "teammate" √† temps plein, qui devra combiner la fonction de Data Analyst (50% du temps) et de Business Developer (R√©seau E.E.N) (pour les 50% du temps restant).




Vous avez envie d‚Äôun nouveau challenge professionnel motivant et au service du d√©veloppement technologique et √©conomique de la Wallonie ? Vous portez de l‚Äôint√©r√™t pour le monde des entreprises, de la recherche et de l‚Äôinnovation ? Les bases de donn√©es et les chiffres n‚Äôont aucun secret pour vous ? Vous √™tes dynamique, pragmatique et orient√©(e) solution ? Et vous appr√©ciez les contacts d‚Äôaffaire pour d√©velopper des clients potentiels ?

Alors venez rejoindre l‚Äô√©quipe du NCP Wallonie !




Financ√© par le Service Public de Wallonie et h√©berg√© par AKT for Wallonia (Ex Union Wallonne des Entreprises), le NCP Wallonie a pour objectif de maximiser la participation des acteurs wallons de la recherche et de l‚Äôinnovation, avec un accent sur les entreprises wallonnes, au programme-cadre Horizon Europe et √† d‚Äôautres sources de financements europ√©ens de la recherche et du d√©veloppement technologique.




En tant que Data Analyst, vous devrez :




¬∑ Analyser la participation des acteurs wallons (entreprises, universit√©s, hautes √©coles et centres de recherche) aux programmes europ√©ens de R&D.

¬∑ R√©aliser des analyses statistiques sur les activit√©s/participations des acteurs wallons dans les programmes europ√©ens de financement R&I.

¬∑ Offrir un service proactif et professionnel aux conseillers du NCP Wallonie et aux diff√©rents acteurs wallons qui participent aux projets europ√©ens.




En tant que Business Developer (EEN Network), vous devrez :

¬∑ Analyser les opportunit√©s de financement R&I potentielles pour l‚Äô√©cosyst√®me wallon et rechercher les prospects potentiels sur des th√©matiques cibles (prospection) notamment au travers le r√©seau EEN et la S3 wallonne ;

¬∑ Suivre les divers clients tout au long du cycle de soumission de leur proposition lors d‚Äôun appel √† projet (via le r√©seau EEN) ;

¬∑ Atteindre les objectifs pour l‚Äô√©quipe du NCP Wallonie au sein du r√©seau EEN (vouchers, analyse et suivi des requ√™tes)




Quelles seront vos responsabilit√©s ?

Title: Digital Intelligence & Data Analyst
Description:
About Ogilvy Social.lab

Ogilvy Social.Lab (OSL) is a full-service advertising agency headquartered in Brussels‚Äô WPP Campus. As part of the international Ogilvy network, our operations span four continents with over 15 nationalities on the 130-strong team working in our offices ‚Äì our mindset is borderless.

We proudly collaborate with prominent international and regional clients, including Absolut, Mondelez, Ford, IKEA, Vans, EU and Belgian institutions, fueling their success internationally.

Entrepreneurship pulses through our veins, embodying our name with a "lab‚Äù mentality. We constantly innovate and experiment, staying in sync with the ever-evolving digital media landscape we specialize in.

Your Main Responsibilities


Analyse social and digital data through a set of tools (Social Listening tools like Synthesio, Competitive Analysis tools like RivalIQ, Audience Analysis tools like Profiler or Global Web Index, Trends and Search Analysis tools like Semrush or Social Lab Proprietary Tools, etc.) based on a client briefing. Develop custom approaches leveraging available data sets and technologies to deliver on actionable insights to inform strategic recommendations.
Support planners in developing data-validated strategies bringing data richness to what consumers, communities or creators are ‚Äòsaying‚Äô, ‚Äòsharing‚Äô and ‚Äòsearching‚Äô online.
Design insightful reports and audits with strategic recommendations.
Deliver high-quality service to local and international clients.
Collaborate with WPP and external data providers.
Participate in the creation of new, commercially viable data products.
Client-facing for the presentation of intelligence work.


Your Track Record Shows


2 to 6 years of experience in Social/Digital/Search Data Analytics, Insights and Digital/Social Strategy (seniority level to be determined based on your background and experience).
Strong research and analytical skills - understand how to apply qualitative and quantitative learnings and turn them into actionable insights
Comfortable using social and digital monitoring technologies such as Synthesio, Brandwatch, Meltwater, Semrush, etc.
Expert in the understanding of social media and established understanding of the wider digital communication landscape.
Ability to work effectively, proactively and seamlessly amongst an integrated agency team.
Eye for innovation and the next emerging platform or partner.


Must-have


Always-on social listening analysis and insights generation.
Cultural tracking (including trends) and insights generation for always-on and campaign use.
A strong understanding of today‚Äôs social media landscape and internet culture (Social 3.0, culture-first, community and creators led, audience-first) and new channels‚Äô codes.
A strong understanding of Social media performance metrics/KPIs for both organic and paid media.
Strong reporting and visualisation skills


Nice-to-have


Dashboarding, data collection and data visualisation experience
Sprinklr expertise
Knowledge of customer research is a plus


OFFER


Fulltime opportunity in an ever-growing, trendsetting advertising agency based in the greenest building in Brussels ‚Äì the new WPP Campus.
Work alongside a team of diverse and people-focused individuals, on impactful projects and with an array of local, regional and global clients.
We are committed to keeping our environmental footprint low and ensuring that our work is ethical.
We thrive on transparency ‚Äì Our words and promises produce actions.
Enjoy attractive employment benefits including:
Flexible working policy; balanced mix of remote work and in-office presence options
Meal & Eco vouchers,
Cafeteria plan,
3 insurance options,
Continuous training,
Latest collaborative tech and tools to thrive,
Teambuilding & integration activities, Lunch&Learns...
As an Ogilvy Social. Lab employee, you will be provided with continuous opportunities to grow through training, and career conversations, while doing strong work, that works on a daily basis.

At Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression.

We believe in building powerful teams with purpose. This means hiring and nurturing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientation, and gender identities ‚Äì and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality.

Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve. This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Data Analyst | Power BI | Aantrekkelijk loonpakket | gedreven team | Regio Leuven | 1104074




What you will be doing




Als Data Analyst ga je digitale oplossingen die voornamelijk binnen EMEA worden gebruikt, maar af en toe ook op wereldwijde schaal ontwikkelen en onderhouden. De taken omvatten onder andere Power BI-rapportage, ontwikkeling van Microsoft Power Platform-oplossingen, het bouwen van datamodellen, het trainen van gebruikers op ontwikkelde oplossingen, het onderhouden en verbeteren van bestaande oplossingen, en het coachen van collega‚Äôs op het gebied van gegevensbeheer en rapportcreatie.




De essenti√´le taken en verantwoordelijkheden zijn:

Ontwikkeling en onderhoud van Power BI-datasets en rapporten.
Ontwikkeling en onderhoud van Power Platform-oplossingen.
Het geven van training en ondersteuning op alle ontwikkelde oplossingen of andere toegewezen taken.
Het uitwerken en uitvoeren van (cross-functionele) projecten in samenwerking met de Operations Administration Supervisor.
Effectief samenwerken met collega‚Äôs van andere afdelingen.
Beheer van vertrouwelijke informatie en het opzetten van de nodige gegevensbeveiliging.
Administratieve ondersteuning bieden aan de Operations-afdeling.
Input leveren voor procesverbeteringen en implementatie van deze proceswijzigingen.
Ondersteuning bieden in validatieprocessen.
Uitvoeren van eventuele andere extra taken of projecten zoals toegewezen.




Who you will be working for




Onze klant, gevestigd in Leuven, is een multinational die wereldwijd 16 000 mensen tewerkstelt. In Leuven kom je terecht in een modern kantoor met een open en dynamische sfeer, met een 50-tal medewerkers. Dit bedrijf hecht grote waarde aan ethische normen en gelijke kansen. Ze streven ernaar om een werkomgeving te cre√´ren zonder barri√®res, waarin inclusiviteit en respect centraal staan. In deze sleutelpositie als Data Analyst ben je verantwoordelijk voor de rapportering op EMEA niveau.




What are we looking for




Bachelor of Master diploma (of gelijkwaardig door ervaring)
Sterke interesse in Datasets, Power BI, Analyses‚Ä¶
Vloeiend in Engels, Nederlands is een plus
Je bent een teamspeler, leergierig en communicatief




What you will get in return




Je stapt als Data Analyst binnen in een internationale bedrijfscultuur, waarin persoonlijke groei en levenslang leren worden gestimuleerd. Bovendien biedt onze klant je een competitief en aantrekkelijk salarispakket met extralegale voordelen.

Daarnaast krijg je de kans om opleidingen te volgen die aansluiten bij je ambities en persoonlijke behoeften.




Please click to apply for this role, we welcome your application! Meer weten? Neem vandaag nog contact met Heleen Corneillie via +32 (0)50 47 20 42.

Je stapt als Data Analyst binnen in een internationale bedrijfscultuur, waarin persoonlijke groei en levenslang leren worden gestimuleerd. Bovendien biedt onze klant je een competitief en aantrekkelijk salarispakket met extralegale voordelen.

Daarnaast krijg je de kans om opleidingen te volgen die aansluiten bij je ambities en persoonlijke behoeften.


Please click to apply for this role, we welcome your application! Meer weten? Neem vandaag nog contact met Heleen Corneillie via +32 (0)50 47 20 42.
