Title: Data and Analytics Lead
Description:
Job Description

As the Data Lead for our Belux Human Health Commercial organization, you will lead and grow a talented team of more than 5 data experts. The purpose of your team is to generate, analyze, model, and visualize data to enable data-informed decision making, and to promote a data driven culture by understanding our organization‚Äôs data needs, and delivering relevant actionable insights.

Your team is working in the following areas: Analytics, Dashboarding, Data Science, Data Engineering, Data Quality & Governance, CRM (Customer Relationship Management) and SFE (Sales Force Effectiveness). There is both operational support, as well as strategic project-based work.




Key Result Areas & Tasks

Work on the data strategy and vision for Belux Human Health Commercial organization
Collaborate closely with the 3 business units (Oncology, Vaccines and Hospital Acute Care) to understand their challenges, collect their needs, and ensure continuous alignment.
Manage data projects portfolio by prioritizing data projects requests, ensuring proper planning and communication with stakeholders.
Coach the data team in understanding the data strategy, and in delivering prioritized projects and operational demands.
Drive implementation of innovative solutions with the team and be ready to deliver challenging projects yourself.
Guide, coach and inspire a team of professionals. Act as a primary point of contact for them.
Develop people and help them grow within the organization.
Collaborate with Global and Regional teams to exchange best practices and source new projects




Skills and qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, a related technical field, or equivalent experience.
Strong foundations in data with previous experience operating as an individual contributor with data skills.
Experience working with and leading cross functional teams.
Experience partnering with commercial and digital teams.
At least 3 years of direct line management experience - leading and coaching data teams of 4+ people.
Nice to have: Pharma and/or biotech industry experience, ideally with a focus on data.
Strong ability to manage multiple projects of various complexity in areas of responsibility.
Ability to navigate complexity and to synthesize different points of view to reach consensus.
Ability to work in a cross-functional environment.
Ability to manage expectations from stakeholders from different functional areas, seniority levels and geographical areas.




Who we are ‚Ä¶

We are known as Merck & Co., Inc., Rahway, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.

Title: Data Anlayst (finance background)
Description:
We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst with a strong finance background to join our team and work on the implementation of our new CRM system for the bank. The ideal candidate will have experience in finance, specifically as an accountant or auditor, and will be responsible for data transfer and integration.

Key Responsibilities:


Collaborate with the finance and IT teams to understand data requirements and ensure smooth data transfer during the CRM implementation.
Analyze and validate financial data to ensure accuracy and integrity.
Develop and maintain complex Excel spreadsheets, including pivot tables, data extraction, and VLOOKUP functions.
Utilize SQL and Python to manipulate and analyze data (preferred).
Ensure data quality and consistency throughout the migration process.
Generate reports and provide insights to support decision-making.
Communicate effectively in both French and English with internal and external stakeholders.


Qualifications:


Minimum of 3 years of experience as a Data Analyst in the finance sector (accounting, auditing, etc.).
Strong proficiency in Excel, including pivot tables, data extraction, and VLOOKUP.
Familiarity with SQL and Python is a significant plus.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Bilingual proficiency in French and English is required.


Education:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Finance, Accounting, Data Analytics, or a related field.


Benefits:


Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunities for professional development and career growth.
Friendly and collaborative work environment.


To apply for the Data Analyst (Finance Background) position located in Brussels, please send your resume to CV@halian.com. Be sure to include the name of the position and location in the subject line of your email. We look forward to reviewing your application and exploring the possibility of you joining our dynamic team at Halian.

Title: Data Analytics Specialist
Description:
At Uni Systems, we are working towards turning digital visions into reality. We are continuously growing and we are looking for a professional Data Analytics Specialist to join our UniQue Brussels team.

Coordination and review of policy units' business needs;
Definition of solutions proposed for servicing policy units' business needs;
Interaction with the business analysts, customer, users, project leaders and the developers;
Carry out ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) tasks;
Creating, designing and developing data models;
Analyse large datasets and propose approaches for optimisation of reporting;
Assessment and quality control of data;
Preparation of statistical analysis of data for use by policy officers and other stakeholders;
Management and processing of data;
Reporting of key indicators for different policy fields on the basis of data sets available;
Development and maintenance of interactive dashboards in Power BI;
Assistance with data management aspects of IT projects developed in European Institution



Requirements



What do you need to succeed in this position?

Excellent knowledge of Data Analytics techniques and tools.
Good knowledge of Power BI.
Experience with one or more of the following:
Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing.
Languages like R, Python, PERL, ....
Other business intelligence tools (Tableau, SAS, SAP, GoodData...).
ETL processes and tools (i.e. Talend Open Studio...).
Knowledge of SQL tooling (NoSQL DB, MongoDB, Hadoop, SQL).
Knowledge of architectural design and implementation of scalable modern data stores.
Knowledge in one of the following areas:
predictive (forecasting, recommendation),
prescriptive (simulation),
sentiment analysis,
topic detection,
social media crawling and processing,
plagiarism detection,
trends/anomalies detection in datasets,
recommendation systems
Very good knowledge of reporting and statistics
Ability to provide ad hoc reports efficiently and fast
Ability to give business and technical presentations
Ability to apply high quality standards
Ability to cope with fast changing technologies used in reporting (currently focused on Power BI)
Very good communication skills with technical and non-technical audiences
Analysis and problem solving skills
Capability to write clear and structured technical documents
Ability to participate in technical meetings and good communication skills
Good knowledge of English

At Uni Systems, we are providing equal employment opportunities and banning any form of discrimination on grounds of gender, religion, race, color, nationality, disability, social class, political beliefs, age, marital status, sexual orientation or any other characteristics. Take a look at¬†our Diversity, Equality & Inclusion Policy¬†for more information.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Bring your data analytics and data mining skills to a unique team seeking to understand and shape the future of marketing technology. We are interested in technology adoption patterns, the respect of visitors' data and the use of open source in marketing. We are also interested in those marketing data analysts who are curious enough to embrace new technologies and are ready to work with unfamiliar tools, if needed.

The role of a Marketing Data Analyst at Canonical

Canonical has provided developers with open source since 2004, helping them build innovations such as public cloud, machine learning, robotics or blockchain. Marketing at Canonical means being at the forefront of innovation, for our customers and for our own martech stack. We're on the look out for a marketing data analyst to join our team and execute on our growth hacking strategy.

The ideal candidate will be passionate about technology, technology marketing and the use of technology in marketing. You will prefer to work in an environment that has emphasis on ownership of campaigns, collaboration, learning, curiosity and a drive to continually improve oneself / the team / the organisation. You will also love to problem solve, get hands-on, experiment, measure and use automation to make daily life easier.

The Marketing team at Canonical drives commercial outcomes for the company across its portfolio of products and grows the addressable market through digital marketing campaigns, lifecycle management, events, partnerships and community development. If these things are important to you and you're motivated by driving growth, delighting customers and filling the sales funnel, we want to talk with you.

This role sits in the Marketing team reporting to the Growth Engineering Manager.

Location: This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.

What your day will look like


Utilise advanced data analytics to grow Canonical's product adoption and market penetration
Focus on quantitative and qualitative data analytics to find insights and meaningful business outcomes
Design and conduct experiments with data, visualisation and insights into Canonical's target audiences
Collaborate with stakeholder teams (Product Management, Engineering, Information Systems, Finance, RevOps, etc) to improve the data and tool ecosystem
Put in place and maintain systems to ensure teams across the company have self-service access to data dashboards


What we are looking for in you?


Background in data science, mathematics, actuarial science, or engineering
Knowledge in advanced statistics, data sciences, coding/scripting languages (Python, JS, etc), and databases (SQL, etc)
Strength in data analytics and visualisation (Looker Studio, Tableau, Apache Superset, etc)
Ability to translate business questions to key research objectives
Ability to identify the best methodology to execute research, synthesise and analyse findings
Excellent writing and communication skills
Willingness to examine the status quo and resilient in the face of challenges


What we offer you

Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.

In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.

üè†Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!

üìöPersonal learning and development budget of 2,000 USD per annum

üí∞Annual compensation review

üèÜRecognition rewards

üèù Annual holiday leave

üë∂Parental Leave

üßë‚ÄçüíºEmployee Assistance Programme

üß≥Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'

‚úàÔ∏èPriority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.

Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

  • Background in data science, mathematics, actuarial science, or engineering
  • Knowledge in advanced statistics, data sciences, coding/scripting languages (Python, JS, etc), and databases (SQL, etc)
  • Strength in data analytics and visualisation (Looker Studio, Tableau, Apache Superset, etc)
  • Ability to translate business questions to key research objectives
  • Ability to identify the best methodology to execute research, synthesise and analyse findings
  • Excellent writing and communication skills
  • Willingness to examine the status quo and resilient in the face of challenges

What we offer you

Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.

In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.

üè†Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!

üìöPersonal learning and development budget of 2,000 USD per annum

üí∞Annual compensation review

üèÜRecognition rewards

üèù Annual holiday leave

üë∂Parental Leave

üßë‚ÄçüíºEmployee Assistance Programme

üß≥Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'

‚úàÔ∏èPriority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.

Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Title: Data Analyst / Data Engineer
Description:
Brief:


Telework: 60% on site in Brussels (Tuesday, Thursday, Wednesday) & 40% homeworking
Technical experience: Excel (PowerPivot, PowerQuery...), SQL, Tableau CRM (Salesforce), Tableau, Modelling technique (BPMN, UML...), Scrum (User Stories), Salesforce Data model, Good understanding of IT world (data models, API's, webservices...)
Languages: fluent English + fluent French or Dutch


Mission context:

The main focus of the Data Analyst/Data Engineer will be to support business in the creation & documentation of various reporting and dashboards (Payment transactions, Accounting, KYC, Logistics...).

The analyst will also be able to participate in some business and functional analysis activities.

Function description:

As a Data Analyst/Data Engineer (s)he should be able to :


Communicate efficiently with business departments to gather, understand and translate business needs into clear requirements.
Get a clear view of all the data sources and data available;
Identify which data are required to build the expected extraction and reporting ;
Collect and integrate data and perform data preparation and transformations in a secure manner, in order to produce reusable key data sets ;
Use these key data sets to produce reportings and analysis for our internal customers as well as regulatory reportings ;
Create clear documentation on the data collection and transformations ;


For this, (s)he should be able to :


Build reports via Salesforce reporting module and/or build dashboards via Tableau or Power BI.
Create insights and do storytelling
Export, merge and transform data with Power Query in case the data have not been integrated yet; data security by design is key!
Ensure data quality by implementing controls on the imported and produced data.
Discover trends and insights that could bring value to the business.
Organize and document functionally implemented data integrations and reports.


Language Requirements

At least master perfectly one of the 2 local languages + perfect English

Required experience and knowledge:

Solid practical experience as data engineer of at least 5 years is needed in the activities listed on the Function Description for which resource needs to take the lead.

You have a solid IT background and know all about data modelling, data documentation, data collecting and transforming and GDPR/data protection, building good data structures.

You've worked in a BI context previously, capturing and delivering data in a structured manner, with reusable key data sets. You have developed dashboards and reportings. You know do's and don'ts to build such deliverables.

Technical experience

mandatory:


Good experience with IT activities (data models, API, data manipulation and transformation (doc included)
Excel (PowerPivot, PowerQuery...) ;
Experience with market ETL/ELT tools is an advantage.
Salesforce reporting / Salesforce Analytic Studio
Tableau dashboarding
Modelling technique (UML...)
Insight creation and story telling
Scrum (writing good User Stories)


preferable:

thorough practical Salesforce Data model experience is a big plus

Business Experience

mandatory:


Business Reporting in a Acquiring and Enabling environment (Accounting, Billing, payment transaction, terminal management).
Storytelling
Already worked in organisations where documentation is a must-have


preferable:


Experience in payment transactions is a plus


Telework:


Expectation: 60% on site (Tuesday, Thursday, Wednesday) & 40% homeworking

Title: Freelance Data Business Analyst
Description:
Freelance Data Business Analyst - centralising experiment data - full remote

Start date mid July till end of the year




Must-Have requirements

3+ years as a Data Analyst or in a related role in an Agile setting
Experience with Chemistry & Lab softwares (eg. Electronic Lab Notebook, LIMS etc.)
Expert in SQL, Excel and/or Google sheets, macros VBA and/or Google Apps Script
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and critical-thinking skills
Strong organisational & time management skills, with a self-starting, entrepreneurial mindset
Excellent verbal / written communication and interpersonal skills
Proficiency in requirement gathering techniques, process modelling, and documentation
Ability to translate non-technical information into a technical level of detail that developers can work with
Proficiency in using project management and collaboration tools (JIRA, Confluence)
Excellent English and French




The mission

The Data Business Analyst will be part of the Connected Research & Build the Future Journey which encompasses several product groups dedicated to Research & Innovation, Group Sustainability and New Business Models (Research Digitisation, Data Acquisition‚Ä¶).

The Data Business Analyst will work on our internal R&I web applications for centralising experiment data and creating outputs to help with researcher analysis - reporting, BI, AI.

They will help create cohesive end-to-end solutions from the ingestion of data, ETL, and display/exploration in web apps and BI dashboards.




Your Responsibilities

Work closely with the Product Owner and business analysts to understand stakeholder needs, objectives, and challenges
Support the business analysts by collecting and analysing data across the business to make informed decisions
Develop customised spreadsheets with quality assurance (i.e. user testing/integration testing) for business stakeholders
Standardise spreadsheets or any data source with a business analysis approach to reflect the best user value
Transform and prepare data from the diverse lab application sources to get it ready to be ingested into the cloud
Own spreadsheet development good practices including functional and non-functional documentation
Ensure that delivered solutions meet the specified requirements and are of high quality
Participate in system testing, user acceptance testing, and validation of implemented solutions
Elicit, document, and analyse business requirements, use cases, and workflows
Participate in daily standup scrums, sprint planning meetings, sprint reviews and retrospective
Actively follow the progress of the sprint to confirm implementation meets the intent of acceptance criteria




Please only reply if you have the MUST HAVE requirements, with your CV and expected daily rate. NO in-mails please! EU residents only. Thank you.

Title: Power BI Data Analyst - Data & AI
Description:
Ben je gepassioneerd door data & analyse en krijg jij energie van het bouwen van PowerBI dashboards met oog voor design die relevante informatie helder voorstellen? Werk je bovendien graag mee aan de meest innovatieve data oplossingen van de toekomst? Laten we dan eens sparren over een positie als Power BI Data Analyst in ons Data Solutions team.


In je rol als PowerBI Data Analyst werk je nauw samen met ervaren collega‚Äôs aan Business Intelligence, Big Data en AI-projecten.
Aan de hand van je analytisch inzicht help je mee aan de transformatie van ruwe data tot inzichtelijke informatie door gebruiksvriendelijke Power BI dashboards te ontwikkelen.
Je analyseert de noden van de klant en vormt de brug tussen business users en data engineers.
Je voorziet de klant van nieuwe inzichten door eenvoudig te begrijpen data visualisaties uit te werken.
Bovendien ben je een krak in het geven van demo's aan onze klanten.


Wat breng jij mee?


Je hebt een aanstekelijk enthousiasme over data & business intelligence.
Je hebt enkele jaren ervaring opgebouwd als Data Analyst en Power BI kent voor jou geen geheimen meer.
Kennis van technologie in data engineering en datawarehouses is een plus. Ook kennis van programmeertalen zoals Python is een meerwaarde.
Je bouwt impactvolle dashboards als geen ander √©n je haalt energie uit storytelling.
Je brengt een flexibele, zelfstandige en collegiale houding met je mee.
Goede communicatieve vaardigheden, klantgerichtheid en nauwkeurigheid zijn tevens zeer belangrijk in deze rol.
Een bepaalde flexibiliteit naar verplaatsingen is vereist aangezien er af en toe van bij de klant wordt gewerkt. Als je aanwezigheid bij de klant niet vereist is dan kan je in het Cegeka-kantoor dichtst bij je woonplaats werken (Antwerpen, Gent, Hasselt of Leuven) of vanuit je home office!


Wat hebben wij jou te bieden?


We vragen heel wat (talenten) van jou. Gelukkig krijg je er ook heel wat voor terug! Een krak zoals jij verdient immers het allerbeste!
Competenties en karakter zijn voor ons essentieel, naast ervaring en ambities. Cegeka investeert voortdurend in talent management opdat elke medewerker zijn potentieel kan realiseren.
Innovatie en kennisdeling staan bij ons hoog op de agenda. We zijn altijd op zoek naar vernieuwing en verbetering bij onze klanten. Je krijgt volop kansen om hierin actief deel te nemen.
Je komt terecht in een hecht, gedreven en gepassioneerd team waarin het aangenaam √©n leuk werken is. We hebben zelfs een eigen Data Solutions fun team.
Begeleiding op maat! Jij geeft aan waar je interesses liggen. We bieden verschillende carri√®repaden aan, en kijken samen hoe we je verder kunnen helpen ontplooien.
Naast het competitief brutosalaris, een (elektrische) bedrijfswagen of mobiliteitsbudget, maaltijdcheques, ecocheques groeps-en hospitalisatieverzekering, gsm-abonnement, forfaitaire onkostenvergoeding en krachtige laptop, bieden we jou flexibele werkuren en een mooie work/life balans.
Dankzij ons Flex Reward Plan kunnen we een verloning op maat aanbieden.


Aspire to more: onze belofte aan jou

Je krijgt bij Cegeka alle ruimte om jezelf als professional verder te ontwikkelen. Samen realiseren we wat je √©cht wil betekenen voor onze klanten en collega‚Äôs. We nodigen je graag uit om met ons mee te groeien. In een ongekende veelzijdigheid aan uitdagende, betekenisvolle IT-projecten. Zet je stempel op projecten bij aansprekende klanten waarbij we het verschil maken. Aspire to more.

We werken hier altijd met elkaar samen. Intensief, met veel plezier en betrokkenheid. Binnen een cultuur gedreven door familiewaarden: vol vertrouwen, mensgericht, open, loyaal en respectvol. Met veel vrijheid en verantwoordelijkheid. Kom deel uitmaken van de volgende fase van een trots, succesvol, snelgroeiend, innovatief, Europees IT-bedrijf vol ambities.

Sollicitatieprocedure


Solliciteer


We bekijken je sollicitatie en nemen zo snel mogelijk contact met je op.


Ontmoet ons


We nodigen je uit voor een kennismaking en ter voorbereiding vul je een vragenlijst in.


Aanbod


Ben je overtuigd en wij ook, dan doen we je graag een aanbod om bij ons te komen werken.


Start!


Contractvoorstel geaccepteerd? Top! We kijken uit naar een prettige samenwerking.

Title: Strategisch Data Analist
Description:
Als datastrategie-team van EpicData werken we op het kruispunt van business, data en processen. Je maakt deel uit van een ondernemend team dat klanten op een pragmatische manier ondersteunt in datastrategie-trajecten. Je begeleidt hen om de kloof tussen business en data te verkleinen door het ontwikkelen van strategie√´n, roadmaps en business cases voor data, analytics, AI en BI-oplossingen.




Hoe ziet deze job eruit?

Je verzamelt, begrijpt en kijkt kritisch naar de behoeften van externe en interne belanghebbenden.
Je vertaalt deze behoeftes in concrete data use cases en prototypes
Je faciliteert Design Thinking-workshops om requirements vast te leggen en innovatieve idee√´n te genereren
Je zorgt voor expertise en co√∂rdinatie gedurende het gehele ideatieproces
Je haalt inzichten uit het analyseren van datasets
Jij bent samen met de technische IT-collega‚Äôs de drijvende kracht in het opleveren van data business projecten




Wat verwachten we van jou?

Een masterdiploma in een bedrijfseconomische richting of IT
Een business mindset en diepgaande kennis van data-analyse
Een track record in business en/of functionele analyse
Je bent analytisch en creatief en daagt graag de status quo uit
Je beschikt over uitstekende probleemoplossende vaardigheden
Je beschikt over goede technische/analytische vaardigheden (bv. Python, R, SQL) en kennis van front-end tools zoals PowerBI, Tableau, Qlik, ...
Uitstekende communicatieve en interpersoonlijke vaardigheden
Vloeiend in het Nederlands (!) en Engels, kennis Frans is een plus




Wat mag je verwachten van ons?

Ons doel is om zoveel mogelijk waarde voor de klant te cre√´ren. Dit betekent niet dat we ons niet mogen amuseren terwijl we dat aan het doen zijn. Een spelletje padel op de velden achter het kantoor, een uitstekende en gratis warme lunch op kantoor, een brainstorm op het dakterras, het hoort er allemaal bij. En natuurlijk, een team van geweldige collega's om mee te genieten.




Jou laten groeien is een van onze belangrijkste aandachtspunten. Dit doen we door je te laten werken aan betekenisvolle projecten en door zowel technische als soft skills te trainen. Mocht dit alles je nog over de streep trekken om contact met ons op te nemen en de sfeer te komen proeven, dan kunnen we je ook geruststellen dat het salarispakket aansluit bij jouw ervaringsniveau en potentieel. Daarnaast krijg je ook een bedrijfswagen, een flexibel inkomstenplan, een hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering, maaltijdvergoeding en ecocheques, een GSM budget en flexibele werkuren.

Show more

  • Een masterdiploma in een bedrijfseconomische richting of IT
  • Een business mindset en diepgaande kennis van data-analyse
  • Een track record in business en/of functionele analyse
  • Je bent analytisch en creatief en daagt graag de status quo uit
  • Je beschikt over uitstekende probleemoplossende vaardigheden
  • Je beschikt over goede technische/analytische vaardigheden (bv. Python, R, SQL) en kennis van front-end tools zoals PowerBI, Tableau, Qlik, ...
  • Uitstekende communicatieve en interpersoonlijke vaardigheden
  • Vloeiend in het Nederlands (!) en Engels, kennis Frans is een plus


Wat mag je verwachten van ons?

Ons doel is om zoveel mogelijk waarde voor de klant te cre√´ren. Dit betekent niet dat we ons niet mogen amuseren terwijl we dat aan het doen zijn. Een spelletje padel op de velden achter het kantoor, een uitstekende en gratis warme lunch op kantoor, een brainstorm op het dakterras, het hoort er allemaal bij. En natuurlijk, een team van geweldige collega's om mee te genieten.


Jou laten groeien is een van onze belangrijkste aandachtspunten. Dit doen we door je te laten werken aan betekenisvolle projecten en door zowel technische als soft skills te trainen. Mocht dit alles je nog over de streep trekken om contact met ons op te nemen en de sfeer te komen proeven, dan kunnen we je ook geruststellen dat het salarispakket aansluit bij jouw ervaringsniveau en potentieel. Daarnaast krijg je ook een bedrijfswagen, een flexibel inkomstenplan, een hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering, maaltijdvergoeding en ecocheques, een GSM budget en flexibele werkuren.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Your mission :

Join Partenamut, Belgium's first free, French-speaking mutual insurance company, and embark on a professional and personal journey where people are at the heart of everything. Here, we are ready to build the mutuality of tomorrow even more attentive and innovative. Every day, we support more than 1.3 million customers in proactively managing their health, but above all, we form a collaborative and supportive team. Your talents and individuality are freely expressed to achieve our common goals.We believe in human-centred fulfilment, innovation, solidarity and diversity.

If you're passionate about innovation and people, if you're prepared to go the extra mile for our customers while remaining whole, and if you like to challenge yourself at work while enjoying your free time, we look forward to meeting you so that together we can build the health and well-being of tomorrow.




Your responsabilities :

As an experienced Data Analyst, you play a pivotal role in advancing our organization's data-driven initiatives by leveraging their proven expertise to provide actionable insights and support informed decision-making within business teams.

Daily :

You support the business with their data requests, and structure findings into low maintenance and easy-to-read listings, tables or charts/dashboarding in line with the information needs of your customers and GDPR regulations.
You analyze data requirements by assessing data availability, quality, comprehension at project start to determine whether data is suitable for the need and how complex it is.
You support the data products owners with the data explorations.
Through a defined collaboration model, you support business in increasing data literacy : data comprehension, best practices for dashboard creation, data story-telling and best practices in data exploration.
You identify ways to increase adoption of the solutions you developed and stakeholder satisfaction.
You play an important role in the future implementation of the data catalogue by validating the accuracy and usefulness of the data. You are equally expected to provide feedback on how to improve the catalog.
You participate in delivery of projects and continuous improvement initiatives as part of cross functional squad.




Your profile as a Data Analyst :

You have a Bachelor or Master in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science or Information Management.
You have proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst (minimum 5 years).
You have technical expertise regarding data models, database design development and data mining techniques.
You have knowledge and experience with databases (SQL, etc) and reporting packages (Tableau, Power BI etc). Programming in Python is a plus.
You have strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and present findings, disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
You have a strong work ethic and a skillset to juggle several different information requests with ease and composure.
You are fluent in French and English (verbal & written).




Our offer :

A full-time open-ended contract with flexible working hours and the possibility of remote working up to 3 days a week.
An exciting position with real prospects in a fast-growing company.
In-depth training in the mutual insurance sector on arrival and regular training throughout your career.
An attractive salary with numerous non-statutory benefits that can be adapted to suit your needs.
Up to 46 days of leave per year.

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
Join Our Team as a Product Data Analyst in the Exciting iGaming Industry! üé≤üìù




Are you passionate about driving product improvements and growth initiatives through data-driven insights? We're seeking a Product Data Analyst to play a crucial role in our Product Department. If you're skilled in identifying growth opportunities, optimizing product features, and ensuring that products evolve to meet user needs and drive business growth, we want to hear from you!




Key Responsibilities:

üîç Process Improvement: Proactively identify process improvement and innovation opportunities within the data analysis function.
üìä Data Visualization: Create and maintain interactive dashboards and visual reports using tools like Tableau or Power BI to make complex data easily understandable and actionable for stakeholders.
ü§ù Stakeholder Collaboration: Work closely with key stakeholders within Product Development.
üìà Trend Analysis: Analyze data to identify and model trends, patterns, and customer behavior related to product performance.
üìù Data Interpretation: Interpret data and present findings in a clear and actionable format to support decision-making processes.
üìâ Metric Monitoring: Monitor and analyze product metrics to identify areas for improvement and optimization.
üí° Culture of Experimentation: Promote a culture of experimentation and testing within the Product Development teams.
üõ†Ô∏è Cross-functional collaboration: Collaborate with product managers, development teams, and UX researchers to align data analysis efforts with business goals.




Competencies:

üìä Analytical Skills: Proficient in statistical analysis, data mining, and predictive modeling.
üíº Business Acumen: Strong understanding of business metrics and the ability to translate data into business insights.
üó£Ô∏è Communication Skills: Ability to communicate complex data findings clearly and promptly to non-technical stakeholders.
üìÖ Time Management: Excellent at managing multiple tasks and meeting deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
ü§ù Teamwork: Strong teamwork skills, collaborating effectively with cross-functional teams to deliver seamless product improvements.
üß† Problem-solving: Strong problem-solving abilities to address and resolve data-related challenges.




Qualifications:

üõ†Ô∏è Technical Skills: Experienced with SQL, Python/R, data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI), and analytics platforms (e.g., Google Analytics, FullStory etc.).
üó£Ô∏è Language Proficiency: Fluent in English, both verbal and written.
üìà Experience: 2+ years experience working as a Data Analyst with Product and Engineering teams.
üéì Educational Background: Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
üè≠ Industry knowledge: iGaming experience is a plus, although not mandatory




We are not just offering a job; we offer the chance to be part of something bigger. Ready to make a mark in the iGaming industry? Submit your resume in English and join us in creating unforgettable experiences for our players. We can‚Äôt wait to welcome you to our team! üåü

Title: HR Data & Reporting Analyst _FR
Description:

Vous suivez et appliquez les tendances et les d√©veloppements en mati√®re d'analyses et de technologies HR.

Qu'avons-nous √† vous offrir ?

d‚Äôun salaire attractif assorti d‚Äôun 13e mois, d‚Äôune indemnit√© de frais, de ch√®ques-repas et d'un bonus collectif et individuel ;
une partie du salaire est propos√©e sous forme de budget flexible. Avec ce budget, vous pouvez opter pour un v√©lo de leasing, un remboursement de vos primes pour l'√©pargne pension, ...

d‚Äôun abonnement de train en 1√®re classe en Belgique, de r√©ductions sur les voyages internationaux en train et d‚Äôune indemnit√© v√©lo ;

O√π allez-vous travailler ?

Pour vous donner une bonne id√©e de votre travail, nous vous pr√©sentons √©galement un cas concret √©liminatoire. Pas de panique : vous aurez le temps de le pr√©parer chez vous. Nous sommes tr√®s curieux de conna√Ætre vos solutions et votre approche !

Title: Data Reporting & Vizualisation
Description:
Data Reporting & Visualization - Expert




Overview: The SPM-Visualization team has developed a strong competence in Tableau and is increasingly solicited to support our internal clients. In the context of evolving Sales Performance and significant digitalization, it is crucial to meet the growing needs by creating dashboards in Tableau. The team requires a Tableau expert who can easily create and maintain dashboards and assist current Tableau users within the team.




Role Description: Support internal clients and execute various data reporting and visualization projects by:




Understanding and identifying stakeholders' reporting and visualization needs.
Capturing requirements and translating them into a prototype, then into a complete Tableau dashboard.
Presenting the full Tableau dashboards to stakeholders and obtaining feedback for future updates.
Developing, updating, optimizing, publishing, and decommissioning reports/dashboards according to data and reporting governance guidelines.
Striving for the most optimal solutions for the development and automation of reports/dashboards.
Collaborating with Data Engineers to create adequate and sustainable data solutions for Tableau dashboards.
Setting up, advocating, and implementing reporting and visualization best practices in line with the guidelines and standards defined within BNPPF.
Acting as the guardian and ambassador of the established governance.




Although the Data Visualization Specialist may temporarily handle light data preparation while designing reports and visualizations, they will work closely with Data Engineers to deliver solid, industrialized, and governed final data structures, ensuring traceability, consistency, and monitoring.




Language Requirements:

Fluent in French or Dutch
Fluent in English




Telework:

Expectation: 50% on-site and 50% homeworking




Required Experience / Knowledge:

Experience in dashboarding and reporting (Tableau)
Experience with SQL (writing and understanding queries)
Knowledge of ETL tools (SAS Programming / SAS EGP) and DBMS Systems (Oracle / Sybase)




Soft Skills:

Team player
Quick self-starter with a proactive attitude
Problem-solver
Good communication and influencing skills
Strong analytical and synthesis skills
Autonomy, commitment, and perseverance
Ability to work in a dynamic and multicultural environment

Title: Data Analytics Intern
Description:
About the Company:

Oeson is a leading IT corporation globally recognized for its expertise in providing top-notch IT and Ed-tech services. Specializing in digital marketing, data science, data analytics, UI-UX design, web development, and app development, we are dedicated to innovation, excellence, and empowering talents worldwide.

Learn More: www.oesonlearning.com

About the Role:

Oeson is offering a chance for eager individuals seeking to master Data Analytics from basic to advanced levels, all while engaging in real-world projects across the globe. It is structured to provide a flexible work setting, allowing participants to collaborate with a diverse global team spanning Oceania, Asia, Europe, and the Americas.

Projects You Will Work On:

Excel project: Visualize hospital dataset using Excel

Statistical project: Analyze live stock price data to study company stock behavior.

EDA case study: Apply EDA techniques in risk analytics for minimizing lending risk.

Bike-sharing system analysis: Examine bike-sharing data and usage patterns.

IPL data analysis: Analyze data from the Indian Premier League cricket tournament.

Data findings communication: Present summarized results and key insights from projects.

Global movie release: Plan to release a movie globally in 2024 by RSVP Movies.

Roles & Responsibilities:

Collaborate with our esteemed data science experts to collect, clean, and analyze extensive datasets, honing skills in data preprocessing and visualization.
Utilize machine learning and data mining techniques to extract insights from large datasets, including Excel interface structure identification.
Apply Python programming skills for Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) in real business scenarios, focusing on risk analytics in banking and financial services.
Design scientific tests and optimize model performance using the latest modeling technologies like no-code databases and data mining.
Collaborate with a team of experts to build machine learning pipelines for diverse use cases in commerce, financial markets, and procurement.
Work with internal stakeholders to explore and understand business data, formulate hypotheses, and measure the impact of strategies using techniques like T-tests.
Solve specific challenges and develop innovative solutions by adapting modeling technologies like bike share systems.
Learn and apply complex analytical techniques using tools like Tableau.
Prepare reports and presentations to effectively communicate data analysis processes and results.

Qualifications:

Currently pursuing any degree showcasing a strong commitment to continuous learning and professional growth.
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, vital for effective collaboration and articulation of complex ideas.
Demonstrated ability to work both independently and as part of a cohesive team, highlighting adaptability and strong teamwork capabilities.

Note:

This position is part of our unpaid ‚ÄúData Analytics Learn and Intern‚Äù. Upon application, our team will contact you to proceed with the application details and joining process.

Location:

Remote, EU

Contact:

To explore the exciting world of Data Analytics with us, please contact us at team.ogtip@oeson.in

Thank you for considering Oeson Private Limited for your professional development in the field of data analytics. We look forward to welcoming you to our dynamic team.

Title: Data Analyst & Business Intelligence Manager m/f/d
Description:
Job Description

Position Overview

We have an exciting new job opportunity at our location in Brussels (Belgium) and are looking to hire a data analyst and business intelligence manager as part of our data & analytics team.

As the data analyst and business intelligence manager for Belgium & Luxemburg, your role will be instrumental in designing, developing, and maintaining a robust data ecosystem and in empowering stakeholders to make informed business decisions.

Your primary responsibilities will encompass end-to-end development of new Qlik Sense applications, or customization of existing ones, and the generation of various strategic data analysis. Your focus will involve extracting, transforming, and analyzing data from diverse sources, while also interacting with various business stakeholders to understand and capture their needs.

You will report to and work in close collaboration with the data & analytics lead and you will be part of a team of 5 talented data experts. The team generates, analyzes, models, and visualizes data, with the aim to deliver actionable insights, enable data-informed decision making, and promote a data driven culture.

Key Result Areas & Tasks

The Primary Activities May Include


Collaboration with stakeholders
Collaborate closely with internal stakeholders and data & analytics lead to understand business needs, and deliver data requirements.
Translate requirements into technical specifications and implement solutions accordingly.
Data Modelling, Visualization and Reporting
Design and create data models that represent the structure and relationships within the data. These models shall serve as the foundation for reporting and analysis.
Create visualizations to present data in a meaningful and accessible way for business users.
Build reports and interactive dashboards that allow users to explore data, analyze trends, and make informed decisions.
Data Querying, Data Integration and Quality Assurance
Employ SQL queries to retrieve data from various sources. Automate data flows where possible (API).
Integrate data from multiple sources and ensure data quality, consistency, and accuracy, by performing checks to identify and rectify any inconsistencies or errors.
Data Pipelines and ETL
Collect, transform, and load data into the BI system.
Perform ETL activities to ensure data is prepared and structured appropriately for analysis.
Data governance
build and maintain knowledge on existing/new data sources, data quality, and metadata.


Experience & Competencies

Ideal Experience, Skillset & Competencies


Strong academic record in a related field.
At least 2-3 years of prior work experience in similar roles.
Proficient English knowledge, both written and spoken.
Strong hands-on experience with visualization tools (Qlik Sense or/and Power BI).
Deep knowledge and hands-on experience with SQL, ETL.
Good communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to quickly develop effective trust-based relationships, working closely with cross functional stakeholders across the business.
Ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a globally dispersed team.


It would be great if you have

Strong knowledge of Qlik technologies including Qlik Sense


Familiarity with key digital and marketing tools, such as
Veeva CRM,
Google Analytics or other web tracking technologies,
Salesforce Marketing Cloud (SFMC)
API

Requisition ID R300680
Show more
HTML:
Job Description

Position Overview

We have an exciting new job opportunity at our location in Brussels (Belgium) and are looking to hire a data analyst and business intelligence manager as part of our data & analytics team.

As the data analyst and business intelligence manager for Belgium & Luxemburg, your role will be instrumental in designing, developing, and maintaining a robust data ecosystem and in empowering stakeholders to make informed business decisions.

Your primary responsibilities will encompass end-to-end development of new Qlik Sense applications, or customization of existing ones, and the generation of various strategic data analysis. Your focus will involve extracting, transforming, and analyzing data from diverse sources, while also interacting with various business stakeholders to understand and capture their needs.

You will report to and work in close collaboration with the data & analytics lead and you will be part of a team of 5 talented data experts. The team generates, analyzes, models, and visualizes data, with the aim to deliver actionable insights, enable data-informed decision making, and promote a data driven culture.

Key Result Areas & Tasks

The Primary Activities May Include

  • Collaboration with stakeholders
  • Collaborate closely with internal stakeholders and data & analytics lead to understand business needs, and deliver data requirements.
  • Translate requirements into technical specifications and implement solutions accordingly.
  • Data Modelling, Visualization and Reporting
  • Design and create data models that represent the structure and relationships within the data. These models shall serve as the foundation for reporting and analysis.
  • Create visualizations to present data in a meaningful and accessible way for business users.
  • Build reports and interactive dashboards that allow users to explore data, analyze trends, and make informed decisions.
  • Data Querying, Data Integration and Quality Assurance
  • Employ SQL queries to retrieve data from various sources. Automate data flows where possible (API).
  • Integrate data from multiple sources and ensure data quality, consistency, and accuracy, by performing checks to identify and rectify any inconsistencies or errors.
  • Data Pipelines and ETL
  • Collect, transform, and load data into the BI system.
  • Perform ETL activities to ensure data is prepared and structured appropriately for analysis.
  • Data governance
  • build and maintain knowledge on existing/new data sources, data quality, and metadata.

Experience & Competencies

Ideal Experience, Skillset & Competencies

  • Strong academic record in a related field.
  • At least 2-3 years of prior work experience in similar roles.
  • Proficient English knowledge, both written and spoken.
  • Strong hands-on experience with visualization tools (Qlik Sense or/and Power BI).
  • Deep knowledge and hands-on experience with SQL, ETL.
  • Good communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to quickly develop effective trust-based relationships, working closely with cross functional stakeholders across the business.
  • Ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a globally dispersed team.

It would be great if you have

Strong knowledge of Qlik technologies including Qlik Sense

  • Familiarity with key digital and marketing tools, such as
  • Veeva CRM,
  • Google Analytics or other web tracking technologies,
  • Salesforce Marketing Cloud (SFMC)
  • API

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
ACENSI BELGIUM is looking for his Client a Data Engineer (F/M/X).







Context of the mission : üíª




Within the context of executing the operational plan for 2024-2026, the COO Office has been tasked with leading the implementation of standardized automated reporting to continuously evaluate automation levels across our Clients' various Lines of Business (LoBs).




This reporting, referred to as the "automation framework," aims to monitor performance indicators to identify deviations from our annual goals and specific scopes.




The goal is to identify root causes of deviations and assess the need for action plans and remediations with the business.




The implementation of this dashboard involves collaboration among business resources (BI teams within the LoBs), IT & Data resources, and members of the COO Office team.







Tasks : üéØ




As a support function within the BI Transformation team, you will assist Business Units (BUs) in transforming their data value chains to easily present automation KPIs.
You will support BI decentralized teams in both Life and P&C Corp to deliver robust solutions for data preparation and team modeling before centralized reporting.







Technical skills : ‚öôÔ∏è




Mastery of BI tools and data value chain elements to effectively prepare and structure data using tabular models for self-service reporting.
Technical expertise in data extraction, manipulation, and presentation (SQL, Azure Analysis Services/Visual Studio, PowerBI, Excel, and other tools).
Knowledge of data modeling standards (dimensional modeling, snowflake vs. star schemas, data warehouses, data marts).







Soft skills : ‚ú®




Ensure best practices in data exploitation, efficient model construction, and the use of reporting tools within project scope.
Regular communication with business sponsors and all project stakeholders, providing consistent feedback to project sponsors.







Language skills : üîä




Fluent in French
Fluent in English







Extra information : üïï




Duration: 31/12/2024 (renewable)

Title: Senior Data Analyst B2C
Description:
Job Description:


Location: Fully remote, EU timezone (CET +/- 2hours)
Start date: ASAP
Languages: English is mandatory; French is a plus
Our client: Cloud Computing / Distributed Systems / AI - European Saas



Objectives of this Role:


Analyze and interpret market and user data to drive business decisions and improve product offerings.
Develop and maintain robust data architecture for efficient data processing and analysis.
Present data insights in a clear, actionable manner to stakeholders across the company.
Understand and navigate the complexities of app marketing and related data restrictions.
Support product development and commercial objectives by providing data-driven insights and recommendations.



Responsibilities:


Design, implement, and manage backend data architecture to support analytics and reporting needs.
Collect, process, and analyze large datasets to extract meaningful insights about user behavior, product performance and growth roadmaps.
Create and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to present data in an understandable and actionable way.
Collaborate with product, business, engineering and management teams to align data initiatives with company goals.
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in data science, nalytics, and B2C app marketing and educate stakeholders on best practices.
Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations and best practices in data handling.
Augment the company with relevant Ai toolings to grow and scale with data insights.



Skills and Qualifications:


8+ years of proven working experience in data science, analytics, or a related field in tech/ cloud/ software domain.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL.
Experience with data visualization tools like Mixpanel, Domo or similar.
Solid understanding of backend data architecture and database management.
Ability to interpret complex data and present it in a clear, concise manner.
Familiarity with data privacy regulations and best practices.
Excellent problem-framing, problem solving and project management skills.
Excellent communication skills with proficiency in English.



Preferred Qualifications:


Experience in the B2C app companies, particularly with user data analysis.
Commercial acumen and the ability to align data insights with business objectives.
Understanding of app marketing strategies and associated data restrictions.
Knowledge of machine learning techniques and their application in business contexts.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively.
Fluency in AI-powered toolings to optimize productivity and efficiency.

Title: Data Analyst & Business Intelligence Manager m/f/d
Description:
Job Description

Position Overview

We have an exciting new job opportunity at our location in Brussels (Belgium) and are looking to hire a data analyst and business intelligence manager as part of our data & analytics team.

As the data analyst and business intelligence manager for Belgium & Luxemburg, your role will be instrumental in designing, developing, and maintaining a robust data ecosystem and in empowering stakeholders to make informed business decisions.

Your primary responsibilities will encompass end-to-end development of new Qlik Sense applications, or customization of existing ones, and the generation of various strategic data analysis. Your focus will involve extracting, transforming, and analyzing data from diverse sources, while also interacting with various business stakeholders to understand and capture their needs.

You will report to and work in close collaboration with the data & analytics lead and you will be part of a team of 5 talented data experts. The team generates, analyzes, models, and visualizes data, with the aim to deliver actionable insights, enable data-informed decision making, and promote a data driven culture.

Key Result Areas & Tasks

The Primary Activities May Include


Collaboration with stakeholders
Collaborate closely with internal stakeholders and data & analytics lead to understand business needs, and deliver data requirements.
Translate requirements into technical specifications and implement solutions accordingly.
Data Modelling, Visualization and Reporting
Design and create data models that represent the structure and relationships within the data. These models shall serve as the foundation for reporting and analysis.
Create visualizations to present data in a meaningful and accessible way for business users.
Build reports and interactive dashboards that allow users to explore data, analyze trends, and make informed decisions.
Data Querying, Data Integration and Quality Assurance
Employ SQL queries to retrieve data from various sources. Automate data flows where possible (API).
Integrate data from multiple sources and ensure data quality, consistency, and accuracy, by performing checks to identify and rectify any inconsistencies or errors.
Data Pipelines and ETL
Collect, transform, and load data into the BI system.
Perform ETL activities to ensure data is prepared and structured appropriately for analysis.
Data governance
build and maintain knowledge on existing/new data sources, data quality, and metadata.


Experience & Competencies

Ideal Experience, Skillset & Competencies


Strong academic record in a related field.
At least 2-3 years of prior work experience in similar roles.
Proficient English knowledge, both written and spoken.
Strong hands-on experience with visualization tools (Qlik Sense or/and Power BI).
Deep knowledge and hands-on experience with SQL, ETL.
Good communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to quickly develop effective trust-based relationships, working closely with cross functional stakeholders across the business.
Ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a globally dispersed team.


It would be great if you have

Strong knowledge of Qlik technologies including Qlik Sense


Familiarity with key digital and marketing tools, such as
Veeva CRM,
Google Analytics or other web tracking technologies,
Salesforce Marketing Cloud (SFMC)
API

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Role: Data Engineer

Location: Brussels 2 days per week on site




In the market for a Data Engineer partnering an Automotive organisations with who are seeking a skilled Data Engineer as they continue to invest in modernising their data solutions.




Key Skills:




‚Ä¢ ETL Implementation: Design and implement ETL processes to feed data warehouses,

ensuring data is accurately transformed and loaded.

‚Ä¢ Data Pipeline Development: Convert data flows into Databricks pipelines for certain data

elements, leveraging Databricks and PySpark.

‚Ä¢ Data Modelling: Utilize BI technology, data modelling, and dimensional modelling to support

data initiatives.

‚Ä¢ SQL Development: Generate and optimize SQL code using Oracle Data Integrator and

investigate data using SQL.




Must-Have Skills:

BI Technology & Data Modelling: Strong expertise in business intelligence technologies, data modeming, and dimensional modelling.
SQL Proficiency: Advanced skills in SQL, including generating, optimizing, and investigating data.
ETL & Data Integration: Experience with ETL processes and Oracle Data Integrator for data integration.
Databricks & PySpark: Familiarity with Databricks pipelines and PySpark.
Power BI: Experience with Power BI for data visualization and reporting.




CVs: Apply via job post or directly @ k.downs@enzotechgroup.com

Title: Marketing Business Planning & Analytics Analyst
Description:
Explore your next opportunity at a Fortune Global 500 organization. Envision innovative possibilities, experience our rewarding culture, and work with talented teams that help you become better every day. We know what it takes to lead UPS into tomorrow‚Äîpeople with a unique combination of skill + passion. If you have the qualities and drive to lead yourself or teams, there are roles ready to cultivate your skills and take you to the next level.

Job Description:

Function:

The Business Planning & Analytics (BPA) Analyst will work within the Europe Marketing Business Planning team based in Brussels. He / She will be responsible for developing reporting on the main KPIs for the Europe Region and providing valuable insights on monthly results & identified trends, supporting the decision making of senior management at the UPS Europe Headquarters. In addition to this, the Business Planning Analyst will support the Business Planning process throughout the year.

Tasks & Responsibilities:


Prepares ad-hoc analysis on multiple topics (B2B/B2C, lane trends, monthly results variances etc.) to provide valuable insights and executes data mining requests, ranging from ETL tasks to complete reports
Develops reporting based on given requirements, interactions with the users and collaborative input from peers and subject matter experts
Supports and advises the team with and on their existing reports and tools
Assesses market opportunities including market trends, key industries groups, network changes and service/product development or enhancements
Supports BP related ad-hoc requests from Region Staff and works on the different stages of development of the BP
Provides technical support for Country Business Planners
Educates and advises internal clients on how to leverage available data, reports and tools



What you'll get:


A salary starting from ‚Ç¨3500,- based on experience and knowledge.
A comprehensive range of extra-legal benefits, including group insurances (hospitalization, pension, life and disability) and meal vouchers. Being part of the UPS world will offer you much more than this. You will be exposed to a dynamic, fast paced, international environment made of highly talented individuals and you will learn from years of solid experience. You will be part of the world's leading logistics company where your talent is recognized and rewarded.



Profile:


Strong affinity for and experienced in MS Excel (formulas, pivot tables with a basic understanding of macros and VBA), MS Access
Uses clear documentation principles in designing and testing processes & hypothesis
Knowledge of SQL is a strong plus
Database/Statistical programming is an asset
Pro-active, driven self-starter, attention to detail is essential
Communicates articulately, concisely
Strong sense of responsibility, disciplined and proven ability to handle properly time management
Problem-solving attitude with an end oriented work capacity
Fluent English is essential, additional languages are an asset
BS degree in economics, engineering, business or marketing preferred



Job location:


Brussels, Belgium



Employee Type:

Permanent

UPS is committed to providing a workplace free of discrimination, harassment, and retaliation.

Title: Medior Data Engineer
Description:
Exsolv√¶ is a data consultancy based in Brussels, Belgium. We are dedicated to fostering a culture of knowledge sharing among data professionals.

Our goal is not only to excel in one discipline, but also to gain a comprehensive understanding of the challenges spread across the four pillars of our expertise:




Data Foundations: Data Engineering to Design, develop, and maintain data architecture and infrastructure, build data pipelines, etc.
BI, Data Analytics & Visualization: Design and implement data visualization solutions that enable to gain insights from the data.
Data Science & Artificial Intelligence: Implement & Develop algorithms in Deep Learning, Machine Learning & Artificial Intelligence.
Data Governance & Strategy: Strategic consultancy for acquisition and valorization of Data.




We provide a collaborative ecosystem for a new generation of pluri-disciplinary engineers who are eager to broaden their understanding of challenges across the data flow.

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Data Engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining our data architecture and infrastructure. The successful candidate will have a strong understanding of database management systems, ETL processes, and data warehousing.




Responsibilities:




Design, build and maintain scalable, reliable, and efficient data pipelines to ingest and process large volumes of data from various sources.




Develop and maintain database schemas, data models, and data access protocols to ensure data consistency, quality, and security.




Implement and optimize ETL processes for data integration, data transformation, and data cleansing.




Collaborate with Data Scientists, Data Analysts, and other stakeholders to understand their data needs, and provide them with high-quality data products and services.




Monitor, troubleshoot, and optimize data infrastructure to ensure data quality, reliability, and performance.




Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies, tools, and best practices in data engineering, and continuously improve our data infrastructure and processes.




Provide technical guidance and mentoring to other team members, and contribute to a positive and collaborative team culture.




Qualifications:




Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.




3+ years of professional experience in data engineering, with a proven track record of designing, building, and maintaining data infrastructure and pipelines.




Strong programming skills in Python, SQL, and at least one distributed computing framework (e.g., Hadoop, Spark, Flink).




Experience with cloud-based data platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and related services (e.g., S3, EMR, BigQuery).




Solid understanding of database management systems (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB) and data warehousing concepts.




Familiarity with data modeling and data integration techniques, and experience with ETLtools (e.g., Talend, Apache NiFi, Airflow).




Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyze complex data sets and identify data quality issues.




Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.




Fluent Speaking and Writing (Mandatory, Trilingual preferred): English, French AND/OR Dutch.




We offer a competitive salary, a comprehensive benefits package, and opportunities for growth and development. If you are passionate about data engineering and want to join this challenging journey, we will be happy to meet you in our offices.

Title: Data Engineer / Analytics Engineer
Description:
About Qover:

We are Qover, a leading insurtech scale-up that has raised $70 million.

With an international team of 125+ colleagues based in Brussels, we help companies orchestrate digital embedded insurance experiences ‚Äì driving opportunities for growth and revenue.

Since Qover was founded in 2016, our co-founders had a clear vision of the future of insurance: it must be simple, transparent and accessible across borders ‚Äì a global safety net.

To that end, our platform covers 3 million users across 32 European countries and works with longstanding partners like Revolut, Deliveroo, NIO, Canyon, Monzo, Cowboy, and many others.

Visit our website for more about what we do!

Your Job :

Qover is seeking an Analytics Engineer or a Data Engineer to strengthen our data capabilities.

As a core member of the data team, you will contribute to the definition of the data solutions that best answer our business needs. You will be in the driver's seat for implementing the data products, from prototyping to production, while always ensuring that your technical solutions align with the best engineering practices.

The Qover data team plays a critical role in the company's day-to-day operations. We are therefore looking for someone able to clean and concise SQL code that can be reliably put into production

Tasks and responsibilities:

Your main objective is to develop and maintain scalable and clean data solutions to support the launch and execution of our insurance programs.

We expect you to:


Develop, maintain and improve our dbt data pipelines used to ensure the day-to-day operations of our embedded insurance programs
Propose and implement a robust data model that can cope with the specificities of insurance data and requires little modification to support the launch of the new product
Automate as much as possible our operational reports. While some reports still involve manual work today, we want to reduce the operational burden to rock bottom
Navigate in the different layers of our BigQuery datawarehouse and leverage synergies across our data sources so that our databases stay clean and don‚Äôt turn into a data maze
Develop and maintain the dashboard front-end by leveraging synergies between Looker and Looker Studio



ensure that our partner‚Äôs data stays secured and private, one of our top priority


Collaborate with the business teams. You will need to help them define what are the most important metrics to display
Ensure a sufficient level of documentation



Required qualifications:


Strong knowledge of SQL
you are familiar with concepts such as CTEs, date spine, window functions, joins on complex predicates, array manipulations
you like to write clean, easy-to-read, easy-to-maintain, SQL
you can detect anti-patterns in SQL and propose solutions to fix it
Experience with data modelling
you first think deeply about a data problem before proceeding with the implementation
you are able to break down a problem into logical pieces and explain clearly your approach
Experience in dbt and Looker is highly desirable as they are both critical components of our tech stack
Fluency in python
You are familiar with the modern data stack
Experience with git and bash
Excellent communication and presentation skills and fluent in English
While you always want to keep up with market trends and best practices, you are also pragmatic. You feel comfortable trading technical elegance to be able to speed up the pace of delivery
Flexible and able to quickly adapt to any business situations
Autonomous, you are also hands-on with a strong team spirit
You are proactive and self-driven. You need minimal supervision and welcome changes. You are comfortable dealing with ambiguity
You have a can-do mentality



By joining our dynamic and ambitious team, we offer:


Lots of modern extra-legal benefits (Mobility allowance, Home working allowance, Meal vouchers, Hospitalisation insurance, Pension scheme, Mobile phone subscription, 28 days holidays (+11 legal bank holidays, etc.)
A nice working space in a great location in Brussels: Qover-dedicated space at WeWork (Rue du Commerce 31) with a large terrace to enjoy team events
A positive company culture that values teamwork and taking initiative but also having fun, with regular social events
A collaborative and communal environment where everyone is welcomed, valued, and accepted regardless of their nationality, gender, age, sexual orientation, disability, philosophical or political views, etc
The chance to work among entrepreneurial people, allowing you to learn and have a real impact at one of Europe‚Äôs fastest-growing InsurTech

Title: Data Engineer (H/F)
Description:
LittleBigCode is a cutting-edge digital consulting laboratory specializing in Data and Artificial Intelligence.




Our mission is to democratize the use of these technologies by collaboratively building impactful applications with our customers, addressing key societal challenges in areas such as health, mobility, and the environment.




We pride ourselves on delivering turnkey projects, offering consulting services, and developing innovative solutions, all while embracing Cloud technologies, AGILE methods, and a DevOps culture for seamless industrialization and scalability.




Our Achievements:

A vibrant community of over 80 enthusiasts in Data Science & Data Engineering.
International presence and missions ‚Äì we're launching our new office in Belgium!
Engaging workshops, Innovation contests, and successful customer challenges.




Join Us in Belgium




Your Role as Data engineer at LittleBigCode :




Working collaboratively in an AGILE environment alongside Data Scientists, architects, and DevOps coaches, your responsibilities will include:




Consulting & Expertise

Analyzing strategic challenges related to Data for our customers.
Contributing to defining ambitions and creating Data roadmaps.
Conducting audits and framing projects (architecture, methodology, code quality).
Supporting projects involving Data-centric architecture.




R&D and Solutions

Participating in the development of internal solutions.
Proposing and creating innovative Data solutions.




Who You Are

Hold a Master's in engineering (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics).
Possess relevant experience as a Data Engineer.
Proficient in programming languages, especially Python and SQL (Scala is a plus).
Familiar with Big Data technologies such as Spark, Hadoop, Kafka, Cassandra, Mongo, etc.
Fully conversant with data services of at least one major Cloud Provider (Azure, AWS, GCP) and various Database types.
Strong understanding of data structuring and modularization concepts.
Experience with ETL processes and setup.
Comfortable with DevOps practices
Fluent in English; proficiency in Dutch and/or French is a significant advantage.




If you are a passionate Data Engineer with a desire to contribute to innovative projects and shape the future of society, we invite you to join our dynamic LittleBigCode team in Belgium!

Title: Data Visualization Specialist/ Tableau Expert
Description:
Our client, a major actor within the banking sector, is looking for a Data Visualization Specialist and Tableau expert!




In a context of Sales Performance evolution and strong digitalisation, it is necessary to respond to the growing needs by creating dashboards:

- that is able to easily create and maintain dashboards in Tableau

- that helps and supports the current Tableau users within the team




Description of the function:




The Data Visualization Specialist and Tableau Expert will support the internal clients and realize several different data reporting‚Äôs and visualization projects by:

Understanding and identifying, together with the stakeholders, their reporting and visualization needs,
Capturing the requirements and translating them firstly into a prototype and secondly into a full Tableau dashboard,
Presenting the full Tableau Dashboards to our stakeholders and get their feedback for later updates
Developing, updating, optimizing, publishing & decommissioning (= full life-cycle) reports/dashboards in accordance with the data & reporting governance guidelines,
Striving for the most optimal solution for the development and automation of reports/dashboards,
Collaborating with our Data Engineers in order to create adequate and sustainable data solutions for Tableau dashboards
Setting-up, advocating and implementing reporting and visualization best practices, in accordance with the guidelines and standards defined by the client,
Being the guardian & ambassador of this governance put in place.




Requirements:




At least 3 years of experience in dashboarding & reporting (Tableau)
Experience with SQL (writing and understanding queries, ‚Ä¶)
Knowledge of functioning of ETL tool (SAS Programming / SAS EGP) and DBMS Systems (Oracle / Sybase)
Soft skills: team player, problem-solver, good analytical and synthesis skills, ability to work in a dynamic and multi-cultural environment
