Title: Data & Analytics Consultant
Description:
Mission

YOUR FUNCTION:

Within the Digital Connected Company & Innovation we focus on helping our clients unlock the value within data. In order to support our unit, we are looking for Big Data / Analytics/ AI consultants who are able to implement an End-2-End data platform.

A data platform designed and driven by business value, is able to ingest data in a proper way, can manage the data quality, can store data securely and offers possibilities for integration with client-specific platforms.

As a Data & Analytics Consultant you have experience with multiple aspects of data: from (master)data management, over big data, data lakes, data visualization to data science and machine learning. You can use data in both a traditional data context (dashboard and reports), but also use it within the modern era of big data solutions, artificial intelligence and advanced analytics.

You have experience in one or more of these domains:


You are able to listen to business people, understand their challenge and shape a data solution that brings value.
Set up data platforms and the data management (the data model, integration, authorization), with all the components needed to support the data strategy of the customer (AI capabilities, Visualization, MDM,..)
Build data science or machine learning solutions that will bring business value. Build and optimize the best possible algorithm but also a webservice or application that can be used in an operational environment
Visualize the data on the best possible way: from a cooperate dashboards, an interactive report to a full self-service environment
Set up processes and governance that will be enabler for a data-driven culture (data stewardship, golden record, data lineage,..)


Profile

YOUR PROFILE


You obtained a master‚Äôs degree in applied statistics, computer science, engineering or similar by experience
You are passionate about data and analytics technology and trends
Have at least 3 years‚Äô experience in implementing data solution and analytics
You are fluent in Python or R
Have knowledge about data architecture, data integration, big data, data lakes, data visualization, computer vision, natural language processing, machine learning
You have experience with different data consumption techniques from traditional to more advanced analytics and AI perspective. (Power BI, Tableau, PyTorch, TensorFlow‚Ä¶)
Or you have hands-on experience with data platforms (e.g Azure, AWS, Google, Databricks, Boomi, Collibra, snowflake‚Ä¶) and are not afraid to dive into something you don‚Äôt know.
Have at least 1 year experience with Relational database technology
Have at least 1 year experience with NoSQL database technology
You have a good understanding of clustering, predictive modeling techniques and recommender systems
You have a pro-active, can-do mindset
You communicate clearly in Dutch and/or French and English (both written and spoken).


You get bonus points if‚Ä¶


You can present and defend your solutions in front of clients
You are able to organize, facilitate and lead workshops


OUR OFFER:


The opportunity to have a meaningful job where you can make a difference
The chance to continuously evolve as a professional, coupled with a variety of training opportunities
Relevant career opportunities to get you where you want to be, with the IT knowledge you need
Inetum-Realdolmen wants you to find a balance between work and private life by offering flexible hours, satellite offices and home working
32 days of annual leave, because life isn‚Äôt all about working
Forget about the miles: we provide you with a company car and a national fuel card
Group insurance and hospitalization insurance, because we care about you
And of course, we also offer a gross salary. One which is optimized from a net perspective for our employees!


Interested? Questions? Recommendations? For more information, contact your recruiter Pino Amico via pino.amico@inetum-realdolmen.world

Organization

Inetum Realdolmen, a member of the European Inetum Group with approximately 1,950 highly qualified employees, provides strategic, tactical and operational ICT solutions for over 1,000 customers throughout the Benelux. In every cooperation, Realdolmen realizes the potential of people and organizations and strives to keep ICT human. We are driven by technological innovation, but we advance at the speed of your ambition, results-focused and managing fundamental change.

Our company motto "New Challenges, New Ideas" reflects this.

An employer you really want to work for!

Not only is Realdolmen a no-nonsense, solid, stable and experienced company with great in-house knowledge and expertise, but we also put our employees first: every individual receives the attention they need. ‚ÄòHeart for People' is more than just words for us ‚Äì it's one of our very core values.

Satellite offices, extensive training opportunities, work-life balance, competence reviews and career opportunities: these are no empty promises for us. Our organization attaches great importance to diversity. We guarantee an objective selection process, whereby candidates are tested and selected solely on the basis of their qualities and skills.

With us it's all about you!

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Quantitative analyst

About US (GEMS):

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales (GEMS) provides energy supply solutions and risk management services to support its clients through their decarbonization journey, while optimizing ENGIE‚Äôs assets and contributing to value creation.

ENGIE is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services with a leading energy management business, piloted by its entity "Global Energy Management & Sales" who built its savoir-faire managing the Group‚Äôs large and diverse asset portfolio over 20+ years.

3,600 employees around the world develop our solutions, through +20 international business platforms. We cover the full energy mix: renewable and thermal power, natural gas & LNG, biomass, environmental products. Our experts provide tailor made solutions based on a wide range of savoir-faire in energy management with a strong focus on decarbonation and decentralization.

Our 190,000 clients span the entire value chain: producers, asset developers, financial players, utilities, distributors and industrials. Our global reach and strong local presence enable us to offer these diverse clients tailor-made services and respond to rapid changes in mature or emerging markets alike.

Our 4 expertises:


Asset management
Energy transition services
Energy supply & global commodities
Risk management & market access


At GEMS we encourage breakthrough results, team spirit, curiosity and innovation while preserving the right work/life balance for you.

More info on GEMS Hub ( https://gems.engie.com ) or LinkedIn ( https://www.linkedin.com/company/engie-global-energy-management-solutions ).

Context: The Expertise Center (EC) Quantitative Research and Modeling (QRM) within GEMS is a team of around 40 quantitative analysts. It‚Äôs mission is to provide advanced quantitative expertise to all Business Platforms (BP) of GEMS. The quantitative analyst will be part of the ‚ÄúPower & Emissions‚Äù quant team (approximately 10 people) and will be fully dedicated to the Business Platform Power Trading, Origination and Structuring. Role:

The quantitative analyst should design and provide robust quantitative tools that have a concrete impact on the power business:


Work very closely with the BP Power Trading, Structuring and Origination, and mainly with the Renewable and Batteries Trading team and the Asset Backed Power Trading team. He / She needs to understand their business needs, and needs to provide them with high-quality quantitative support in their day to day activities.
Participate in enhancing the existing pricing and managing framework.
Deliver ad hoc tactical solutions as well as develop new pricers in the official pricing library.
Play a key role for developing new products, linked for example to the renewable and battery business (pricing, managing strategies, various risk indicators, ‚Ä¶).
Promote best coding practices that comply with general rules and standards.
Document and share knowledge across GEMS on the different models used within GEMS.


Hard skills:


Must have:

Strong Financial Mathematical background (probability, stochastic calculus, various numerical methods such as Monte Carlo, finite differences, ‚Ä¶)
Experience on different optimization methods
Strong coding experience (preferably C# and python), object oriented programming skills
Experience in a trading environment
Familiar with Git




Good to have:

Experience on the power markets

Soft skills:


Must have:

Practical and conceptual thinking
Ability to explain and convey messages about complex issues
Ability to deliver concrete solutions
Autonomy
Working together

Education and professional background:


Engineering or university degree (Master of PhD) in Computer Sciences, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Financial Engineering.
Any seniority will be examined.


Languages:


English


Travels: Occasional travels (for example conferences) are possible, but limited.

If you meet these requirements, then you are the talent we are looking for. Do not waste time!

Apply by attaching your updated CV, regardless your gender.

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales is committed to create a gender-neutral environment that unlocks the potential of everyone and provides equal employment opportunities for all individuals.

All our positions are open to people with disabilities, please let your recruiter know if you need reasonable accommodations to be able to participate in the recruitment process, they will be happy to assist you.

About ENGIE:

Our group is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services. Our purpose (‚Äúraison d‚Äô√™tre‚Äù) is to act to accelerate the transition towards a carbon-neutral world, through reduced energy consumption and more environmentally-friendly solutions, reconciling economic performance with a positive impact on people and the planet. We rely on our key businesses (gas, power, renewable energy, services) to offer competitive solutions to our customers. With our 96,000 employees, our customers, partners and stakeholders, we are a community of Imaginative Builders, committed every day to more harmonious progress.

Title: Data Warehouse Engineer
Description:
At Uni Systems, we are working towards turning digital visions into reality. We are continuously growing and we are looking for a Data Scientist to join our UniQue team.

What will you be doing in this role?

Understand and model policy and operational needs.
Develop data products to meet the business needs.
Compile the information and deliver detailed analyses using the reporting tools at hand (e.g. Excel, SAP BusinessObjects, SQL, Python, Qliksense).
Recognize potential needs for new data products in response to business requests from the Business units and other stakeholders.
Collect business requirement, identify, assess and deploy relevant existing data processing, machine learning and business intelligence solution.
Query, process and/or structure data from various sources and carry out analysis.
Design and development of reporting applications.
Validate and format data and draft analysis reports and/or update existing ones.
Data modelling.
Design of Data Quality and Health Monitoring processes.



Requirements



What will you be bringing to the team?

Bachelor Degree in IT or related field and 13 years of experience in IT.
Extensive experience with relational database systems applied to data warehouse.
Experience with Python and data analytics package Pandas
Extensive experience with SQL.
Experience with Qliksense.
Experience with near real time data warehousing and/or change data capture technologies.
Experience with SAP Business Intelligence reporting environment.
Experience with cloud technologies and architecture (data lakes), especially in Amazon AWS, such as Amazon's Athena, Redshift etc, will be considered as an asset.
Business understanding of Research and Innovation funding scheme and policy activities is highly desirable.
Machine learning experience to cluster/classify data using supervised and unsupervised algorithms would be an asset.
At least 1 year of experience with JIRA ticketing and Confluence.
Fluent in English at least at a level C1, knowledge of French is an advantage.



Benefits



At Uni Systems, we are providing equal employment opportunities and banning any form of discrimination on grounds of gender, religion, race, color, nationality, disability, social class, political beliefs, age, marital status, sexual orientation or any other characteristics. Take a look at our Diversity, Equality & Inclusion Policy for more information.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Seeking an organized and detail-oriented data base squinted person to oversee our sustainability
data acquisition, dissemination, and project management.
We are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented professional to join our team and oversee the
effective utilization of internal and external data tools and services to support business operations
and facilitate informed decision-making



1. AIDA: Incident Database Management:
First Priority: AIDA is an inhouse adverse Incident Database which has been launched a year ago
* Work closely with regions to plan and enhance the incident tracking and emergency helpline
improvements, ensuring all stakeholders are aligned and improvements are made where
needed.
* Lead and Support regions & countries to achieve the improvement targets for 2024,
including historical data uploads, helpline trainings, etc.
* Oversee and conduct basic maintenance on AIDA system, cooperate with HSE & IT teams.
* Provide user support including by handling access rights, keeping important information
correct and UpToDate, and promptly addressing any questions or issues raised by users.
* Compile and distribute incident data reports and dashboards to key stakeholders, including
regulatory teams and regional/global teams for insights.
* Onboard and explain the details of Incident management programs, AIDA, dashboards, and
data insights to new stakeholders.
2. Manage 3P and internal tools and services for internal stakeholders to support business
to track data and deliver insights:
Agrolense Data Collection Platform:
* Ensure seamless operation, maintenance, and continuous enhancement of the Agrolense
data collection platform in alignment with business requirements

Collaborate with the 6G team to fine-tune the platform and generate insightful reports for
dissemination to key stakeholders, including the SYT teams in IN, ID, AME, Value Chain
team -Kellogg, CLKS and KAP project teams.
* Guarantee the successful integration of API link with CFT (external service) for on-farm
carbon footprint measurement within the Agrolense platform.
* Global Safe Use training data collection tool: Take charge of project management in
collaboration with the core team to finalize data collection parameters and visualization
needs (establish 6G API link to Qliksense)
"BIR" tool: House made intranet-based business decision support tool
* Coordinate with the business team to finalize the visual, content and wording aspects of the
tool, ensuring alignment with brand and corporate guidance, legal requirement.
* Collaborate with the SYT IT team to implement changes to the tool in a timely manner,
making certain that project team approves the finalized specifications prior to launch.

the global database on a quarterly basis, aligning with EPA and product design codes in
collaboration with the IT team.

for continuous improvement.

and regional initiatives.

regions and countries.

Title: Data Analyst - Metals
Description:
Job Description: Data Analyst ‚Äì Metals Sector




We are looking for an ambitious data analyst who is passionate about sustainability and data-driven business. In this role, you will work with ecoinvent users and data providers to enhance the metals sector of the ecoinvent database.




Responsibilities:

Provide technical support for diverse projects aimed at improving and developing the core structure of the ecoinvent database and the expansion of its coverage, including:

Desk research tasks, deep dives into metal production processes, and providing analyses to the sector manager.

Reviewing datasets for data provision projects.

Collaborate with external stakeholders, such as data providers, to guide them through the data preparation and submission process.
Support the communication efforts of ecoinvent, reinforcing support for users of the ecoinvent database.




Qualifications:

Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs Degree in Mining, Metallurgy, or a related field a must.
Preferably a minimum of one year of industry experience in mining, metal processing, or a related field
Experience in LCA, practical or theoretical, and the ecoinvent methodology and data is a plus.
Proficiency in English; any other language is an asset.
Proficiency in MS Office.
Basic programming skills, especially in Python.
Basic modeling skills.
Self-motivated attitude, systematic thinking, and strong attention to detail.

The ideal candidate brings strong critical thinking skills and a problem-solving attitude. You are proactive, structured, and organized. You are enthusiastic about learning and pushing for innovation. You will work independently and alongside internal and external collaborators, so good interpersonal skills, effective communication skills, and a can-do attitude are essential. Managing multiple, diverse tasks simultaneously does not phase you. You enjoy working in a diverse and international team, have a curious mind, and grasp new concepts quickly.




Why ecoinvent?

As a fast-growing team based in Z√ºrich with over twenty nationalities, we embrace diversity and promote a collaborative and adventurous mindset. We are committed to building an inspiring work culture that nurtures creative thinking, transparency, and reliability.




Our benefits include flexible and hybrid work, employee professional growth plans, and our most vital asset: our community. We value transparency, flexibility, and a diverse working environment that encourages learning and continuous improvement. Collaboration is at the heart of what we do. Join us and make an impact.




Our Mission

ecoinvent is an internationally active, mission-driven organization devoted to supporting high-quality, science-based environmental assessments. Its activities include publishing and maintaining the ecoinvent database‚Äîa comprehensive life cycle inventory database that provides reliable and transparent information on the environmental impacts of various products and services. It is used by companies, researchers, and policymakers to analyze the environmental impacts of their operations and make informed decisions.




Interested in this unique opportunity?

Please submit your complete application through our LinkedIn posting, including your CV and possible start date.




Please note that immigration sponsorship is not possible for this role.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Summary


This role is responsible for leading the collection, cleaning, preprocessing, and analysis of large datasets to derive meaningful insights. The role generates regular reports and ad-hoc analysis, highlighting key metrics and insights that inform business decisions. The role translates complex data into actionable recommendations for various departments, such as marketing, operations, or finance. The role ensures data accuracy, integrity, and consistency across all analyses and reports.


Responsibilities


Participates as a senior member of team of other data science engineers carrying out the investigation, design, development, execution, and implementation of data science projects to generate new insights, products, technologies, and intellectual property.
Creates extensive plans, data collection and analysis procedures and data insight visualizations for assigned projects.
Reviews and assesses existing reporting suite with a view of modernization through automation and process improvement.
Collaborates with internal and external partners to perform experiments and validations in accordance with overall plan.
Collaborates with SMEs to develop procedures for collecting, recording, analyzing, and communicating data for review and feedback.
Prepares literature and presentations for peer review, publication, and delivery at industry and scientific events and conferences; creates patent applications and supporting documentation.
Drives innovation and integration of new Data Science related technologies and practices into projects and activities in the R&D organizations.
Provides guidance and mentoring to less- experienced staff members.
Applies advanced subject matter knowledge, leads, and contributes to complex projects, and exercises independent judgment in resolving business issues and establishing policies.
Develops and builds productive internal/external working relationships and may provide mentoring and guidance to lower-level employees.


Education & Experience Recommended


Four-year or Graduate Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or any other related discipline or commensurate work experience or demonstrated competence.
Typically has 7-10 years of work experience, preferably in data analytics, database management, statistical analysis, or a related field.


Preferred Certifications


Programming Language/s Certification (SQL, Python, or similar)


Knowledge & Skills


Agile Methodology
Business Intelligence
Computer Science
Dashboard
Data Analysis
Data Management
Data Modeling
Data Quality
Data Science
Data Visualization
Data Warehousing
Extract Transform Load (ETL)
Machine Learning
Power BI
Python (Programming Language)
R (Programming Language)
SAS (Software)
SQL (Programming Language)
Statistics
Tableau (Business Intelligence Software)


Cross-Org Skills


Effective Communication
Results Orientation
Learning Agility
Digital Fluency
Customer Centricity


Impact & Scope


Impacts function and leads and/or provides expertise to functional project teams and may participate in cross-functional initiatives.


Complexity


Works on complex problems where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of multiple factors.


Disclaimer


This job description describes the general nature and level of work performed in this role. It is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, skills, responsibilities, knowledge, etc. These may be subject to change and additional functions may be assigned as needed by management.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Data Analyst role involves collecting, processing, and analysing data to help us make informed decisions. You will be responsible for interpreting data sets, performing statistical analyses to identify trends, and developing data models to predict future outcomes. The analyst will work closely with stakeholders to understand their data needs, ensuring accurate and accessible reporting. You should possess strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and the ability to communicate complex findings in a clear and understandable manner. This position requires a blend of technical expertise and business acumen to contribute to data-driven strategies that drive the organization's goals forward.

Responsibilities

Primary Responsibilities:



Support operational analysis component of the Tenerity business
Build automated reporting processes to minimize manual effort
Collaborate with key business stakeholders (Acquisition, Performance Marketing, Billing, and Finance) to identify opportunities where data science can drive value, improve processes, and generate actionable insights.
Communicate complex technical concepts and findings in a clear and concise manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Act as a data expert to support account teams in answering questions and queries



Qualifications

Qualifications:



Bachelor or Master‚Äôs degree, preferably in Analytics, Computer Science, Information Systems, Mathematics, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, Data Science
1-2+ years proven experience
Competencies in utilizing SQL for data retrieval and analysis
Other coding languages are a plus ( SAS, R, Python, etc.)
Strong analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving abilities
Ability to interpret data effectively to provide insight for strategic partnerships
Skillful in Microsoft applications with advanced Excel exposure (ex. v-lookups, pivot tables, VB macro scripting, etc.)
Experience in Amazon QuickSight is a plus
Ability to work on multiple projects and tasks simultaneously
Effective verbal and written communication skills, including ability to communicate and collaborate effectively with internal and external stakeholders
Fluent in English, French or other languages are a plus
Strong time management skills
Ability to adapt to challenging situations
Ability to work in a multicultural environment
Strong stakeholders management skills

Title: Business Intelligence/ Data Analytics Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Born from a single question, innovation is in our DNA. Having recently celebrated our 10-year anniversary, we are a diverse and quality-conscious company, which has set itself the goal of transporting temperature-sensitive medicines in a more reliable and sustainable way. Long story short, we help save lives and preserve the environment.

Our goal? To continue to advance towards zero loss in the pharma supply chain, worldwide.

If you're a BI Data Analytics Analyst with strong skills in business intelligence tools and systems, KPI dashboard development and maintenance, trend analysis for actionable insights, financial planning support and data-driven decision-making - this could be the role for you:

Here's what you'll do:


Implement and Improvement of Business Intelligence Tools and systems
Implement, develop, and maintain of internal and external KPI Dashboards
Prepare reports and analyses in order to identify trends to generate actionable business insights
Support the Controlling/Financial Planning and Analysis team
Support the other departments with data insights
Maintain of the Business Intelligence tool and EPM
Act as sparring Partner for the Finance Team, CFO, Deputy CFO and the Management team
Participate in interdisciplinary projects



Requirements

This is what you'll need:


Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Analytics & Presentation, combined with Business/Finance or equivalent
Several years of practical experience in Business Intelligence, AI, Data Mining, Data analytics, and Data Modeling, ERP/EPM projects either from a consultancy or an industry position in international growth/scale-up environments
Proven experience with data modelling, business intelligence tools and systems
Excellent knowledge of data analysis and visualization tools like Excel, SAP Business Analytics, Power BI, SQL, etc
IT Project Management and implementation experience
Ability to convert complex data into clear, concise reports and presentations
Interest in figures, business contexts, data, numbers, research, and analysis
Ability to manage several tasks in detail and accuracy, without loosing the overview
Result-oriented with a focus on long-term goals and career growth
Fluent in English and German



Benefits

What we can offer you:


Flexible working hours for work/life balance
Interdisciplinary and varied projects
Diverse and global work culture/ environment
Possibility to work for an environmentally conscious company
Unique opportunity to actively shape processes



Why SkyCell:

We are looking for people who challenge the status quo and thrive on making a difference to people and the world around us. That's where our Finance & Admin team play a pivotal role and you could be a part of it.

Our Group Controlling & Finance Department is at the heart of our strategic decision-making process. We analyze financial data to provide strategic insights and support decision-making as well as develop and implement financial strategies to optimize our resources. Our team is not just about crunching numbers; we're about shaping the future of SkyCell AG. We work closely with senior leadership to drive growth, profitability, and sustainability.

We are Innovative Award Winners:

We're driven by our core values and guided by our collaborations, purpose, and employees. Our commitment to changing the face of medical supply chains, making them safer, more secure, and more sustainable resonates strongly with every one of our employees; we're therefore incredibly proud to have been certified as a Great Place to Work alongside being awarded a sustainability rating of Platinum by EcoVadis.

If you would like to know more about us, visit www.skycell.ch and search #WeAreSkyCell on LinkedIn.

To become part of our journey and make a difference - click apply and we will be in touch!

Please contact Lucy Slough, Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist if you have any questions (hr@skycell.ch).

SkyCell AG is proud to be an equal opportunities employer, we celebrate and support diversity and are passionate about creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, colour, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics.

For this position we only consider direct applications

HTML:
Born from a single question, innovation is in our DNA. Having recently celebrated our 10-year anniversary, we are a diverse and quality-conscious company, which has set itself the goal of transporting temperature-sensitive medicines in a more reliable and sustainable way. Long story short, we help save lives and preserve the environment.

Our goal? To continue to advance towards zero loss in the pharma supply chain, worldwide.

If you're a BI Data Analytics Analyst with strong skills in business intelligence tools and systems, KPI dashboard development and maintenance, trend analysis for actionable insights, financial planning support and data-driven decision-making - this could be the role for you:

Here's what you'll do:

  • Implement and Improvement of Business Intelligence Tools and systems
  • Implement, develop, and maintain of internal and external KPI Dashboards
  • Prepare reports and analyses in order to identify trends to generate actionable business insights
  • Support the Controlling/Financial Planning and Analysis team
  • Support the other departments with data insights
  • Maintain of the Business Intelligence tool and EPM
  • Act as sparring Partner for the Finance Team, CFO, Deputy CFO and the Management team
  • Participate in interdisciplinary projects


Requirements

This is what you'll need:

  • Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Analytics & Presentation, combined with Business/Finance or equivalent
  • Several years of practical experience in Business Intelligence, AI, Data Mining, Data analytics, and Data Modeling, ERP/EPM projects either from a consultancy or an industry position in international growth/scale-up environments
  • Proven experience with data modelling, business intelligence tools and systems
  • Excellent knowledge of data analysis and visualization tools like Excel, SAP Business Analytics, Power BI, SQL, etc
  • IT Project Management and implementation experience
  • Ability to convert complex data into clear, concise reports and presentations
  • Interest in figures, business contexts, data, numbers, research, and analysis
  • Ability to manage several tasks in detail and accuracy, without loosing the overview
  • Result-oriented with a focus on long-term goals and career growth
  • Fluent in English and German


Benefits

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
A career at Lombard Odier means working for a renowned global wealth and asset manager, with a strong focus on sustainable investing. An innovative bank of choice for private and institutional clients, our independently owned Firm is one of the best-capitalised banking groups in the world, managing close to CHF 300 billion and operating from over 25 offices across 4 continents.




With a history spanning over 225 years, Lombard Odier is an investment house providing a comprehensive offering of discretionary and advisory portfolio management, wealth services and custody. We also offer asset management services and investment strategies through Lombard Odier Investment Managers and provide

advanced banking technology to other financial institutions.




‚ÄúRethink Everything‚Äù is our philosophy ‚Äì it is at the heart of everything we do. We have grown stronger through more than 40 financial crises by rethinking the world around us to provide a fresh investment perspective for our clients.




Our technology team works directly and closely with the Business. Our IT ecosystem is based on state-of-the-art tools from leading financial software providers. In addition to this, we develop our own solutions using agile development and DevOps techniques.




In order to strengthen our Asset Management - IT team, we are looking for a Geneva based:




Business Intelligence Analyst ‚Äì Temporary (6 months)




Primary responsibilities




Migrate manual process (excel) into automated Alteryx workflows & Tableau dashboards
Drive collaboration with various units to optimize and streamline their operational workflows
Provide guidance and support to business users in utilizing our Business intelligence for self-service analytics and reporting




Desired profile




University degree in finance, information technology or equivalent
Knowledge of Business Intelligence platforms ‚Äì Tableau & Alteryx is preferred
Team player with strong communication skills
Quick learner with strong problem-solving skills




Why join us




Our Maison‚Äôs DNA is defined by five core values. Excellence drives us to be the best at what we do, while Innovation fuels our progress. Respect underpins every interaction, and Integrity shapes our actions. Together, we are One Team, united in serving our clients with unwavering dedication.




LOIM is an equal opportunity employer




We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment, where talented people inspire the organization with a diversity of thought, background, experience and identity to reinforce our innovation and deliver excellence. We firmly believe this is how we will continue to thrive. To deliver on this, we have actively embedded Diversity & Inclusion in our business strategy.

Show more

Title: (Junior-) Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Arrakis aims to disrupt the current market-making industry by providing the infrastructure to enable every project in the world that wants to launch a token to benefit from non-custodial, trust-less, and automated on-chain market-making strategies. We believe in a world where every organization, from a small startup to a large enterprise, will be tokenized and traded on-chain. For this world, Arrakis is building the tools to create the necessary liquidity to enable this token economy to rival and out-compete the traditional financial industry.

As a Quantitative Analyst at Arrakis, you will drive our liquidity provisioning strategies, develop quantitative analyses of on-chain trading activities and own client relationships to deliver tailored market-making services. You'll also work with our business development team on client onboarding, account management and enhance our quantitative algorithms with the core development team. Your contributions will be vital in establishing Arrakis as the leading decentralised market-making protocol.

What You'll Accomplish


Working with some of the leading DeFi projects in web3 to strengthen their on-chain liquidity
Keep ahead of the latest developments in quantitative finance, blockchain technology, and Web3 innovations to continuously refine and adapt our market making strategies (e.g. upcoming migration to UniswapV4) to maintain a competitive edge in the rapidly evolving web3 market-making industry
Collaborate with Cross-Functional Teams: Work closely with software engineers, data scientists and business development representatives to refine, enhance and develop the best market making service to our clients
Own customer relationships and provide excellent client service by monitoring the ongoing market-making activities and respond to custom client requests
Perform data analysis and design Analytics dashboards with on-chain data



Requirements

Our ideal candidate has:


At least 2 years professional experience in Trading, Quantitative Finance, Market Making (preferred)
Experience in Quantitative analysis and Data Science preferably on-chain data / DeFi
Web3 native using DeFi protocols every day/week
Experience working with JavaScript / TypeScript, SQL
Bonus: Rust, Dune Analytics
Some experience with hands on software development in a quantitative finance environment
Comfortable in fast-paced environments and having ambitious targets
Excellent communication skills being able to engage in client relationship management and communication
Well-organised with strong time management skills and a proactive personality
Bonus: Experience working in a successful DeFi protocol



Benefits

Join an amazing team of industry veterans focused on revolutionising web3 market making, collaborating with major projects like MakerDAO, Uniswap, Aave, Lido, operating fully remotely with members spanning Zug, Paris, New York, Berlin supported by world-class investors including Uniswap Labs, Robot Ventures, Accel, Longhash, and more.

What we offer:


Competitive salary
SPICE token package
Work remotely or with the Founders in person, in Switzerland
Chance to travel the world to go to exciting events, connecting with key industry players
Join amazing in-person offsites all over the world
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (24 months)
Description:
In order to reinforce our Operations Data team, within our Supply Chain department we are currently recruiting a:

Data Analyst

Your Mission

Within our integrated end-to-end Supply Chain, you will be in charge of developing and maintaining analytics reports to facilitate decision making for the department, and ensure data integrity and quality. This role is committed to leveraging data to optimize the efficiency and effectiveness of main internal processes. It involves tasks like analyzing data to identify trends and inefficiencies, developing data-driven recommendations for improvement, and creating reports and visualizations to communicate insights to stakeholders. Ultimately, your goal will be to use data to streamline operations, reduce costs, and improve customer satisfaction.

HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT ?


Collaborate with Supply Chain teams to gather and analyze data on procurement, inventory management, warehousing, production, and sales.
Utilize data analysis tools and techniques to identify trends, patterns, and root causes of inefficiencies.
Maintain established portfolio of data-driven solutions to optimize Supply Chain processes, such as forecasting models for demand planning and inventory management strategies.
Create clear and concise reports and visualizations to communicate complex data insights to stakeholders across different departments.
Monitor and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success of Supply Chain initiatives.
Stay up-to-date on the latest data analysis trends and technologies.
Partner with other Business Analysts from other departments including IT, Commercial, Finance, and Operations


How Will You Experience Success


Master degree in Engineering, Business Analytics, Data Science, Supply Chain Management, or a related field
Proven previous experience with data analysis tools and techniques, such as Power BI and Python
Previous experience with Google Cloud ecosystem is a plus
Strong understanding of statistical analysis concepts
Microsoft office expert, especially Excel
Experience working in a Supply Chain environment is a plus
Fluent French, advanced English
Analytical & synthetic mindset
Autonomous, results-driven, rigorous and proactive
Comfortable in changing and evolving contexts
Strong communication skills with the ability to work with multiple stakeholders and teams


How Do We Keep You Smiling


You will be part of a dynamic Maison where your skills and talents will be recognized
You will share with us the same values as "enriching communities, care attitude, continuous improvement, efficient accountability"
You will work in a multicultural team and develop international experience
You will navigate with us on our sustainability journey
You will develop and take your career at the next level with potential opportunities within the Maison and the Richemont Group


INTERVIEW PROCESS

1st stage - After your application has been selected, our recruitment team will reach out to you within 2 weeks to conduct an introductury call

2nd stage - Interview with the Line Manager

3rd stage - Interview with the HR Manager / Director

Panerai is an equal opportunities employer ensuring that all applicants are treated equally and fairly throughout our recruitment process. We want to offer an inclusive environment of mutual respect and we are determined that no applicant experiences discrimination based on gender, gender expression, disability, origin, background, religious beliefs or sexual orientation or any other basis protected by law.

Title: Customer Insights Analyst
Description:
Customer Insights & Analytics, Senior Director




The Senior Director of Customer Insights & Analytics will report to the Head of Global Marketing and will spearhead the Customer Insights & Analytics strategy and execution across the clients portfolio.

A primary focus will be on building the Customer Insights & Analytics capability and team in preparation for upcoming product launches.




Build and Lead: Develop a robust Customer Insights & Analytics team. Implement a focused, business-oriented strategy to evolve the team and enhance its impact through strong strategic capabilities.
Thought Leadership: Provide expertise and advanced frameworks for understanding customer engagement and behavior (segmentation, cohort modeling, behavior analysis, message/activity testing, etc.).
Champion Analysis Adoption: Promote the use of analysis and insights in decision-making. Ensure customer insights are accessible across the organization, helping everyone understand and act on customer needs and values.
Commercial Translation: Convert commercial questions from various business units into research and analysis plans to support proposition development, segmentation, customer retention, and customer experience optimization.
Data Analysis: Analyze data, identify trends and gaps, make recommendations, and enhance the customer experience through insights.
Model Development: Create analytical and forecasting models to estimate product portfolio value, aiding the business decision-making process.
Innovative Approaches: Utilize innovative methods, such as big data and AI, to gain deeper consumer/customer insights.
Collaborative Agenda Setting: Work with internal stakeholders to establish the insight and analytics agenda, answering key business questions and co-creating insights that shape strategies and their execution with autonomy and proactivity.
Annual Planning: Lead the development of annual Global Customer Insights & Analytics plans and budgets.
Market Research: Conduct Primary and Secondary Market Research activities, delivering high-quality, clear syntheses to inform product strategy and decision-making.
Process Improvement: Continuously enhance processes to meet stakeholder needs, providing effective, high-quality reports and communications that make insights readily available for decision-making and strategic processes.




Required Experience:

12+ years of market insights and analytics experience, including working in a pharmaceutical or biotech environment.

5 + years experience managing people.

Experience collaborating within a global, cross-functional environment.

Proven record in bridging business priorities with relevant global insights and solutions.

Specific Expertise:

Primary and secondary competitive intelligence
Global & US market analytics & forecasting
Experience supporting new product launches.




Education:

Life Sciences and or Economics/Social Sciences/Business Master's Degree.




Skills:

Pro-active, bringing ideas in a self-driven manner
Ability to blend strategic thinking with genuine interest in tactical execution
Strong business acumen and sense of urgency in sharing critical information with relevant stakeholders
A proactive and results-driven leader focused on bringing strategic solutions to the team
Driven, successful market insights expert with a passion for delivering best practices
Ability to successfully interact with senior management
Flexibility to manage in a fast-changing environment
Strategic thinker with superior problem-solving skills
Proven ability to perform complex international market research, competitive intelligence, analysis and forecasting projects
Solid knowledge and understanding of market insights and analytics methodologies
Excellent written/verbal communication, presentation and project management skills
English: fluent, spoken and written (essential), additional languages are an advantage

Show more

  • Pro-active, bringing ideas in a self-driven manner
  • Ability to blend strategic thinking with genuine interest in tactical execution
  • Strong business acumen and sense of urgency in sharing critical information with relevant stakeholders
  • A proactive and results-driven leader focused on bringing strategic solutions to the team
  • Driven, successful market insights expert with a passion for delivering best practices
  • Ability to successfully interact with senior management
  • Flexibility to manage in a fast-changing environment
  • Strategic thinker with superior problem-solving skills
  • Proven ability to perform complex international market research, competitive intelligence, analysis and forecasting projects
  • Solid knowledge and understanding of market insights and analytics methodologies
  • Excellent written/verbal communication, presentation and project management skills
  • English: fluent, spoken and written (essential), additional languages are an advantage

Title: HR Reporting & Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title:

HR Reporting & Data Analyst

Contract Type:

Time Type:

Full time

Job Description:

The HR Reporting & Data Analyst will be responsible to develop, enhance, implement and maintain reporting capabilities across the different HR systems by using a wide range of reporting tools and techniques. The analyst will provide value adding analysis and commentary derived from key metrics, to highlight what is happening with our people to inform future people strategies.

Reporting to the Reward & HRIS Manager, the jobholder will interact with other system administrators, internal data integrity partners and will closely collaborate with stakeholders across the HR team and the wider business.

We are looking for an enthusiastic and hard-working person to join us as HR Reporting & Data Analyst and help our organization optimize their People Analytics in order to have the best in class analytical solutions. This role is for someone who has a very good knowledge of Workday reporting and a working experience in other analytical tools, ideally in a fast-paced environment, has a passion for data and analysis as well as for innovative technical solutions. This is an opportunity to expand your knowledge across the Workday Suite.

Main Responsilibities


Collaborate to the People Analytics strategy
Work collaboratively with stakeholders across the HR team and the wider business to understand their reporting needs. Suggest best in class analytical practices and provide them potential new insights and trend analysis based on their requirements.
Understand, manipulate, and present numerical data in formats that are easily understood by the stakeholders. Develop and maintain complex HR reports & metrics using data from multiple HR data sources.
Interprete, analyse and monitor trends in data, as directed by the HRIS Manager or by the business.
Own the Data Architecture in Workday and in other HR systems to ensure consistency amongst the different systems.
Responsible for Data Management in Workday and in other HR systems: ensure appropriate configuration documentation, end-users guidelines and trainings are in place for the different stakeholders.
Responsible for Data Audit in Workday and in other HR systems: ensure appropriate monthly controls are in place and coordinate different stakeholders for any corrections to be performed.



HCM Workday Reporting


Develop, enhance, implement and maintain Workday reporting capabilities, using the full suite of Workday Reporting tools (standard & advanced reports, composite reports, dashboards, worksheets and Discovery Boards).
Ensure data governance standards are implemented consistently, granting access to Workday reports in compliance with the existing security matrix and with relevant data protection regulations such as GDPR.
Provide training and support for Workday reporting functionalities, facilitating training sessions for HR professionals and other stakeholders.
Monitor and maintain data accuracy within Workday by building relevant reports and conducting regular audits of key information
Troubleshoote any issues.
Document report/dashboard requirements, their configuration and the relevant end-users guides.
Staying up to date on Workday new releases and changes related to reporting, analysing the changes impact on existing reporting, identifying improvement opportunities and promoting new releases to stakeholders and users.



Reporting


Develop, enhance and maintain HR reports & metrics in different tools (Excel, Power BI, ‚Ä¶) using data from multiple HR data sources.
Ensure data governance standards are respected.
Produce BAU reporting and analytics for the HR professionals and the wider business.
Produce ad hoc regional and global reports and analytics as requested by stakeholders and business need, e.g producing data for local management meetings, board meetings, external surveys, audits, ‚Ä¶
Strong presentation skills in line with firm branding, including presenting information through PowerBI, Excel and PowerPoint.
Ad hoc administrative tasks in relation to data and analytics (maintenance of reports catalogue, data policy and guidance, ‚Ä¶).
Be involved in data modelling for compensation campaigns.
Contribute to HR Projects through discussion of how HR technology can be leveraged to deliver the outcome, gathering requirements for future use.
Performs other duties as required.



If you think the open position you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!

Our people make all the difference in our success.

Title: BI Data Analyst ‚Äì Z√ºrich
Description:
Job Description

Apply now for the position BI Data Analyst ‚Äì Z√ºrich and let‚Äôs achieve great things together! Become part of a successful team and achieve success beyond your previous capabilities. Hungry for more? Properti is the leading and multi-award-winning PropTech broker in Switzerland. We combine highly trained experts with the latest technologies on an intelligent platform to provide customers, brokers and service partners with risk-free, flexible and simplified services. If you can imagine working at Technology in Z√ºrich, apply now for the position.

Tasks


Collecting and analyzing data from various sources to identify trends, patterns, and correlations that will support business growth
Creating and maintaining data models, databases, and central dashboards to support data-driven decision-making
Collaborating with stakeholders and data scientists to establish business goals, metrics, and requirements and then translate these specifics into business analysis solutions
Conducting data quality checks while ensuring data integrity and accuracy across all spectrums before implementing findings
Developing reports, visualizations, and presentations to communicate strategic findings and presenting these insights as recommendations to key stakeholders to aid business decisions
Identifying opportunities for process improvements and optimization based on data insights


Job requirements


A Bachelor‚Äôs degree (or Master‚Äôs degree) in a field such as data analytics, statistics, business administration, mathematics, computer science, data science or a related discipline is preferred
A minimum of 3-5 years of experience in data analysis, information technology, or a related field of data management
Strong technical skills in data collection, data mining, and statistical modeling techniques
Work experience with programming languages and tools such as SQL, Python, R and simple analytics tools such as Excel
Experience using data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or QlikView to create compelling visualizations and reports
Understanding of database concepts such as database structures, query languages, and data warehousing principles
Experience handling business intelligence tools such as Microsoft Power BI, Oracle Business Intelligence, IBM Cognos to extract and analyze data
Experience with information systems in the context of machine learning, big data, or AI is a strong advantage
Commitment to continuous learning and willingness to stay updated on emerging industry trends, business processes, technologies, and methodologies in the data field
Strong analytical skills: You are able to break down complex problems in a data analyst role, analyze data effectively, and derive meaningful insights are all keys to success in this role
Attention to detail: You must be meticulous and thorough throughout the data analysis process, ensuring accuracy in reporting and recommendations
Critical thinking: You use strategic thinking to evaluate information objectively and assess alternative solutions to make informed decisions
Effective communication skills: Your ability to convey complex technical terms to non-technical team members is an essential part of the role, communicating findings in a clear and concise manner
Collaboration and teamwork: You‚Äôre a team player, always willing to work with cross-functional and global teams, share knowledge, and contribute to collective goals
Problem-solving skills: You can identify and define problems, analyze root causes, and develop innovative solutions based on strategic insights
Project management: You are able to coordinate complex projects beyond the scope of business analytics, ensuring timely roll-out and consistently meeting goals and expectations


Job advantages


Promotion: above-average career opportunities & talent promotion
Doer mentality: young and innovative company, embedded in an agile, flat entrepreneurial culture
Properti Academy: access to our internal academy in the field of real estate
Properti Coaching: internal professional contact point with own psychologist
Modern working environment: flexible working hours with the possibility of home office
Food & Drinks: fresh fruits & snacks, coffee & tea, drinks & after work beer
Birthday Retreat: half day free of charge
Loyalty: 5 weeks vacation, plus unlimited (unpaid) vacations
Teambuilding: Rocket Friday, summer & winter event, incentive trips

Title: Energy Data Portfolio Analyst
Description:
Profil du candidat


You hold a master‚Äôs degree in engineering / finance or an equivalent.
You have 2-3 years‚Äô experience in the Gas and Power markets with a high data analysis component.
Strong operational and modelling skills with the ability to implement those using commonly used tools ‚Äì Alteryx, Python and PBI.
Strong analytical capabilities, especially in energy markets and in a broader economical field.
A team player who works well with internal team(s), partners and external stakeholders.
Forward-looking individual with the ability to work autonomously while being well organised.
Fluent in English and secondary language is essential ‚Äì French, Spanish and Italian.



At TotalEnergies, we believe that our employees‚Äô fulfilment has its roots in the wealth of the experiences they are offered. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to respecting diversity and inclusion in the workplace.

Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard for race, color, gender, religion, national origin, disability, military status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender. Candidates with disabilities are encouraged to apply. We will provide necessary accommodations upon request.

Activit√©s

Job Dimension:

Energy Data Management team consists of 8 FTE based in Geneva and is managing all detailed data supplied by 45 market system operators and providers, within 10 markets on power and gas, in a centralised database portal to calculate imbalances and costs associated with physical trades on behalf of the 40 market access affiliated contracts of TotalEnergies.

The Energy Data Portfolio Analyst with the Deputy Head of Energy Data Management on the team is responsible for the reconciliation, P&L explanation and invoice-able amount of nearly 1.8 billion Euros from these group affiliated contracts a year with growth expected. The team supports the development of the business across further markets and less-carbonised commodities by developing an Energy Data Hub.

The team is the direct liaison to the market system operators to on-board assets onto TotalEnergies balancing perimeters, is responsible for continuous data collection from different sources, data comparison, check, cleaning, and enables a seamless and flexible single access to accurate and robust data in which it is then shared with our internal and external stakeholders. The Energy Data Management team is accountable for collaborating with relevant departments on ensuring accuracy of data while implementing into the trading system and reviewing robustness of all internal systems as it relates to this data.

What you will do:

The Energy Data Portfolio Analyst as part of the Trading Support department is responsible to ensure reconciliations with group affiliates.

Energy Data Portfolio Analyst will work with Trading Systems team to ensure systems can manage contracts that fits the needs of all departments such as Front Office, Middle Office, Back Office and Finance departments. Contracts can include but not limited to Power Purchase Agreements, Procurement of Gas and Power for industrial sites of the affiliates, Energy Mechanisms, and Gas Sales Agreements

Thus, your main tasks will be the following:


Ensuring allocation data is received in a timely manner and communicating to TSO/DSO on allocation issues while verifying data accuracy daily and proper reflection in trading system.
Reconciling group affiliated contracts and booking of actualization of contract into trading system ahead of settlements.
Report and explain any P&L impact to Middle Office.
Produce key performance measures around imbalances of assets and TGP short-term activities that will be used for back testing of commercial contracts pricing.
Producing reports for internal and external stakeholders for purposes such as regulatory reporting, customs and contract reviews.
Updating procedures to ensure clarity and feasibility of process reference.
Communicating to Trading Systems team new requirements to book contracts into system.
Assisting Back Office with contract changes or revisions that can generate accruals.



Contexte et environnement

Fast-paced trading environment requires the jobholder to be able to work both autonomously and a team to produce quick results. Global trading environment involves communication to be sent and received in several languages.

The role operates within a changing energy market mainly due to environmental and regulatory impacts and requirements.

In house systems requires deep collaboration with other departments and IT teams to implement.

Our Culture:

We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population and we are committed to the energy transition. The volatility of the energy trading markets requires excellence in risk management and a culture of innovation. We are fully embracing the digital revolution.

Our people flourish in an environment that promotes expertise, entrepreneurship spirit, agility and a purpose-driven culture, generating boundless opportunities to learn, grow and achieve collaborative success.

Reinforcing the competencies of our people is a key pillar of our culture: we train our people to ensure their development and we pledge to encourage safety in all our actions.

We look for passion, ambition and open-mindedness. While we evolve in a demanding industry that requests to be always on the edge, we cultivate a friendly workplace where our people feel good, where team spirit and respect guide our daily routine, where the diversity of our people and their skills create a nourishing experience for all of us.

Title: Databricks, Power BI Consultant
Description:
To join our team dedicated to our Reinsurance, Insurance and Banking customers, we are looking for a Databricks, Power BI Consultant (F/M).




Your Responsibilities:

Analyze and interpret complex data to provide actionable insights.
Develop and implement advanced data models and algorithms to solve business problems.
Utilize Databricks for data processing, machine learning, and advanced analytics.
Create and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using Power BI to visualize key metrics and trends.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business needs and develop data-driven solutions.
Communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in data science.

Your Profile:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
Proven experience in the Reinsurance, Insurance and Banking.
Strong expertise in Databricks, including data processing, machine learning, and advanced analytics.
Proficient in Power BI for creating interactive dashboards and reports.
Strong programming skills in Python, R, or similar languages.
Experience with big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, or similar.
Knowledge of statistical modeling and machine learning techniques.
Familiarity with cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.
Certification in Databricks, Power BI is a plus.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
VF Corporation is looking for an exceptional Business Intelligence Analyst to join our BI EMEA team based in Stabio, Switzerland.




Let‚Äôs talk about the role!

As a BI Analyst, you have been already exposed to the BI subject matter, either at the University or in a first work experience. You will participate in the design and deployment of key strategic BI Solutions. You will support your Lead Manager in daily activities to ensure product adoption and contribute to the verification and continuous improvement of reporting data quality. Direct exposure to the end-user community is crucial in this role, as is an advanced ability to conceptualize and test solutions from source system to BI solutions.




Job Details




We expect you to deliver unbeatable results while fulfilling the following aspects of the BI Analyst role:

Gather and understand Business Requirements
Transform Business Requirements into Logical Data Models and high-level Technical Requirements
Communicate the gathered information with the technical team
Implement reports as a Superuser
Manage incidents and provide support to the Business Community in addressing their data/tools challenges




Skills For Success

To succeed as a BI Analyst, you must translate our business objectives into a coherent BI design, follow up with the implementation team, double-check the final deliverables, and follow-up their adoption in the Business Community. Strong empathy and influencing skills will help you get both the business and the technical team on board. We are looking for someone with a service-oriented approach who has:




An attitude of teamwork, aiding colleagues in resolving issues, and hastening your own learning curve about the technical landscape and business processes
A general understanding of Business Intelligence/Data Warehouse applications
Understanding of Data Modeling principles
Hands-on experience in data investigations
Experience with Visual Insight platforms (Microsoft Power BI, Tableau, IBM Cognos preferred)
Experience with relational data access (SAP HANA, SQL Server, Redshift‚Ä¶)
Exposure to Fashion/Retail industries in prior experiences is considered a plus
Knowledge of the main SAP GUI, back-end tables, and their interactions is considered a plus




Other key skills for success:




Teamwork attitude, good interaction, and communication skills
Ability to handle Change Management
Focus on the end-user community
Problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Analytical mindset
Ability to escalate to the appropriate level of support
Efficiency and effectiveness in dealing with end-users
Fluency in spoken and written English




VF is a global apparel company connecting people to the lifestyles they cherish through our family of iconic brands. At the heart of our journey lies our purpose: We power movements of sustainable and active lifestyles for the betterment of people and our planet. This is our purpose. It‚Äôs the reason we come to work every day. Our purpose unites us and leads us to pursue our goals, together. This is our calling. Learn more at vfc.com




What‚Äôs In It For You

We‚Äôre in the business of unleashing human potential, driven by the ideas, energy and commitment of our people. That‚Äôs why we offer comprehensive benefits that encourage mental, physical and financial well-being for all VF associates. When it comes to benefits, we‚Äôre the total package.




A supportive feedback-based culture where respect and integrity guide us in what we do
An inclusive international environment where people of diverse backgrounds, lifestyles and nationalities love working together
Be part of an iconic lifestyle brand in a multi brand, multi countries organization
On site gym offering health and well-being initiatives
A discount card with 50% on all VF brands
Break out areas offering complimentary hot drinks




This post is not eligible for relocation support.




Free to Be, Inclusion & Diversity

As a purpose-led, performance driven company, we strive to foster a culture of belonging based on respect, connection, openness and authenticity. We are committed to building and maintaining a workplace that celebrates the diversity of our associates, allowing them to bring their authentic selves to work every day.




As an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer, VF is committed to support disadvantaged groups whilst providing equal opportunities for both VF associates and applicants alike.




If you like what you have read and want to join our team then we would like to hear from you!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Position Summary:

We are looking for candidates with hands on experience in Big Data & Cloud Technologies.




Must have technical Skills

3-6 Years of experience
Expertise and hands-on experience on Python ‚Äì Must Have
Expertise knowledge on SparkQL/Spark Dataframe ‚Äì Must Have
Good knowledge of AWS and AWS Glue ‚Äì Must Have
Good knowledge of SQL ‚Äì Good to Have
Good knowledge of Shell script ‚Äì Good to Have
Good Knowledge of one of the Workflow engine like Oozie, Autosys ‚Äì Good to Have
Good knowledge of Agile Development‚Äì Good to Have
Passionate about exploring new technologies ‚Äì Good to Have
Automation approach - ‚Äì Good to Have




Responsibilities

Selected candidate will work on Data Warehouse modernization projects and will responsible for the following activities.
Develop programs/scripts in Python/Java + SparkSQL/Spark Dataframe or Python/Java + Cloud native SQL like RedshiftSQL/SnowSQL etc.
Validation of scripts
Performance tuning
Data ingestion from source to target platform
Job orchestration




About Impetus

Impetus Technologies is a digital engineering company.

We deliver expert services and products in cloud data engineering and analytics space to help large enterprises in their digital transformation journey /goals. Enabling an intelligent, data-driven future for our customers.

We solve Analytics, AI (Artificial Intelligence), and Cloud puzzle for fortune 500 companies to help drive innovation and growth for them.

Headquartered in Los Gatos, California, with offshore development centers. We also have office in Canada.

Year on Year we have grown more than 40% and have been we have been recognized as one of the best companies to work for.




Why Impetus?




Work on solving real-life business problems using next-generation technologies. The quality and content of the job you do here is exceptional and helps you learn and grow fast

Learn while you Grow - You continuously learn and upgrade your skills. Get hands on learning through our unique training and development program.

We are on a mission to enable 100% of our Engineers on cloud

We are growing exponentially and looking for more than 100% growth in 2024

We are a people first company, and our work culture is the primary reason ‚Ä¶why more than 25 % of our employees have been with us for more than ten years.

If you are looking for Career growth and stability, this is the place for you.

You will have the opportunity to work with the smartest brains who have been thought leaders/authors contributing to the tech world.

Title: Internship Global Master Data Analyst
Description:
Switzerland, Visp

Today, Lonza is a global leader in life sciences operating across three continents. While we work in science, there‚Äôs no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that‚Äôs the kind of work we want to be part of.

Key Responsibilities

The Master Data department in Visp is a global team responsible for the development of master data processes and standards that are to be followed by the whole organization. As a trainee, you will be responsible to:


Perform various data analyses and reports to support Master data or Business projects
Support with SAP Master data mass maintenance and migration projects
Gather feedbacks from global and local Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) within the organization
Define functional and technical requirements for the development/enhancement of new Master Data processes
Improve and enhance our training documentation as well as providing direct trainings to various teams within Lonza


As a member of the Global Master Data team, you will be able to learn SAP Materials Management (MM), Production & Planning (PP) and Sales & Distribution (SD) modules, key business processes as well as SAP data structures. Overall, you will interact with many different departments and experts across the company worldwide.

Key Requirements


You have a Bachelor or Master degree in data or computer science, business information technology, or mathematics.
You have an understanding of data structures or experience with databases.
You are fluent in English. German and any additional language will be an appreciated asset.
You are interested in continuous improvements of processes, IT tools and innovative solutions.
You are interested in being a reliable team member in a multi-cultural environment.


Every day, Lonza‚Äôs products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.

People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our client is a Non profit organisation based in Geneva. To strengthen their team, they are looking for a Data Analyst.

This detailed list outlines the responsibilities for a role leading the Office of Inspector General's (OIG) case intake activities within the Analytic and Transformation team of the Professional Services Unit.


Lead the screening and assessment of allegations, determining their credibility, verifiability, and materiality.
Propose appropriate OIG responses based on the assessment.
Obtain, assess, and utilize intelligence from various confidential sources, including case intake, oversight investigations, financial information, and external stakeholder data.
Prepare assessment outcomes for whistleblowers and referral memos for the Secretariat and external agencies.
Engage with whistleblowers to gather information supporting assessment conclusions.
Ensure consistent and timely delivery of work by Case Intake Analysts, in line with SOPs.
Report cases with significant risks to the Analytics & Transformation Manager.
Use case intake outcomes to create presentations highlighting key fraud risk trends, providing qualitative and quantitative insights.
Present these analytics to OIG Management and the Secretariat.
Monitor regulatory developments and industry trends to enhance the OIG‚Äôs counter-fraud program.
Contribute to the development of OIG‚Äôs counter-fraud strategy and workplan using intelligence from case intake activities.
Represent the OIG in panels, meetings, and with external stakeholders on intelligence and investigation case management matters.
Prepare and lead case intake and assessment training sessions for various divisions and units.
Coordinate strategic analysis initiatives, such as investigations and intelligence data analytics, with the Manager of Analytics and Transformation.
Provide support for special projects, acting as a focal point for Case Intake in system redesign efforts.
Conduct effective onboarding and ongoing capacity building for team members.
Validate and control the screening assessment outcomes of Case Intake Analysts before submission to senior management.
Act as a role model, promoting collaborative relationships within the organization.


Profile:


A university degree in a related field, or a first-level university degree with relevant academic qualifications and experience in a related area, or
Significant relevant experience at a national or international level in lieu of the above academic qualifications.
Professional qualifications and/or training related to investigations and/or intelligence.
Understanding of the Global Fund‚Äôs business model and OIG‚Äôs activities.
Strong experience as a criminal intelligence analyst and/or investigations analyst, working on complex criminal and/or administrative investigations in fraud and abuse, or other large-scale and complex investigations.
Proficiency in using intelligence tools and methods for analytical tasks, including analysis and investigation databases, free text retrieval applications, and analytical products.
Proven ability to create and maintain effective liaison between key internal and external stakeholders.
Experience in providing high-quality written and verbal summary-level analyses and a range of intelligence products.
Over 5 years of experience as a criminal intelligence analyst and/or investigations analyst in the area of fraud and abuse, or other large-scale and complex investigations.
Experience working with multiple sectors, such as international organizations, governments, civil society, and the private sector.

  • Coordinate strategic analysis initiatives, such as investigations and intelligence data analytics, with the Manager of Analytics and Transformation.
  • Provide support for special projects, acting as a focal point for Case Intake in system redesign efforts.
  • Conduct effective onboarding and ongoing capacity building for team members.
  • Validate and control the screening assessment outcomes of Case Intake Analysts before submission to senior management.
  • Act as a role model, promoting collaborative relationships within the organization.

Profile:

  • A university degree in a related field, or a first-level university degree with relevant academic qualifications and experience in a related area, or
  • Significant relevant experience at a national or international level in lieu of the above academic qualifications.
  • Professional qualifications and/or training related to investigations and/or intelligence.
  • Understanding of the Global Fund‚Äôs business model and OIG‚Äôs activities.
  • Strong experience as a criminal intelligence analyst and/or investigations analyst, working on complex criminal and/or administrative investigations in fraud and abuse, or other large-scale and complex investigations.
  • Proficiency in using intelligence tools and methods for analytical tasks, including analysis and investigation databases, free text retrieval applications, and analytical products.
  • Proven ability to create and maintain effective liaison between key internal and external stakeholders.
  • Experience in providing high-quality written and verbal summary-level analyses and a range of intelligence products.
  • Over 5 years of experience as a criminal intelligence analyst and/or investigations analyst in the area of fraud and abuse, or other large-scale and complex investigations.
  • Experience working with multiple sectors, such as international organizations, governments, civil society, and the private sector.
