Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Position Summary:

We are looking for candidates with hands on experience in Big Data or Cloud Technologies.




Must have technical Skills:

8+ Years of experience

Expertise and hands-on experience on Spark Data Frame, and Hadoop echo system components.

Good knowledge and hands-on experience of AWS and AWS Glue.

Good knowledge of HiveQL & SparkQL.

Good knowledge of Shell script & Java/scala/python.

Good knowledge of SQL.

Good knowledge of migration projects on Hadoop.

Good Knowledge of one of the Workflow engine like Oozie, Autosys.

Good knowledge of Agile Development.

Passionate about exploring new technologies.

Automation approach.




*Data Ingestion, Processing and Orchestration knowledge




About Impetus

Impetus Technologies is a digital engineering company.

We deliver expert services and products in cloud data engineering and analytics space to help large enterprises in their digital transformation journey /goals. Enabling an intelligent, data-driven future for our customers.

We solve Analytics, AI (Artificial Intelligence), and Cloud puzzle for fortune 500 companies to help drive innovation and growth for them.

Headquartered in Los Gatos, California, with offshore development centers. We also have office in Canada.

Year on Year we have grown more than 40% and have been we have been recognized as one of the best companies to work for.




Why Impetus?




Work on solving real-life business problems using next-generation technologies. The quality and content of the job you do here is exceptional and helps you learn and grow fast

Learn while you Grow - You continuously learn and upgrade your skills. Get hands on learning through our unique training and development program.

We are on a mission to enable 100% of our Engineers on cloud

We are growing exponentially and looking for more than 100% growth in 2024

We are a people first company, and our work culture is the primary reason ‚Ä¶why more than 25 % of our employees have been with us for more than ten years.

If you are looking for Career growth and stability, this is the place for you.

You will have the opportunity to work with the smartest brains who have been thought leaders/authors contributing to the tech world.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork ‚Äì the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.

VF Corporation is looking for an exceptional Business Intelligence Analyst to join our BI EMEA team based in Stabio, Switzerland.

Let's talk about the role!

As a BI Analyst, you have been already exposed to the BI subject matter, either at the University or in a first work experience. You will participate in the design and deployment of key strategic BI Solutions. You will support your Lead Manager in daily activities to ensure product adoption and contribute to the verification and continuous improvement of reporting data quality. Direct exposure to the end-user community is crucial in this role, as is an advanced ability to conceptualize and test solutions from source system to BI solutions.

Job Details

We expect you to deliver unbeatable results while fulfilling the following aspects of the BI Analyst role:


Gather and understand Business Requirements
Transform Business Requirements into Logical Data Models and high-level Technical Requirements
Communicate the gathered information with the technical team
Implement reports as a Superuser
Manage incidents and provide support to the Business Community in addressing their data/tools challenges


Skills For Success

To succeed as a BI Analyst, you must translate our business objectives into a coherent BI design, follow up with the implementation team, double-check the final deliverables, and follow-up their adoption in the Business Community. Strong empathy and influencing skills will help you get both the business and the technical team on board. We are looking for someone with a service-oriented approach who has:


An attitude of teamwork, aiding colleagues in resolving issues, and hastening your own learning curve about the technical landscape and business processes
A general understanding of Business Intelligence/Data Warehouse applications
Understanding of Data Modeling principles
Hands-on experience in data investigations
Experience with Visual Insight platforms (Microsoft Power BI, Tableau, IBM Cognos preferred)
Experience with relational data access (SAP HANA, SQL Server, Redshift‚Ä¶)
Exposure to Fashion/Retail industries in prior experiences is considered a plus
Knowledge of the main SAP GUI, back-end tables, and their interactions is considered a plus


Other Key Skills For Success


Teamwork attitude, good interaction, and communication skills
Ability to handle Change Management
Focus on the end-user community
Problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Analytical mindset
Ability to escalate to the appropriate level of support
Efficiency and effectiveness in dealing with end-users
Fluency in spoken and written English


VF is a global apparel company connecting people to the lifestyles they cherish through our family of iconic brands. At the heart of our journey lies our purpose: We power movements of sustainable and active lifestyles for the betterment of people and our planet. This is our purpose. It's the reason we come to work every day. Our purpose unites us and leads us to pursue our goals, together. This is our calling. Learn more at vfc.com

What's In It For You

We're in the business of unleashing human potential, driven by the ideas, energy and commitment of our people. That's why we offer comprehensive benefits that encourage mental, physical and financial well-being for all VF associates. When it comes to benefits, we're the total package.


A supportive feedback-based culture where respect and integrity guide us in what we do
An inclusive international environment where people of diverse backgrounds, lifestyles and nationalities love working together
Be part of an iconic lifestyle brand in a multi brand, multi countries organization
On site gym offering health and well-being initiatives
A discount card with 50% on all VF brands
Break out areas offering complimentary hot drinks


This post is not eligible for relocation support.

Free to Be, Inclusion & Diversity

As a purpose-led, performance driven company, we strive to foster a culture of belonging based on respect, connection, openness and authenticity. We are committed to building and maintaining a workplace that celebrates the diversity of our associates, allowing them to bring their authentic selves to work every day.

As an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer, VF is committed to support disadvantaged groups whilst providing equal opportunities for both VF associates and applicants alike.

If you like what you have read and want to join our team then we would like to hear from you!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
For our client, a leading company in the Pharma industry, we are currently looking for a Data Engineer experienced in data integration using warehouses, data lakes and database modeling.




General Information:




Start Date: 15.08.2024 (latest start date: 01.11.2024)

End Date: 6 months - extension possible

Workplace: Basel (Remote/Home Office: partially remote, partially in Basel)

Workload: 100%




Tasks and Responsibilities:




Developing a robust light-weight framework for creating data products based on an existing prototype that extracts data from multiple sources and creates data visualizations as the output
Creating automated extraction and loading processes from key databases
Creating easy-to-maintain transformations using DBT
Enabling a data storage solution and consumption by users via API or GUI
Developing, maintaining and documenting a solid codebase that we can turn into a self-service framework




Your Profile:




Min. vocational training
3-6 years of experience in data and workflow engineering skills (ETL/ELT principles)
Experience with data integration using warehouses, data lakes and database modeling (Snowflake, Postgres etc.)
Experience with Python for data extraction scripts
Experience with SQL for data extraction from internal databases
Experience with PostgreSQL for persistence of final product data, AWS S3 as a staging layer, Gitlab for CI, task and code tracking
A passion for working in an environment with high urgency, and you love to spend most of your time writing code
Enjoying operational side of things, like managing cloud-based infrastructure, workflow orchestration (e.g. GitLab CI/CD) and containerization (e.g., Docker)
Interest in understanding biomedical or preclinical research data or have previously worked in a Pharma domain
Excellent communication skills in English




Nice to have:

DTB for data transformations

Title: Data Analyst / Scientist
Description:
We are seeking a highly motivated Data Analyst/Scientist to join our IoT Lab team, responsible for developing BOBST Connect, our all-in-one digital platform that enhances and improves packaging productivity. BOBST Connect brings data and digital services together in one fully connected cloud platform, with BOBST machine insights and expertise built-in, enabling overview and orchestration of the production process. You will be an integral part of the agile organization responsible for developing this innovative product, constantly evolving to serve our customers.

In this role, you will collaborate closely with our business stakeholders, IoT product management team, development teams, and other Data Scientists to define new products, services, and tools using data and machine learning. As a member of the team, you will work on the development of data models, algorithms, and statistical analyses to extract meaningful insights from large and complex data sets. You will also be responsible for supporting the teams with data operational tasks.

Please note this is a hands-on role, involving a lot of data crunching: if you are looking for a management or supervisory position, this is not for you, as we strive to keep a flat hierarchy with very productive and operational teams.

Main Responsibilities


Design, develop, and deploy data-driven solutions to answer a variety of business problems (predictive maintenance, equipment lifecycle analysis, etc.)
Understand the requirements of product owners and provide insights and recommendations based on data analysis.
Work on the development of data models, algorithms, and statistical analyses to extract meaningful insights from complex data sets.
Design and implement data pipelines and data warehouses to support data analysis and reporting needs.
Develop and maintain dashboards and visualizations to communicate insights and findings to stakeholders.
Mentor and coach developers on best practices in data analysis, modelling, and visualization.
Keep up to date with the latest advancements in data science, machine learning and artificial intelligence technologies, and apply them to solve business problems.


Your Education And Languages Capabilities


Bachelor in Computer Science or Data Science (Master or PHD a plus)
Full professional proficiency in English. French an asset.


Your technical Knowledge


Advanced proficiency in programming languages (ideally Python), and experience with data manipulation and analysis libraries such as Pandas and NumPy.
Knowledge of machine learning algorithms and techniques such as regression, classification, and deep learning.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau/Power BI, or standard libraries (D3/Plotly/...).
Strong communication skills and ability to communicate complex findings to non-technical stakeholders.


Preferred Qualifications


At least 3 years in a similar role
Experience with big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, or Hive (experience with Databricks is a big plus).
Experience with cloud technologies (ideally Microsoft Azure).
Experience with Agile/Scrum disciplines based on Azure DevOps


Your personal attributes


A true believer in the value of data, with the ability to take ownership and deliver autonomously and proactively tangible results to the organization.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, to effectively interact with technical and non-technical stakeholders, including very senior managers.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills to identify patterns and insights in large data sets.
Strong attention to detail and ability to ensure data accuracy and completeness, while keeping solutions as simple and robust as possible.
Strong collaboration skills and ability to work in an agile environment, including the ability to manage priorities and give regular reporting on ongoing tasks.
Continuous learning mindset, keeping up to date with the latest advancements in data science and machine learning.
Ability to think creatively to develop innovative solutions to complex business problems.


For more than 130 years, and over 50 countries, BOBST has always been at the forefront of innovation and we want to accelerate connectivity, digitalization, automation and sustainability to make packaging better than ever.

BOBST is one of the world‚Äôs leading suppliers of equipment and services to packaging and label manufacturers in the folding carton, corrugated board and flexible materials industries. Join our highly qualified staff and together, let‚Äôs shape the future of the packaging world.

The production site of Mex, near Lausanne in Switzerland, is also the headquarters of the Bobst Group. It is the most important site, employing approx. 1500 passionate people.

It also trains each year roughly 200 apprentices. The site offers an idyllic work environment. In the countryside and close to major highways, it is also well served by public transport. It offers many amenities, such as a corporate restaurant, sports fields, a fitness and a nursery. The facilities have been recently renovated and represent a model for sustainable development.

Title: Data management analyst
Description:
Job Reference #
298554BR

Job Type
Full Time

Your role
Are you interested in Records Management and electronic Archiving? Would you like to apply and further develop your records management and analytical skills in a multinational company? Are you thrilled by getting to know different processes of the bank and the people behind them? Are you attracted by defining legal and regulatory requirements to ensure the bank implements compliant solutions?

We‚Äôre looking for someone like that to:


advise and support to business divisions and Group Functions regarding their electronic archiving needs in accordance with legal and regulatory and internal requirements
support group-wide projects as records management subject matter expert
conduct requirement and gap analysis to identify risks of non-compliance to policy and related records management risk controls and related reporting
provide Records Management subject matter expertise to assess impact of changing requirements to our processes and archives


Your team
You‚Äôll be working as an analyst in our records management team, in an international environment with a global scope, supporting and providing additional capacity to the current Archiving and Records Management Crew based in Z√ºrich.

Our Records Management Crew is part of the Chief Data and Information Office (CDIO) function supporting the oversight and implementation of the records management policy. As a records management analyst you'll be helping our stakeholders review their archiving requirements and support the implementation and governance of records management compliance across the bank.

Your expertise


a university degree or business degree
experience in a similar role of information governance (records management, document management, information management)
experience in the international banking environment and knowledge about banking processes and products
a solid Records Management/(Electronic) Archiving knowledge/understanding and/or the respective training
experience in business analysis, project management and affinity to information technology
additional technical background would be preferred
knowledge of UNIX, Oracle and SQL/PL SQL technologies or advanced Excel skills would be beneficial.
a self-starter who can work well with minimal supervision (you can micromanage yourself)
Technically minded with strong conceptual and analytical problem solving skills
team-orientated but also independently minded
a great communicator, with the ability to communicate appropriately at all levels in the organization and good at enabling effective interaction with key stakeholders
organized and detail oriented
able to prioritize multiple tasks within multiple concurrent activities
client and result oriented

UBS is the world‚Äôs largest and the only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors..

Job Reference #
298554BR

Job Type
Full Time

Your role
Are you interested in Records Management and electronic Archiving? Would you like to apply and further develop your records management and analytical skills in a multinational company? Are you thrilled by getting to know different processes of the bank and the people behind them? Are you attracted by defining legal and regulatory requirements to ensure the bank implements compliant solutions?

We‚Äôre looking for someone like that to:

  • advise and support to business divisions and Group Functions regarding their electronic archiving needs in accordance with legal and regulatory and internal requirements
  • support group-wide projects as records management subject matter expert
  • conduct requirement and gap analysis to identify risks of non-compliance to policy and related records management risk controls and related reporting
  • provide Records Management subject matter expertise to assess impact of changing requirements to our processes and archives

Your team
You‚Äôll be working as an analyst in our records management team, in an international environment with a global scope, supporting and providing additional capacity to the current Archiving and Records Management Crew based in Z√ºrich.

Our Records Management Crew is part of the Chief Data and Information Office (CDIO) function supporting the oversight and implementation of the records management policy. As a records management analyst you'll be helping our stakeholders review their archiving requirements and support the implementation and governance of records management compliance across the bank.

Your expertise

  • a university degree or business degree
  • experience in a similar role of information governance (records management, document management, information management)
  • experience in the international banking environment and knowledge about banking processes and products
  • a solid Records Management/(Electronic) Archiving knowledge/understanding and/or the respective training
  • experience in business analysis, project management and affinity to information technology
  • additional technical background would be preferred
  • knowledge of UNIX, Oracle and SQL/PL SQL technologies or advanced Excel skills would be beneficial.
  • a self-starter who can work well with minimal supervision (you can micromanage yourself)
  • Technically minded with strong conceptual and analytical problem solving skills
  • team-orientated but also independently minded
  • a great communicator, with the ability to communicate appropriately at all levels in the organization and good at enabling effective interaction with key stakeholders
  • organized and detail oriented
  • able to prioritize multiple tasks within multiple concurrent activities
  • client and result oriented
  • very good written and spoken English, other languages are a plus

Title: Payments Data Analyst
Description:
lastminute.com is the European Travel Tech leader in Dynamic Holiday Packages. It operates a portfolio of well-known brands such as lastminute.com, Volagratis, Rumbo, weg.de, Bravofly, Jetcost and Hotelscan.

Our mission is to lead the travel industry by leveraging technology to simplify, personalise, and enhance our customers‚Äô travel experience. Experts in brightening up online travel, we help our customers find and do "whatever makes them pink".

We continuously invest in talented people who ensure our offering is closer to the needs of the customers and keep us at the cutting edge of technology evolution. More than 1,700 employees spread across our offices worldwide develop our own products and services to power the entire traveller journey for millions of people".

At the heart of our culture is a commitment to inclusion across race, gender, age, sexual orientation, religion, gender identity or expression and accessibility. We strongly believe in an equal opportunity space, which is welcoming and celebrates the uniqueness of everyone who works here. We value different lived experiences and respect viewpoints, as we know unicity drives innovation. We want to make sure our people reflect the communities across the world we help travel.

lastminute.com N.V. is a publicly-traded company listed under the ticker symbol LMN on the SIX Swiss Exchange.



Job Description



lastminute.com is looking for an ambitious and highly motivated Payments Data Analyst for its Data & Analytics department.

The candidate will have the opportunity to become a key member of one of the Data & Analytics teams, leveraging his/her analytical skills to produce actionable insights with the aim to improve payments performance.

The primary emphasis will be on enhancing payment conversion, leveraging the various different payment methods that we could offer in any market globally. He/she will analyze the funnel steps relevant for payments and other business metrics, closely working with the Payments Business Platform team. This entails datamining, designing and analyzing A/B tests, providing suggestions how to optimize existing and new payment methods including our by now pay later fintech product, assessing performance, and strategizing for new user experiences.

Key Responsibilities

Collect and analyze data related to how customers are interacting with available payment methods (user‚Äôs behavior, transactions data and financial trends)..
Contribution on develop and maintain reports and dashboards to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) related to payments processing.
Identify patterns, trends, and anomalies in payment data to enable better business decisions and improve operational efficiency.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Product, Engineering, Finance teams to understand the business and provide data-driven insights.
Conduct ad-hoc analysis to support strategic initiatives and decisions (what-if analysis, delta analysis, forecasts, etc) in the payments and fraud prevention domain.
Implement data visualization techniques to communicate findings and recommendations effectively to stakeholders.
Stay current with industry trends and best practices in payments processing and data analysis.


Qualifications



Qualifications

Essential

Strong analytical skills/mindset
At least 2 years of experience in a similar role in a fast-paced environment
Strong SQL skills for querying and exploring data sets
Strong knowledge of Excel/Google Sheets
Fluent in English both written and verbal
Ability to influence decision makers through presentations of analysis
Good knowledge of statistical analysis techniques and how to apply them using analytical Tool (eg. Spotfire,Tableau,Qlink or similar)
Good experience in storytelling, visualizing data, using data visualization tools
Experience in business partnering/stakeholder management

Desirable

Knowledge of TIBCO Spotfire
Knowledge of data modeling and best practices related to analytical databases
Previous experience in the travel industry
Familiarity with digital and e-commerce business

Abilities/qualities

Problem-solving, decision-making skills, and innovative thinking
High attention to detail and ability to effectively manage multiple projects, meeting deadlines successfully
Proactivity and strategic approach
Strong team player with excellent communication skills, willing to challenge existing processes and applications


Additional Information



What we offer

By joining our company, you will have the chance to:

Join a dynamic team in an inclusive-international environment
Grow thanks to the career journey and our internal mobility perspective
Manage your own schedule thanks to the flexible start and end of the working day
Work a shorter working week (36h), of which 4 hours on Friday morning
Get focus time for learning, development and deep work on Friday mornings
Work partially or fully remote according to local laws
Enjoy continuous training thanks to our company platform
Benefit from employee discounts on travel
Receive 2 days off per year for the purpose of volunteering
Receive a voucher after some years in the company
Get free snacks / fruit / hot drinks / water / beverages at our offices
Participate in amazing winter and summer corporate events
Benefit from extended parental or marriage leave according to local laws
Welfare platform (Corporate Benefits) where you will find dedicated discounts with more than 1500 partners.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst:in Operations
Description:
Arbeitsort: Region Z√ºrich & Remote Work, Teilzeit ab 80% m√∂glich

Hast du Spass die Business Reporting- und Analyseprozesse im Bereich Service Operations weiterzuentwickeln, die Datenumgebung aufzubauen und zu bewirtschaften, und damit die Grundlage f√ºr die kontinuierliche Verbesserung unserer Gesch√§ftsprozesse sicherzustellen?

Dann haben wir die passende Stelle f√ºr dich. Als Data Analyst:in Operations √ºbernimmst du Verantwortung im Themengebiet Analytics und Reporting. Das Sicherstellen von zeitgerechten und qualitativ hochwertigen F√ºhrungsinformationen geh√∂rt ebenso zu deinem Aufgabengebiet wie das Weiterentwickeln der Reporting Plattform. Es bereitet dir Freude, mit verschiedenen internen und externen Schnittstellen zusammenzuarbeiten, dein berufliches Netzwerk zu nutzen, und dich kontinuierlich in deinem Bereich weiterzubilden.

Deine Aufgaben



F√ºr die Gesch√§ftsleitung und das Service Operations F√ºhrungsteam erstellst und pflegst du zeitgerecht wiederkehrende Reports: monatliche Berichte zu unseren KPIs und viertelj√§hrige Quartalsvorhersagen.
Mit den Linienverantwortlichen besprichst du Anforderungen f√ºr neue Reports und Analysen. Du schl√§gst Analysen vor, die zu mehr Insights in unserem Betreib f√ºhren k√∂nnten, z.B. welche Parameter unsere KPIs am meisten beeinflussen.
Du beteiligst dich an das Sammeln und Auswerten von Daten, um firmenweite Business Cases auszuarbeiten.
Innerhalb deines Teams entwickelst du das Operations Reporting Framework weiter: Einerseits optimierst du unsere MS Office-basierte Plattform, andererseits beteiligst du dich an der Planung, um verschiedene dieser Datenquellen in unsere moderne, Cloud-basierte Plattform (MS Azure) zu √ºberf√ºhren.
Du unterst√ºtzt Softwareentwicklungs-Initiativen und sorgst daf√ºr, dass die Analytics Aspekte bei der Definition von funktionalen Anforderungen und der Umsetzung in den Betrieb ber√ºcksichtigt werden.



Dein Profil



Du verf√ºgst √ºber einen Uni/FH-Abschluss vorzugsweise in Data Science, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder Betriebswirtschaft.
Mehrj√§hrige Erfahrungen in einer √§hnlichen Position sowie sehr gute analytische, konzeptionelle und probleml√∂sende F√§higkeiten sind wesentlich.
Sehr gute Systemkenntnisse in MS Excel, MS Power Query und MS PowerPoint, Erfahrung mit SQL sowie die Bereitschaft, um weitere Scripting Sprachen zu lernen (z.B. Python), sind essenziell.
Von Vorteil w√§ren Erfahrung mit MS Power BI und Prozessdefinitions-Tools, z.B. Signavio, MS Visio.
Du sch√§tzt die enge Zusammenarbeit im Team und mit anderen Anspruchsgruppen (Bsp. Linienverantwortliche, Controlling, HR) innerhalb der Firma.
Versiert und stilsicher setzt du Deutsch ein und wendest aktiv deine fundierten Englischkenntnisse an.



Bist du bereit f√ºr deinen n√§chsten Karriereschritt? Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung.

F√ºr diese Position akzeptieren wir ausschliesslich Direktbewerbungen.

Dann haben wir die passende Stelle f√ºr dich. Als Data Analyst:in Operations √ºbernimmst du Verantwortung im Themengebiet Analytics und Reporting. Das Sicherstellen von zeitgerechten und qualitativ hochwertigen F√ºhrungsinformationen geh√∂rt ebenso zu deinem Aufgabengebiet wie das Weiterentwickeln der Reporting Plattform. Es bereitet dir Freude, mit verschiedenen internen und externen Schnittstellen zusammenzuarbeiten, dein berufliches Netzwerk zu nutzen, und dich kontinuierlich in deinem Bereich weiterzubilden.

Deine Aufgaben


  • F√ºr die Gesch√§ftsleitung und das Service Operations F√ºhrungsteam erstellst und pflegst du zeitgerecht wiederkehrende Reports: monatliche Berichte zu unseren KPIs und viertelj√§hrige Quartalsvorhersagen.
  • Mit den Linienverantwortlichen besprichst du Anforderungen f√ºr neue Reports und Analysen. Du schl√§gst Analysen vor, die zu mehr Insights in unserem Betreib f√ºhren k√∂nnten, z.B. welche Parameter unsere KPIs am meisten beeinflussen.
  • Du beteiligst dich an das Sammeln und Auswerten von Daten, um firmenweite Business Cases auszuarbeiten.
  • Innerhalb deines Teams entwickelst du das Operations Reporting Framework weiter: Einerseits optimierst du unsere MS Office-basierte Plattform, andererseits beteiligst du dich an der Planung, um verschiedene dieser Datenquellen in unsere moderne, Cloud-basierte Plattform (MS Azure) zu √ºberf√ºhren.
  • Du unterst√ºtzt Softwareentwicklungs-Initiativen und sorgst daf√ºr, dass die Analytics Aspekte bei der Definition von funktionalen Anforderungen und der Umsetzung in den Betrieb ber√ºcksichtigt werden.


Dein Profil


  • Du verf√ºgst √ºber einen Uni/FH-Abschluss vorzugsweise in Data Science, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder Betriebswirtschaft.
  • Mehrj√§hrige Erfahrungen in einer √§hnlichen Position sowie sehr gute analytische, konzeptionelle und probleml√∂sende F√§higkeiten sind wesentlich.
  • Sehr gute Systemkenntnisse in MS Excel, MS Power Query und MS PowerPoint, Erfahrung mit SQL sowie die Bereitschaft, um weitere Scripting Sprachen zu lernen (z.B. Python), sind essenziell.
  • Von Vorteil w√§ren Erfahrung mit MS Power BI und Prozessdefinitions-Tools, z.B. Signavio, MS Visio.
  • Du sch√§tzt die enge Zusammenarbeit im Team und mit anderen Anspruchsgruppen (Bsp. Linienverantwortliche, Controlling, HR) innerhalb der Firma.
  • Versiert und stilsicher setzt du Deutsch ein und wendest aktiv deine fundierten Englischkenntnisse an.


Bist du bereit f√ºr deinen n√§chsten Karriereschritt? Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung.

F√ºr diese Position akzeptieren wir ausschliesslich Direktbewerbungen.

Title: Competitive Intelligence Analyst I
Description:
If you need assistance during the recruiting process due to a disability, please reach out to our Recruiting Accommodations Team through the Accommodation Request form. This form is used only by individuals with disabilities who require assistance or adjustments in applying and interviewing for a job. This form is not for inquiring about a position or the status of an application.

Competitive Intelligence Analyst I

Are you a true team player looking to evolve in a fast-paced environment that aims at serving actionable insights to a broad set of stakeholders? Are you excited by the thought of working in an industry-leading competitive intelligence team, supporting all lines of business? Then this opportunity is for you!

Your curiosity, ambition and appetite for finding insights in competitor data will have a direct impact on many areas of the business and will translate directly into increased competitiveness and revenue opportunities for Expedia.

What You'll Do

Create information flows to support business execution


Drive data collection, scheduling and quality control to build and enrich datasets of competitive insights
Develop systems and processes to monitor price and supply competitiveness through data sourced from external vendors
Design workflows and define tests to ensure internal stakeholders leverage accurate and relevant data in an efficient manner
Fulfill ad-hoc requests for data and analysis


Solving the Problem and Communicating


Top-class eye for business, analytical rigor, combined with a problem solver mind-set and attention to detail
High level of intellectual curiosity and focus on willing to take action business insights
Excellent understanding of how to effectively visualize highly complex data.
Strong written and oral communication skills
Technically adept


Partner with internal group of customers to support them and understand their business needs


Establish trust and a collaborative working relationship
Provide high level of daily customer service as the team's primary liaison to a large (across many countries) group of customers within Expedia's lodging organization
Partner with internal data teams to identify and resolve data integrity issues


Who You Are


Bachelor's degree is required (MBA or other advanced degree is preferred) in a numerical field (Business, Economics, Statistics or Computer Science)
Any other qualification (e.g. program management) is a plus
Intermediate (or better) knowledge of SQL is required
Experience with a programming language (e.g. Python/R) highly recommended
Ability to convert raw data into impactful reports and insights
Knowledge of data visualization tools preferred (Tableau, Power BI etc.)


About Expedia Group

Expedia Group (NASDAQ: EXPE) powers travel for everyone, everywhere through our global platform. Driven by the core belief that travel is a force for good, we help people experience the world in new ways and build lasting connections. We provide industry-leading technology solutions to fuel partner growth and success, while facilitating memorable experiences for travelers. Expedia Group's family of brands includes: Brand Expedia¬Æ, Hotels.com¬Æ, Expedia¬Æ Partner Solutions, Vrbo¬Æ, trivago¬Æ, Orbitz¬Æ, Travelocity¬Æ, Hotwire¬Æ, Wotif¬Æ, ebookers¬Æ, CheapTickets¬Æ, Expedia Group‚Ñ¢ Media Solutions, Expedia Local Expert¬Æ, CarRentals.com‚Ñ¢, and Expedia Cruises‚Ñ¢.

Never provide sensitive, personal information to someone unless you‚Äôre confident who the recipient is. Expedia Group does not extend job offers via email or any other messaging tools to individuals to whom we have not made prior contact. Our email domain is @expediagroup.com. Title: (Senior) Customer Success Data Analyst
Description:
You want A dynamic and challenging role in a globally recognized and expanding organization? The Opportunity to work with a passionate team dedicated to making a tangible impact on customer experience? This job is for you:

(Senior) Customer Success Data Analyst

Your mission

This role is critical in driving advanced reporting initiatives and optimizing data utilization to enhance customer experiences. The ideal candidate will possess a robust technical background in data analysis and dashboard creation, particularly using tools like Grafana and Data Mesh



Leadership and Initiative:Drive key reporting initiatives within the Customer Success team, demonstrating persistence and leadership to manage projects effectively.
Customer Interaction:Actively participate in customer conversations to gain a deep understanding of their needs and expectations, helping to bring insights directly from the frontline into our strategic decisions.
Data Mesh Utilization:Utilize the data mesh infrastructure to meet the specific needs of Customer Success, ensuring effective use of tools such as Grafana and similar analytics tools.
Dashboard Development:Create and manage standard CS dashboards as well as executive dashboards. Develop specialized dashboards for internal use cases as needed.
Collaboration and Development:Participate in the Big Room Planning (BRP) process for data-related topics, securing buy-in from Development teams and other stakeholders.
Technical Documentation:Support the creation .yaml files and documentation to facilitate understanding and usage of data resources.
UI and Report Development:Develop graphical user interfaces for report generation, focusing on prototyping and using PromQL to write efficient queries.
Optimization: Continuously improve the performance of data queries and systems to enhance reporting speed and accuracy.



Qualifications & Skills



Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Analytics, or a related field.
At least 2-5 years of experience in a reporting or data analyst role within a technology-driven environment.
Proficiency in Grafana, and/or other analytics and visualization tools.
Strong understanding of PromQL and experience in developing user-friendly graphical interfaces for reporting.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with a proven ability to manage complex datasets and extract actionable insights.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with an ability to clearly convey complex data-related concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience working directly with customers to understand and fulfill their data reporting needs.



What we offer:

Want to join a team that enjoys making secure connectivity simple for our customers? You‚Äôll be among people who believe in:

Caring‚ÄØPASSIONATELY‚ÄØabout keeping our customers safe ‚Äì We‚Äôre dedicated to solving problems. Whatever it takes.

Thinking‚ÄØUNCONVENTIONALLY‚ÄØto stay ahead ‚Äì The world never fails to surprise us. So let‚Äôs surprise it first.

Doing the hard work to make things‚ÄØSIMPLE‚ÄØ‚Äì Craft and hone something that delights in its simplicity.

Working‚ÄØCOLLABORATIVELY‚ÄØto build success ‚Äì The power of the team will always make us faster and better.

As a testament to this, Open Systems has been recognised as an outstanding place to work. You‚Äôll be surrounded by smart teams who enrich your experience and provide opportunities you will need to develop your skills and advance your career.‚ÄØ

We look forward to receiving your online application (please note that you need to compress your application into two attachments). Only direct applications will be considered.

About Open Systems

Backed by the Service Experience Promise, Open Systems simply and cost-effectively connects and secures hybrid environments and thus ensures your organization can meet business objectives. Open Systems uniquely focuses on a superior user experience when helping organizations reduce risk, improve efficiency, and accelerate innovation. The Open Systems SASE Experience delivers on the promise of ZTNA with a comprehensive, unified and easy-to-implement and use SASE platform that combines SD-WAN and Security Service Edge delivered as a Service. We provide 24x7 operational management and engineering support from assigned engineering teams and ensure affordable and predictable costs.

Discover more at open-systems.com.

Title: Data Engineer
HTML:
Joining Mirabaud, means entering an entrepreneurial and innovative environment. With the 7th generation of the Mirabaud family working within the bank, the culture is that of a family business. With over 750 employees based in 10 countries worldwide, Mirabaud offers opportunities to develop one‚Äôs career across an international network of 16 offices.

Mirabaud is proud to announce the launching of the largest project since its foundation in 1819, pushing ahead its highly regarded entrepreneurial and passionate team to the next level of client servicing thanks to the adoption of enhanced digital front and back-office capabilities. To support this ambitious digital transformation and migration to the cloud, our Data Hub, Reporting & MIS team is looking to add:

Job Description

A day in your future job:

  • Work with IT Application owners and Business Analysts to capture and define data Hub requirements;
  • Actively participates with our Data Architect in the functional and technical target solution;
  • Participate in the construction and evolution of our Data Hub (pySpark, Azure Synapse);
  • Participate in providing or extracting data from the Data Hub for various consumers (Client and Regulatory Reporting, etc.);
  • Respect the instructions and standards in place, design, perform and execute unit tests;
  • Organize and deliver trainings to the Application support team members;

Qualifications

Your assets to succeed:

  • Minimum 5 years of experience as a Data Engineer;
  • Degree in computer engineering or related field;
  • Very good knowledge of pySpark, Microsoft Azure Cloud and Synapse;
  • Knowledge of Wealth Management sector, an asset;
  • Knowledge of PureView and PowerApps, an asset;
  • Fluent in French and good command of English;
  • Creative, problem solver and team player with great adaptability skills;

Additional Information

Jump on the boat!

  • Family-friendly and dynamic environment;
  • Direct impact on the business, no matter your position or seniority;
  • Work in an environment that encourages autonomy and entrepreneurship;
  • Flexible working arrangements to help you achieve a better work-life balance;
  • Variety of cultural and sporting activities during your free time;
  • Inclusion and equal treatment;
  • Various employee benefits & family friendly benefits.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
What To Expect
Tesla is looking to hire an enthusiastic and experienced Data Engineer to help drive business decisions by using the power of data. The Data Engineer will join the EMEA Business Analytics Team based in Cham, Switzerland. As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for building, developing and maintain the data infrastructure and pipeline for delivering advanced analytical solutions and data products. This role is critical for shaping our data strategy and supporting data-driven decision making across the organization.

What You'll Do


Collaborate with the data team to develop business intelligence (BI) data products, empowering and accelerating business processes
Set up and maintain infrastructure for data science use cases, including ELT pipelines, machine learning models, and app deployment, using various open-source tools. As part of this role, you‚Äôll also act as a half-platform engineer
Work closely with BI, IT, and data engineering peers to identify optimal solutions on private cloud
Design, develop, and curate data pipelines to maintain reliable and well-curated data sources, enhancing productivity
Bring best practices to the entire lifecycle of data products, from development and testing to deployment and ongoing maintenance
Develop a deep understanding of data based on business acumen, collaborating closely with data scientists, business analysts, and business stakeholders
Communicate technical and business topics effectively, using written, verbal, and presentation materials as needed



What You'll Bring


Experience in creating data pipelines using SQL and Python, with a strong proficiency in both
Familiarity with Linux, Kubernetes, Airflow, and CI/CD pipelines
Knowledge of best practices for database design within relational databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, Vertica)
Experience with Mlflow and Kubeflow is a plus
Exposure to data products, including dashboards and machine learning models
Strong problem-solving skills and a proactive attitude, capable of finding solutions with minimal guidance
A team player with a growth mindset, possessing excellent analytical, organizational, and communication skills. You‚Äôll be able to deliver on tight deadlines in alignment with business requirements



, Tesla

Title: Data Analyst Internal Audit
Description:
coni + partner, established 1993, is a consultancy company with headquarter in Zurich and subsidiaries in D√ºsseldorf and Shanghai. We are specialised in custom-fit staffing in tune with the corporate culture by ensuring a perfect match of professional skills, references and personal as well as social skills of successful candidates.

Our client is an international Bank in Zurich. We are searching for an internal auditor (m, f, d) with a flair for data science as

Data Analyst Internal Audit

Tasks

Developing data analytics capability within the Audit function / Developing and extracting knowledge from internal data sets by applying various descriptive and predictive analytics techniques / Together with the team designing rich data visualization to communicate complex insights / Driving the Audit database and building views to enable analytical investigation / Writing software to clean and investigate large data sets of numerical and textual data and driving the automation process / Working on local and global audit projects with strategic impact and high visibility / Interacting with the Group Internal Audit team and gaining banking knowledge first-hand through analysis of data supporting key Bank‚Äôs processes / Contributing to the Data Science community in the Bank building knowledge network & become known for your skills.

Requirements

Master studies / Experienced in auditing and quantitative analysis or data science / Responsibility to deal with critical and confidential data / Expertise in text mining and natural language processing / Experienced with data analytics in risk management or audit / Ability, with ease to assemble data sets from disparate sources and analyze using appropriate quantitative methodologies, computational frameworks and systems / Experience in data visualization / Experience in developing and maintaining complex ETL flows and pipelines, using clear, efficient and tested code / Development experience using multiple programming languages and tools (including one or more of Python, R, Spark, SAS, Handoop) / SQL proficiency / Proactive personality / Analytical, critical and strategic mindset / High-level of confidentiality / Integrity /Communication skills in English and German.

Title: Power BI Specialist
Description:
60-100%, Lausanne and home office

As a Power BI Specialist, you enrich our team and take our data analysis and visualization skills to the next level. You are responsible for the design, development and optimization of Power BI solutions and enable employees to work with Power BI.

How You Make a Difference


You are responsible for the development and stability of the Power BI platform, for defining the framework conditions and ensuring compliance with processes and governance guidelines.
As the driving force, you work with the Self-service team to steer Swiss Post's transformation into a data-driven organization and empower staff through training and learning paths.
You contribute your expert knowledge in business analysis, consulting and implementation of complex requirements for customers, and optimize Power BI reports and dashboards to ensure smooth performance.
You liaise with various stakeholders and simplify processes, ensuring greater efficiency.
Your tasks involve working closely with data scientists and data engineers, as well as mentoring internal and external staff.
You promote exchange of knowledge within the team and ensure that Support requests are processed efficiently.



What You Have To Offer


You have a university degree in informatics or business informatics.
You have practical knowledge of Power BI, including data integration, dashboard creation and DAX calculations.
You are able to create complex data models and transform data from multiple sources.
Additional knowledge of other BI tools such as SAP Analytics Cloud, Tableau and SAP Datasphere round off your profile.
You have an excellent spoken and written command of German and English. Any other national language is an advantage.



If you are an enthusiastic data expert and have the skills listed above, we look forward to receiving your application!

What We Have To Offer


6 weeks' holiday
Parental Leave
Mobile and flexible working
Fair employment conditions
Half Fare Travelcard or contribution towards GA
Support with basic and advanced training
Staff vouchers



Contact

Jan Locher Head of Business Intelligence

+41 76 367 90 16

Annual gross salary at 100%

CHF 98'000 - 118'000 Effective salary may differ from this salary range depending on experience and skills

Swiss Post unit

IT/Technology

As the driving force behind digitization, the Informatics/Technology function unit has an influence on the whole of Swiss Post and is an important partner in its success. We go beyond core IT tasks and empower the company in its digital transformation. We use the latest technologies and work to advance agile, bimodal and embedded IT innovations. We develop new, secure business models and ensure that Swiss Post has a modern, high-performing ICT infrastructure. In addition, we are committed to the issue of sustainability: our headquarters in Bern have been awarded two certificates for sustainability. All newly built logistics centers meet the Gold sustainability standard at a minimum.

Business Intelligence Analyst, S√£o Paulo - Cloudkitchens

Who We Are

CloudKitchens helps restaurateurs around the world succeed in online food delivery - our goal is to make food more affordable, higher quality, and convenient for everyone.

We take underutilized properties and transform them into smart kitchens so they can better serve restaurateurs, customers, and the neighborhoods they‚Äôre in. Every time we launch a new facility we create jobs in that neighborhood, and we‚Äôre proud to provide a wide range of cuisines and options for healthy food at an affordable price.

We're changing the game for restaurateurs whether they‚Äôre entrepreneurs opening their first restaurant all the way through to your favorite global quick-service restaurant chains.

What You‚Äôll Do


Develop and maintain sales analytics reports and dashboards to provide actionable insights that support data-driven decision-making for the sales leaders
Build and maintain reports, dashboards, and visualization to track key performance metrics and drive business decisions using SQL, Looker, Tableau, or other BI solutions.
Proactively monitor the quality and integrity of supporting sales data and highlight improvement opportunities.
Perform deep dive analysis of operating metrics providing business insights to leadership by understanding the situation, developing a hypothesis, analyzing data, and reporting back findings/solutions.
Effectively communicate analysis results to business leaders for decision-making and prioritization
Work with business leaders on implementing sales activities as needed with some oversight.


What We‚Äôre Looking For


Great communication skills.
Advanced English.
Data Analytics
Project management experience preferred.
SQL & Python


Why join us


Growing market: You‚Äôll be focused on an $80 billion market that‚Äôs projected to reach at least $500 billion by 2030 in the US alone.
Changing the restaurant industry: You‚Äôll be part of a team that helps restaurants succeed in online food delivery.
Collaborative environment: You will receive support and guidance from experienced colleagues and managers, helping you to learn, grow and achieve your goals, and you‚Äôll work closely with other teams to ensure our customer‚Äôs success.


What Else You Need To Know

This role is based in our S√£o Paulo office location. We believe that people do their best work when they are together. As a company, we‚Äôre in the marketplace of ideas and innovation. When you‚Äôre constantly innovating, changing how an industry works, inventing new products and processes - and we are doing all these things - we believe we‚Äôre better as a team in-person. That‚Äôs why all of our teams (except for our field-based roles) are now working from one of our office locations 5 days a week. Looking forward to sharing more about a Career of Substance at Cloudkitchens.

Ready to join us as we serve those who serve others?
